original: de'i phyir / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúconditioned and unconditioned.

original: thams cad kyi tha mar bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi tha mar bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äù Because it is explained at the end of all.

original: de la 'dus byas ni btags pa dang bcas shing rgyu dang bcas pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de la 'dus byas ni btags pa dang bcas shing rgyu dang bcas pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Among them, the conditioned is established by the characteristics of being imputed and having causes.

original: 'dus ma byas ni don dang bcas pa'i rab tu zhi bas rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni don dang bcas pa'i rab tu zhi bas rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The unconditioned is established by the pacification of the meaning of being imputed and having causes.

original: btags pa dang rgyu dang rgyu mtshan yang mi shes nas de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: btags pa dang rgyu dang rgyu mtshan yang mi shes nas de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Since the collection of names, etc., are not known, in order to teach them, he says,

original: de la btags pa ni ming gi tshogs la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de la btags pa ni ming gi tshogs la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúAmong them, the imputed is the collection of names, etc.‚Äù

original: ming dang tshig gi tshogs kyi dngos po dag gi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par gnyis btags pas na @268a * //
analyzed: ming dang tshig gi tshogs kyi dngos po dag gi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par gnyis btags pas na @268a * //
translated: The two, the nature and the distinction of the entities of the collection of names and the collection of phrases, are imputed.

original: ming dang tshig gi tshogs gnyis ni btags pa'o //
analyzed: ming dang tshig gi tshogs gnyis ni btags pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the two, the collection of names and the collection of phrases, are the imputed.

original: yi ge'i tshogs ni de gnyi ga gsal bar byed pa'i phyir btags pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge'i tshogs ni de gnyi ga gsal bar byed pa'i phyir btags pa'o //
translated: The collection of letters is the imputed because it illuminates those two.

original: rgyu ni sa bon du bsdus pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba de yang zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad kyi bag chags kyi rjes su song ba 'bras bu ma byin pa kun 'byung ba'i bden par bsdus pa nyid de /üîΩ'bras bu byin pa las rnam par dbye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu ni sa bon du bsdus pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba de yang zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad kyi bag chags kyi rjes su song ba 'bras bu ma byin pa kun 'byung ba'i bden par bsdus pa nyid de / 'bras bu byin pa las rnam par dbye ba'i phyir /
translated: The cause is the store consciousness, which is included in the seeds. It is the store consciousness that is affected by the residues of all afflicted phenomena. It is included in the truth of the origin of suffering because it has not yet yielded its fruit.

original: sa bon du bsdus pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sa bon du bsdus pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to distinguish it from the fruit that it has yielded, it is said to be ‚Äúincluded in the seeds.‚ÄùüîΩThe objective condition is included in the realm of appearances, the realm of embodiment, and the realm of experience. The realm of appearances refers to the store consciousness.

original: rgyu mtshan ni gnas dang lus dang longs spyod du bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ni gnas dang lus dang longs spyod du bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The realm of embodiment refers to the store consciousness that appears as a body.üîΩThe realm of experience refers to the store consciousness that appears as the world.

original: 'jug pa ni rnam par shes par bsdus pa yid dang 'dzin pa dang rnam par rtog par bsdus pa'o zhes bya ba de la gnas ni snod kyi 'jig rten te /üîΩder snang ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni rnam par shes par bsdus pa yid dang 'dzin pa dang rnam par rtog par bsdus pa'o zhes bya ba de la gnas ni snod kyi 'jig rten te / der snang ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The actualizing consciousness is included in the consciousnesses, the mental activities of apprehension, and the mental activities of conceptualization.

original: gnas kyi bdag nyid du bsdus pas na gnas su bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gnas kyi bdag nyid du bsdus pas na gnas su bsdus pa'o //
translated: The realm of appearances refers to the world that is the container for living beings.üîΩThe realm of embodiment refers to the five sense organs that are the support for the five kinds of sense consciousness.üîΩThe realm of experience refers to the five sense objects that are the objects of the five kinds of sense consciousness.

original: lus su snang ba'i rang bzhin la lus su bsdus pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus su snang ba'i rang bzhin la lus su bsdus pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The nature of the appearance as a body is called ‚Äúincluded in the body.‚Äù

original: lus ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i khog pa lus der snang ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: lus ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i khog pa lus der snang ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The body is the body-sense-center together with the sense-faculty. The store-consciousness appearing as that body is the body.

original: lus su bsdus pa ni lus kyi bdag nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lus su bsdus pa ni lus kyi bdag nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúIncluded in the body‚Äù means having the nature of the body.

original: longs spyod du bsdus pa ni gong du bshad pa de nyid de /
analyzed: longs spyod du bsdus pa ni gong du bshad pa de nyid de /
translated: The inclusion in enjoyment is just what was explained above.

original: de gnyis la yang rnam par shes pa gzhan dag dbang byed pa'i dngos por longs spyod pas na longs spyod do //
analyzed: de gnyis la yang rnam par shes pa gzhan dag dbang byed pa'i dngos por longs spyod pas na longs spyod do //
translated: Also, in those two, the other consciousnesses are enjoyed as the thing that dominates, so they are enjoyment.

original: yang na bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'i don la longs spyod pas na longs spyod de /
analyzed: yang na bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'i don la longs spyod pas na longs spyod de /
translated: Or else, enjoyment is the enjoyment of the object such as food and drink.

original: der snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ni longs spyod du bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: der snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ni longs spyod du bsdus pa'o //
translated: The consciousness appearing as that is included in enjoyment.

original: btags pa dang bcas shing rgyu dang bcas pa'i rgyu mtshan de ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo bsdus pa'i phyir 'dus byas su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: btags pa dang bcas shing rgyu dang bcas pa'i rgyu mtshan de ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo bsdus pa'i phyir 'dus byas su rig par bya'o //
translated: That which is characterized as having a designation and having a cause should be known as conditioned because it includes the essential nature of the other-dependent that is associated with something.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa ni sems las byung ba ste /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa ni sems las byung ba ste /
translated: That which is associated is the mental factors.

original: 'dus byas de ni de nyid 'ba' zhig ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dus byas de ni de nyid 'ba' zhig ma yin par bstan to //
translated: That conditioned is taught to be not just that alone.

original: de yang gang gi rgyu mtshan zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang gi rgyu mtshan zhe na /
translated: And what is its cause?

original: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan te /
analyzed: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan te /
translated: It is the cause of the collection of names, etc.

original: de ni de dag gi ngo bo nyid dang khyad par rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de dag gi ngo bo nyid dang khyad par rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because it expresses the essential nature and the distinctions of those.

original: de dag gi rjes su 'brang bas rang bzhen dang bye brag la mngon par zhen pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba yid dang 'dzin pa dang rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba rnams kyi rgyu mtshan @268b yang yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi rjes su 'brang bas rang bzhen dang bye brag la mngon par zhen pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba yid dang 'dzin pa dang rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba rnams kyi rgyu mtshan @268b yang yin no //
translated: It is also the cause of the mind and mental factors that follow after those, which are called the intellect, apprehension, and discursive thought, because of their adherence to the essential nature and distinctions.

original: kha cig na re yid dang 'dzin pa dang rnam par rtog pa yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu mtshan te /
analyzed: kha cig na re yid dang 'dzin pa dang rnam par rtog pa yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu mtshan te /
translated: Some say: The mind, apprehending, and discrimination are the causal signs of the store consciousness,

original: de la bag chags brtas par byed pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: de la bag chags brtas par byed pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: because the latent impressions are strengthened in it.

original: gzhan dag ni rang bzhin bye brag tu 'dogs pas na 'dogs pa'i mtshan ma ni 'du shes te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rang bzhin bye brag tu 'dogs pas na 'dogs pa'i mtshan ma ni 'du shes te /
translated: Others say: Discriminative constructions are the signs of designation because they designate the intrinsic natures of things.

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they have the nature of apprehending signs.

original: gnas dang lus dang longs spyod du bsdus pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni bag chags brtas par byed pa'i phyir gzhi'i rgyu mtshan no //üîΩyid dang 'dzin pa dang rnam par rtog pa rnams ni dmigs pa mtshan mar byed pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan yang yin la /
analyzed: gnas dang lus dang longs spyod du bsdus pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni bag chags brtas par byed pa'i phyir gzhi'i rgyu mtshan no // yid dang 'dzin pa dang rnam par rtog pa rnams ni dmigs pa mtshan mar byed pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan yang yin la /
translated: The store consciousness, which is included in the bases, bodies, and enjoyments, is the causal sign of the basis because the latent impressions are strengthened in it.üîΩThe mind, apprehending, and discrimination are the causal signs of the objective realm because they make the objective realm into a sign.

original: gnyi ga mtshan mar byed pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang / dmigs par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yang yin no snyam du sems so //
analyzed: gnyi ga mtshan mar byed pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang / dmigs par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yang yin no snyam du sems so //
translated: They are also the causal signs of the objective realm and the agent that objectifies because they both make the objective realm into a sign.

original: de la yid la gang rtag ru rlom sems pa'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la yid la gang rtag ru rlom sems pa'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The nature of the mind is the aspect of the imagination of what is unreal.

original: bdag gam bdag gi zhes bya ba gang rtag par rlom sems pa de ni yid ces bya ste /üîΩde ni bdag tu rmongs pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag la chags pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / kun du 'gro ba lnga po tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang /
analyzed: bdag gam bdag gi zhes bya ba gang rtag par rlom sems pa de ni yid ces bya ste / de ni bdag tu rmongs pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag la chags pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / kun du 'gro ba lnga po tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang /
translated: The mind is that which constantly imagines ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: yid la byed pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: yid la byed pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: It is associated with five universal mental factors: delusion about self, view of self, attachment to self, pride in self, and the five omnipresent mental factors: feeling, discrimination, intention, contact, and mental activity.üîΩGrasping is the five collections of consciousness.

original: 'dzin pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po zhes bya ba ni yul gyi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po zhes bya ba ni yul gyi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: They are called ‚Äúgrasping‚Äù because they have the characteristic of grasping the nature of objects.

original: rang rig pa yin pas brjod mi nus pa'i phyir 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa yin pas brjod mi nus pa'i phyir 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúgrasping‚Äù because they are self-knowing and self-illuminating.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Imagination is the mental consciousness.

original: de ni chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la rnam par rtog pa can gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la rnam par rtog pa can gyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the conceptualization of the general and specific characteristics of phenomena.

original: btags pa dang bcas shing rgyu dang bcas pa'i rgyu mtshan 'di las nyon mongs pa gnyis kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa'i phyir 'dus byas so //
analyzed: btags pa dang bcas shing rgyu dang bcas pa'i rgyu mtshan 'di las nyon mongs pa gnyis kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa'i phyir 'dus byas so //
translated: The conditioned is so called because it is the object of the two defilements, namely, the conceptual differentiation of the apprehended object and apprehending subject and the latent impressions of moral defilement.

original: 'dus ma byas ni rab tu zhi ba'i 'gog pa dang rab tu zhi ba'i don de bzhin nyid de bzhin nyid de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni rab tu zhi ba'i 'gog pa dang rab tu zhi ba'i don de bzhin nyid de bzhin nyid de zhes bya ba la /
translated: The unconditioned is the cessation that is peace and the reality that is peace.

original: rgyu dang bcas pa'i sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir 'gog pa ni rab tu zhi ba'i bar rung na /
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa'i sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir 'gog pa ni rab tu zhi ba'i bar rung na /
translated: Since cessation is characterized by the pacification of suffering together with its causes, it is tenable that it is peace.

original: de bzhin nyid ji ltar rab tu zhi ba'i don ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ji ltar rab tu zhi ba'i don ces bya zhe na /
translated: But how can reality be described as the object of peace?

original: rab tu zhi ba'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the object of peace.

original: 'gog pa dang de bzhin nyid gnyis 'brel pa ci yang med pa snyam na /
analyzed: 'gog pa dang de bzhin nyid gnyis 'brel pa ci yang med pa snyam na /
translated: If there is no connection between cessation and reality,

original: ji ltar rab tu zhi ba'i don zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rab tu zhi ba'i don zhes bya zhe na /
translated: how can reality be described as the object of peace?

original: @269a * // de bzhin nyid ni lam gyi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @269a * // de bzhin nyid ni lam gyi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Suchness is the objective support of the path.

original: ji ltar na lam yang rab tu zhi ba nyid ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na lam yang rab tu zhi ba nyid ces bya zhe na /
translated: How is the path also described as peace?

original: des rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it causes peace.

original: rab tu zhi ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni rab tu zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni rab tu zhi ba'o //
translated: Nirvana is peace because it is peaceful.

original: 'dis rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i phyir lam yang rab tu zhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i phyir lam yang rab tu zhi ba'o //
translated: The path is peace because it causes peace.

original: de ltar na tshig rnam par sbyar ba tha dad pa'i phyir brjod pa gcig gis mya ngan las 'das pa dang lam gnyi ga rab tu zhi ba zhes bya bar bzung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na tshig rnam par sbyar ba tha dad pa'i phyir brjod pa gcig gis mya ngan las 'das pa dang lam gnyi ga rab tu zhi ba zhes bya bar bzung ngo //
translated: Thus, because the verbal expression is different, both nirvana and the path are understood to be called ‚Äúpeace‚Äù by a single statement.

original: ci lam gyi bden pa 'dus byas sam 'on te 'dus ma byas she na /
analyzed: ci lam gyi bden pa 'dus byas sam 'on te 'dus ma byas she na /
translated: Is the truth of the path conditioned or unconditioned?

original: bskyed par bya ba yin pas 'dus byas so //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba yin pas 'dus byas so //
translated: It is conditioned because it is to be generated.

original: gal te las dang nyon mongs pas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas zhes brjod na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gal te las dang nyon mongs pas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas zhes brjod na nyes pa med do //
translated: If it is said that it is unconditioned because it is not directly conditioned by karma and moral defilement and it is distinguished by the unconditioned, there is no fault.

original: de ltar don 'dis phung po la sogs pa shes pa ni phung po la sogs pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /üîΩthog ma du ma nyid dang ni //
analyzed: de ltar don 'dis phung po la sogs pa shes pa ni phung po la sogs pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni / thog ma du ma nyid dang ni //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that knowledge of the aggregates, etc. is skill in the aggregates, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the summary

original: bsdus dang yongs su phye ba'i don //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsdus dang yongs su phye ba'i don // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: is stated in terms of the manifold, the ultimate,üîΩand the summary of the ultimate.

original: rgyas par thams cad la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par thams cad la brjod par bya'o //
translated: The manifold is to be stated in full for all.

original: de kho na'i don bsdus pa ni mdor bsdu na de kho na rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de kho na'i don bsdus pa ni mdor bsdu na de kho na rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The summary of the ultimate is, in brief, the twofold reality.

original: rgyas par ni rnam pa bcur bshad do //
analyzed: rgyas par ni rnam pa bcur bshad do //
translated: In full, it is explained as tenfold.

original: de bas na mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de bas na mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚ÄúIn brief, it is twofold.‚Äù

original: rnam pa gnyis po ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis po ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the two aspects?

original: me long lta bu'i de kho na dang / snang ba'i de kho na'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i de kho na dang / snang ba'i de kho na'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúThe reality of the mirror and the reality of appearance.‚Äù

original: de la rtsa ba'i de kho na de ni me long lta bu'i de kho na ste /
analyzed: de la rtsa ba'i de kho na de ni me long lta bu'i de kho na ste /
translated: The basic reality is the reality of the mirror.

original: de yang ngo bo nyid gsum mo //
analyzed: de yang ngo bo nyid gsum mo //
translated: And that is the threefold nature.

original: ci'i phyir de la me long lta bu'i de kho na zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de la me long lta bu'i de kho na zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the reality of the mirror?

original: mtshan nyid kyi de kho na la sogs pa lhag ma rnams der snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi de kho na la sogs pa lhag ma rnams der snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the remaining realities such as the reality of characteristic appear therein.

original: snang ba'i de kho na ni mtshan nyid kyi de kho na la sogs pa sngar bstan pa rnam pa dgu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba'i de kho na ni mtshan nyid kyi de kho na la sogs pa sngar bstan pa rnam pa dgu gang yin pa'o //
translated: The reality of appearance is the nine aspects of reality previously mentioned, beginning with the reality of characteristic.

original: ci'i phyir de dag snang ba'i de kho na zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag snang ba'i de kho na zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called the reality of appearance?

original: rtsa ba'i de kho na la snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i de kho na la snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they appear in the fundamental reality.

original: nga rgyal med pa snang ba'i de kho na ni mtshan nyid kyi de kho na ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal med pa snang ba'i de kho na ni mtshan nyid kyi de kho na ste /
translated: The reality of appearance that is free of pride is the reality of characteristic.

original: gang zag dang / chos dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa la sgro mi 'dogs pa dang / skur pa mi 'debs pa'i phyir des nga rgyal med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag dang / chos dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa la sgro mi 'dogs pa dang / skur pa mi 'debs pa'i phyir des nga rgyal med par 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes free of pride because of the absence of the superimposition of the self of the person and of phenomena, of the apprehended and the apprehender, of entity and non-entity.

original: phyin ci log gi gnyen po snang ba'i de kho na ni phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi gnyen po snang ba'i de kho na ni phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The reality of appearance that is the antidote to error is the reality of the absence of error.

original: de ni @269b rtag pa la sogs par phyin ci log gi gnyen por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ni @269b rtag pa la sogs par phyin ci log gi gnyen por gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the antidote to the error of permanence, etc.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pas nges par 'byung ba snang ba'i de kho na ni 'bras bu dang rgyu'i de kho na ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pas nges par 'byung ba snang ba'i de kho na ni 'bras bu dang rgyu'i de kho na ste /
translated: The reality of the appearance of the vehicle of listeners is the reality of result and cause.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rab tu rtogs shing bsgoms pas nyan thos nges par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rab tu rtogs shing bsgoms pas nyan thos nges par 'byung ngo //
translated: The listeners are liberated by fully understanding and cultivating the four noble truths.

original: theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung ba snang ba'i de kho na ni phra ba dang rags pa'i de kho na ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung ba snang ba'i de kho na ni phra ba dang rags pa'i de kho na ste /
translated: The reality of the appearance of the vehicle of the great vehicle is the reality of the subtle and the gross.

original: rags pa kun rdzob kyi bden pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa dang / phra ba don dam pa'i bden pas rnam par grol bar byed pa'i phyir theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rags pa kun rdzob kyi bden pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa dang / phra ba don dam pa'i bden pas rnam par grol bar byed pa'i phyir theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The great vehicle is the liberation of sentient beings by the gross, conventional truth, and the liberation by the subtle, ultimate truth.

original: phas kyi rgol ba tshar gcod pa snang ba'i de kho na ni grags pa'i de kho na'o //
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba tshar gcod pa snang ba'i de kho na ni grags pa'i de kho na'o //
translated: The reality of the appearance of the defeat of adversaries is the reality of fame.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de'i phyir / dpe la brten te rigs pas tshar gcod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / dpe la brten te rigs pas tshar gcod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause of the defeat by reasoning based on examples.‚Äù

original: tshar gcod pa la dpe ni 'jig rten du grags pa'o //
analyzed: tshar gcod pa la dpe ni 'jig rten du grags pa'o //
translated: The example of defeat is famous in the world.

original: rigs pa ni rigs pas rab tu grub pa la brten pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ni rigs pas rab tu grub pa la brten pa'o //
translated: Reason is based on what is well established by reasoning.

original: theg pa chen po mngon par brjod pa snang ba'i de kho na ni rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi de kho na ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po mngon par brjod pa snang ba'i de kho na ni rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi de kho na ste /
translated: The reality of the appearance of the expression of the Great Vehicle is the reality that is the domain of pure intuition.

original: des ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi lung gzhan mngon par brjod pa ste /
analyzed: des ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi lung gzhan mngon par brjod pa ste /
translated: By it, the domain of intuition that is pure of the obscurations of the afflictions and the knowable is expressed in other scriptures.

original: de ni theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: de ni theg pa chen po'o //
translated: That is the Great Vehicle.

original: shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad la 'jug pa snang ba'i de kho na la bsdu ba'i de kho na dngos po lnga ste /
analyzed: shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad la 'jug pa snang ba'i de kho na la bsdu ba'i de kho na dngos po lnga ste /
translated: The reality of the appearance of the engagement in all aspects of the knowable is the reality of inclusion, which is five things.

original: de ni shes par bya ba thams cad la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //üîΩma nor ba de bzhin nyid mngon par brjod pa snang ba'i de kho na ni rab tu dbye ba'i de kho na ste /
analyzed: de ni shes par bya ba thams cad la 'jug pa'i phyir ro // ma nor ba de bzhin nyid mngon par brjod pa snang ba'i de kho na ni rab tu dbye ba'i de kho na ste /
translated: It is because it engages all that is to be known.üîΩThe reality of the appearance of the expression of nonerroneous suchness is the reality of differentiation.

original: des dngos po rnams kyi ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des dngos po rnams kyi ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By it, the nonerroneous suchness and the undifferentiated suchness of things are expressed.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi la dgongs pa thams cad rtogs par snang ba'i de kho na zhes bya ba ni mkhas pa'i de kho na ste /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi la dgongs pa thams cad rtogs par snang ba'i de kho na zhes bya ba ni mkhas pa'i de kho na ste /
translated: The ‚Äúreality‚Äù called the knowledge of all the intentions of the basis of self-habits is the reality of the expert.

original: des bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi la dgongs pa thams cad kyi sgo nas rtogs te /
analyzed: des bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi la dgongs pa thams cad kyi sgo nas rtogs te /
translated: By it, one knows all the intentions of the basis of self-habits.

original: bsam pa bcu po dag gis phung po la sogs pa la bdag tu 'dzin pa 'jug par sngar ji skad du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa bcu po dag gis phung po la sogs pa la bdag tu 'dzin pa 'jug par sngar ji skad du bstan pa'o //
translated: As was previously explained, the ten thoughts operate in the self-habits of the aggregates, etc.

original: de kho na'i don bsdus pa smos pa ni bde blag tu 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de kho na'i don bsdus pa smos pa ni bde blag tu 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The summary of the meaning of reality is mentioned for easy retention,

original: don gyis tshig 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyis tshig 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it draws the words into the meaning.

original: rmongs pa med pa dang yongs su skyo ba yang med par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rmongs pa med pa dang yongs su skyo ba yang med par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is for the purpose of avoiding both confusion and complete discouragement.

original: skabs kyi mgo mjug yongs @270a * //
analyzed: skabs kyi mgo mjug yongs @270a * //
translated: When one sees the beginning and end of the topic,

original: su mthong na yongs su skyo ba mi skye'o //
analyzed: su mthong na yongs su skyo ba mi skye'o //
translated: one does not become completely discouraged.

original: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad pa rtogs pas rmongs pa yang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad pa rtogs pas rmongs pa yang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: And when one understands the explanation according to the teaching, one does not become confused.

original: de kho na bshad zin to //
analyzed: de kho na bshad zin to //
translated: Reality has been explained.

original: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las de kho na'i le'ur bcad pa ste gsum pa'i 'grel bshad do /
analyzed: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las de kho na'i le'ur bcad pa ste gsum pa'i 'grel bshad do /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the third chapter of the root text, which is an investigation of reality.

original: // / de kho na bshad pa'i 'og tu gnyen po bsgom pa dang / de'i gnas dang 'bras bu thob pa bshad dgos te /
analyzed: // / de kho na bshad pa'i 'og tu gnyen po bsgom pa dang / de'i gnas dang 'bras bu thob pa bshad dgos te /

analyzed: de bas na de bstan pa'i phyir le'ur bcad pa bzhi pa brtsams so //

analyzed: de kho na'i 'og tu bstan pa dang gnyen po bsgom pa la rag lus pa'i phyir de'i gnas dang 'bras bu thob pa gnyis kyang smos so //
translated: After reality, the two, the basis of that and the attainment of the result, are also mentioned because they depend on the teaching and the cultivation of the antidotes.

analyzed: bstan pa'i mdor byas pa las gnyen po ni byang chub kyi phyogs su bzhed par bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: gnyen po bsgom pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa ste zhes bya ba smos so //

analyzed: de dag bsgoms na mi mthun pa'i phyogs sgrib pa ji skad bstan pa rnams spang bar bya ba la mthu yod par 'gyur bas gnyen po rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they are cultivated, they are called antidotes because they have the power to abandon the discards that are their counter corollaries, the obscurations taught above.

original: de rnams kyang sum cu rtsa bdun te /
analyzed: de rnams kyang sum cu rtsa bdun te /

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar du'o //

analyzed: de rnams bsgom pa ni spel ba dang / bskyed pa dang / goms par bya ba dang / lan mang du bya ba zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs so //

analyzed: de yang de kho na'o 'og tu bstan pa'i phyir de yang brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs bsgoms pa la ci'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa nyid thog mar bshad kyi gzhan ni ma yin zhe na /

original: de la re zhig dang por /
analyzed: de la re zhig dang por /
translated: First,

original: gnas ngan len phyir sred rgyu'i phyir //
analyzed: gnas ngan len phyir sred rgyu'i phyir //

original: zhes rgya cher smos so //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher smos so //

original: de la zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs bsgoms pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs bsgoms pa la'o //
translated: Here refers to the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment.

original: re zhig ces bya ba ni rim gyi don te /
analyzed: re zhig ces bya ba ni rim gyi don te /

original: thog mar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa ji bshad la /
analyzed: thog mar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa ji bshad la /

original: gzhan yang phyis bshad do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang phyis bshad do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Later, one cultivates the other factors of enlightenment.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'khor ba gnyis kyi yon tan dang nyes pa mo rtogs pa'i phyir 'du byed rnams la bde ba dang gtsang ba dang rtag pa dang bdag tu mngon par zhen pas byis pa rnams srid pa dang longs spyod la mngon par dga' zhing
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'khor ba gnyis kyi yon tan dang nyes pa mo rtogs pa'i phyir 'du byed rnams la bde ba dang gtsang ba dang rtag pa dang bdag tu mngon par zhen pas byis pa rnams srid pa dang longs spyod la mngon par dga' zhing
translated: Because childish beings do not understand the good qualities and faults of nirvana and samsara, they cling to conditioned phenomena as blissful, pure, permanent, and having a self, and delight in existence and enjoyments.

original: mya ngan las 'das pas skrag go //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pas skrag go //
translated: They fear nirvana.

original: yon tan dang nyes pa ma rtogs pa dang / bde ba la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa de @270b yang bden pa mthong nas ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yon tan dang nyes pa ma rtogs pa dang / bde ba la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa de @270b yang bden pa mthong nas ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: However, when they see the truths, that misunderstanding and clinging to bliss and so on is reversed.

original: de'i phyir 'khor ba la skyo bar bya ba'i don dang / mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du bya ba'i don du bden pa bzhi la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa nyid thog mar bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor ba la skyo bar bya ba'i don dang / mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du bya ba'i don du bden pa bzhi la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa nyid thog mar bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the cultivation of the applications of mindfulness is explained first in order to engage the four noble truths for the purpose of becoming disenchanted with sa·πÉsƒÅra and for the purpose of manifesting nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: lus kyis ni gnas ngan len rab tu ston zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus kyis ni gnas ngan len rab tu ston zhes bya ba la /
translated: The body manifests the negative reflex actions.

original: gnas ngan len ni ngan par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gnas ngan len ni ngan par gnas pa ste /

analyzed: 'di ltar nyin gcig bzhin mngon par 'dus byas kyang lus 'gyur ba nyid pas lus kyis ni gnas ngan len rab tu ston to //

analyzed: de'i phyir lus la yongs su brtags pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug go //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni gnas ngan len dang bcas pa'i 'du byed yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid ni gnas ngan len dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid ni gnas ngan len dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams yin la /
translated: Thus, the reality of the truth of suffering is the formations together with the negative reflex actions.

original: lus kyis kyang gnas ngan len du rab tu ston pas /
analyzed: lus kyis kyang gnas ngan len du rab tu ston pas /
translated: And the body is also shown to be a negative reflex action.

original: de'i phyir lus la yongs su brtags pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus la yongs su brtags pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, one enters into the truth of suffering by thoroughly investigating the body.

original: gnas ngan len mi shes pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas ngan len mi shes pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since one does not understand the negative reflex actions,

analyzed: gnas ngan len ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid de zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe negative reflex actions are the suffering of the formations.‚Äù

original: 'du byed ni dngos po rnams kyi skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'du byed ni dngos po rnams kyi skye ba'o //

analyzed: de yang gnod pa thams cad kyi gzhi yin pas gnas ngan len yin la /
translated: And since that is the basis of all harm, it is a negative reflex action.

original: 'phags pa rnams dang mi mthun pa'i phyir sdug bsngal nyid de /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams dang mi mthun pa'i phyir sdug bsngal nyid de /
translated: And since it is not in accord with the noble ones, it is suffering.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:üîΩThis birth is a harm. When there is birth, there is aging, death,

original: skye 'di gnod yin pa skye ba yod na rga dang 'chi ba dang // nad dang phongs pa gsod dang 'ching ba la sogs pa dgra rnams yod //
analyzed: skye 'di gnod yin pa skye ba yod na rga dang 'chi ba dang // nad dang phongs pa gsod dang 'ching ba la sogs pa dgra rnams yod //
translated: sickness, poverty, killing, bondage, and so on, which are enemies.

original: gal te 'jigs mad skye ba med gyur gnod pa de dag med //üîΩshing skyes med na me dang rlung dang nags mes 'gyel mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te 'jigs mad skye ba med gyur gnod pa de dag med // shing skyes med na me dang rlung dang nags mes 'gyel mi 'gyur //
translated: If there were no birth, there would be no fear of the afflictions.

original: zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: If there were no arising of a tree, there would be no fear of fire, wind, and forest fire.

original: des zhes bya ba 'di 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba 'di 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis so //
translated: By that, i.e., by the suffering of the formative forces.

analyzed: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid gnyis kyis ni ma yin te ;
translated: It is not by the two, i.e., by the suffering of change and the suffering of suffering,

analyzed: de gnyis khyab pa ma yin pa dang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because these two are not pervasive and because the suffering of the formative forces is the cause.

analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad 'phags pas sdug bsngal du gzigs kyi zag pa med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The Noble Ones perceive all contaminated entities as suffering, but not the uncontaminated ones,

original: lam gyi bden pa na che'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩphyin ci log gi @271a * //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa na che'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro // phyin ci log gi @271a * //
translated: because the truth of the path is the antidote to suffering.üîΩOrdinary people do not,

original: bsam pa nyams pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa nyams pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: because their minds are impaired by erroneous inversion.

original: mdo'i sde las kyang mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo'i sde las kyang mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Sutra Pitaka also says: In brief, the five aggregates of attachment are suffering.

original: gzhan dag na re 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid ni las su mi rung ba'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid ni las su mi rung ba'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The suffering of the formative forces is the unserviceability of mind.

original: gzhan na re las su mi rung ba ni gnas ngan len ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan na re las su mi rung ba ni gnas ngan len ma yin no //
translated: Others say: Un¬≠serviceability is not the negative reflex.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: las su mi rung ba'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir nges par zag pa dang bcas pa ni sa bon gyi rgyu las byung bar khas blang dgos na /
analyzed: las su mi rung ba'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir nges par zag pa dang bcas pa ni sa bon gyi rgyu las byung bar khas blang dgos na /
translated: Because unserviceability is a defilement, it must be admitted that it arises from the cause of a seed.

analyzed: de ni dgra bcom pa'i rgyud la sa bon med kyang res 'ga' kha zas dang gnas pa la sogs pa drags pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: But it occurs in the continuum of an arhat, even though the seed of that is destroyed, because of the excessive consumption of food, etc.

original: de ni zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir gnas ngan len zhes byar mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de ni zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir gnas ngan len zhes byar mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: It is not proper to call that negative reflex, because it is not a defilement.

analyzed: de bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyis sa bon gnas pa ni 'dir gnas ngan len du 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, the store-consciousness is accepted here as the negative reflex because the seeds of the dharmas that are associated with impurity are present in it.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang lhan cig pa'i lus 'di ni de'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang lhan cig pa'i lus 'di ni de'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The body that is associated with pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain is the result of that.

analyzed: de bas na bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dang lhan cig pa skad cig re re la 'byung ba'i lus kyi gnas ngan len de rab tu ston te /

original: shes par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: shes par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúreveals‚Äù is ‚Äúmakes known.‚Äù

analyzed: dper na myu gus g-yul gyi ser ga'i nang du song ba'i sa bon mngon pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a sprout reveals the seed that is inside the husk of grain.

original: de'i phyir lus la yongs su brtags pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus la yongs su brtags pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug go //
translated: Thus, one enters into the truth of suffering by investigating the body.

original: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
translated: Here, the cause is mentioned:

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni gnas ngan len dang bcas pa'i 'du byed yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni gnas ngan len dang bcas pa'i 'du byed yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Its characteristic is that it is a formation that is associated with negative reflex.

original: sa bon dang bcas pa'i 'du byed kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sa bon dang bcas pa'i 'du byed kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because it has the nature of formations together with their seeds.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid ni 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid ngag gnas ngan len gnyis kyi rjes su song ba dang / de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal du bshad do //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid ni 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid ngag gnas ngan len gnyis kyi rjes su song ba dang / de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal du bshad do //
translated: The truth of suffering as the suffering of the formations is explained as the suffering of the formations because it is associated with the two, i.e., change and the suffering of the formations, and because it is their cause.

original: de bas na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad 'phags pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal nyid du gzigs so //
analyzed: de bas na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad 'phags pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal nyid du gzigs so //
translated: Therefore, all contaminated things are seen by the noble ones as suffering due to the suffering of the formations.

original: de ltar na lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: de ltar na lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug go //
translated: Thus, one enters into the truth of suffering through the application of the mindfulness of the body.

original: sred pa'i rgyu ni tshor ba ste /
analyzed: sred pa'i rgyu ni tshor ba ste /
translated: The cause of craving is feeling.

original: zhes bya ba ni ma @271b rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung bar dgos pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ma @271b rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung bar dgos pa ste /
translated: This is the purpose of the statement, i.e., that it arises from contact accompanied by ignorance.

original: zag pa med pa ni de'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni de'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the uncontaminated is not its cause.

original: de la bde ba'i tshor ba ni de dang ldan zhing mi 'bral bar sred pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la bde ba'i tshor ba ni de dang ldan zhing mi 'bral bar sred pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Pleasant feeling is the cause of craving to possess and not be separated from that feeling.

original: sdug bsngal ni de dang mi phrad pa dang bral bar sred pa'i rgyu'o /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni de dang mi phrad pa dang bral bar sred pa'i rgyu'o /
translated: Painful feeling is the cause of craving to not meet with and to be separated from that feeling.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa 'ga' zhig la de'i gnas skabs la mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa'i rgyu dang / de dang phrad cing mi 'bral par sred pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa 'ga' zhig la de'i gnas skabs la mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa'i rgyu dang / de dang phrad cing mi 'bral par sred pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling is the cause of craving to delight in the state of meditative equipoise and to meet with and not be separated from that feeling.

original: de sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas reg na 'dod pa'i bde ba la mngon par dga'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas reg na 'dod pa'i bde ba la mngon par dga'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúWhen he is touched by painful feeling, he delights in sensual pleasure.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal ba'i tshor ba yang bde ba la sred pa'i rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i tshor ba yang bde ba la sred pa'i rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, painful feeling is also the cause of craving for pleasure.

original: de la yongs su brtags pas kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: de la yongs su brtags pas kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la 'jug go //
translated: Thus, through investigating that, one enters the truth of origin.

original: de la tshor ba rnams la rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba nyid du nye bar yongs su rtog na kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: de la tshor ba rnams la rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba nyid du nye bar yongs su rtog na kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la 'jug ste /
translated: When one thoroughly investigates feelings as to their intrinsic nature, their result, their impermanence, and their unsatisfactoriness, one penetrates the truth of origination.

original: sred pa ni de'i 'bras bur khong du chud do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sred pa ni de'i 'bras bur khong du chud do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the above passage is that one understands craving to be the result of feeling.

original: mdo sde las sred pa ni kun 'byung ba'i bden par gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo sde las sred pa ni kun 'byung ba'i bden par gsungs te /
translated: The sutras declare craving to be the truth of origination.

original: sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the origination of suffering?

original: yang 'byung ba'i sred pa dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'o zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yang 'byung ba'i sred pa dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'o zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: It is the craving which leads to further existence and is accompanied by the passion for this and that.

original: de ltar tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pas kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: de ltar tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pas kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la 'jug go //
translated: Thus, one penetrates the truth of origination by means of the close placement of mindfulness on feeling.

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi ni sems te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi ni sems te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The basis for the manifest clinging to a self is mind.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa'i yon tan khyad par can gyi bdag gzhan med pas na bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i dmigs pa ni sems nyid do //
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa'i yon tan khyad par can gyi bdag gzhan med pas na bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i dmigs pa ni sems nyid do //
translated: Since there is no self which possesses the special qualities of permanence, etc., the object of the manifest clinging to a self is mind alone.

original: de bas na de yongs su brtags pas 'gog pa'i bden pa la zhi ba nyid du 'jug ste /
analyzed: de bas na de yongs su brtags pas 'gog pa'i bden pa la zhi ba nyid du 'jug ste /
translated: Therefore, by thoroughly investigating it, one enters into the peacefulness of the truth of cessation.

original: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
translated: Here, the cause is stated:

original: bdag chad bar dogs pa'i 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag chad bar dogs pa'i 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: because there is no fear of the annihilation of the self.

original: sems la mi rtag pa la sogs par yongs su brtags pas bdag tu mngon par zhen pa ldog cing sdug bsngal du 'du shes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems la mi rtag pa la sogs par yongs su brtags pas bdag tu mngon par zhen pa ldog cing sdug bsngal du 'du shes 'byung ngo //
translated: By thoroughly investigating the mind as impermanent, etc., one turns away from the attachment to a self and the perception of suffering arises.

original: de'i phyir bdag chad pa'i 'jigs pa med pas sdug bsngal ba tsam zhig gcod pa'i phyir 'gog pa'i bden pa la zhi ba nyid du 'jug ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag chad pa'i 'jigs pa med pas sdug bsngal ba tsam zhig gcod pa'i phyir 'gog pa'i bden pa la zhi ba nyid du 'jug ste /
translated: Therefore, because there is no fear of the annihilation of the self, one enters into the peacefulness of the truth of cessation in order to eliminate mere suffering.

original: de ltar sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pas 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'jug ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pas 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'jug ces bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is said that one enters into the truth of cessation by means of the application of the mindfulness of the mind.

original: chos la yongs su brtags @272a * //
analyzed: chos la yongs su brtags @272a * //
translated: Thoroughly investigating phenomena,

original: pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos la rmongs pa med pa'i phyir lam gyi bden pa la 'jug go zhes bya ba de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //üîΩrnam par byang ba rnams ni nye ba'i gnyen por gyur pa rnams te /
analyzed: pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos la rmongs pa med pa'i phyir lam gyi bden pa la 'jug go zhes bya ba de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams so // rnam par byang ba rnams ni nye ba'i gnyen por gyur pa rnams te /
translated: The phenomena of defilement are the passions and the secondary passions.

original: mi sdug pa dang byams pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa dang byams pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those of purification are the proximate powers, such as the meditation on the impurities and loving-kindness.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba de rnams la gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi ngo bor shes nas gnod pa thams cad gtan du spang ba'i thabs lam gyi bden pa la mngon du phyogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba de rnams la gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi ngo bor shes nas gnod pa thams cad gtan du spang ba'i thabs lam gyi bden pa la mngon du phyogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Having understood that these phenomena of defilement and purification are the antidotes and the counteractions, one turns toward the truth of the path as the means to eliminate all harm forever.

original: de ltar chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pas lam gyi bden pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: de ltar chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pas lam gyi bden pa la 'jug go //
translated: Thus, one enters the truth of the path through the application of mindfulness to the phenomena of defilement and purification.

original: 'jug pa ni 'dir bden pa so so la bden pa'i mtshan nyid du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni 'dir bden pa so so la bden pa'i mtshan nyid du rtogs pa'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúto enter‚Äù means to realize the characteristics of the truths individually.

original: de la lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / mi gtsang ba du ma'i rdzas kyi rang bzhin dang / mi gtsang ba'i sa bon dang /
analyzed: de la lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / mi gtsang ba du ma'i rdzas kyi rang bzhin dang / mi gtsang ba'i sa bon dang /
translated: The cultivation of the mindfulness of the body is the meditation on impermanence, suffering, emptiness, selflessness, the nature of many impure substances, the seed of impurity,

original: mi gtsang ba'i rgyu mthun pa dang / mi gtsang ba gnas pa'i rgyu dang / mi gtsang bar 'gyur ba dang / dbu ba rdos pa bzhin du snying po med pa dang / 'gro ba dang skye gnas yin par bsgom mo //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i rgyu mthun pa dang / mi gtsang ba gnas pa'i rgyu dang / mi gtsang bar 'gyur ba dang / dbu ba rdos pa bzhin du snying po med pa dang / 'gro ba dang skye gnas yin par bsgom mo //
translated: the natural outflow of impurity, the cause of the abode of impurity, the transformation into impurity, the lack of essence like a lump of foam, and the abode of beings.

original: tshor ba dang sems dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams bsgom pa yang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / rgyu dang /
analyzed: tshor ba dang sems dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams bsgom pa yang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / rgyu dang /
translated: The cultivation of the mindfulness of feelings, mind, and phenomena is the meditation on impermanence, suffering, emptiness, selflessness, general characteristics, specific characteristics, cause,

original: 'bras bu dang / khams dang / sa dang / 'gro ba dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po yin par bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang / khams dang / sa dang / 'gro ba dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po yin par bsgom mo //
translated: one cultivates the realization of the result, the elements, the stages, the destinies, the wholesome, the unwholesome, the undefined, the adverse elements and the counteragents.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa ni 'di lta bu yang yin la rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i rnam par yang bsgom mo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa ni 'di lta bu yang yin la rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i rnam par yang bsgom mo //
translated: This is the cultivation of the applications of mindfulness by the bodhisattvas. It is also the cultivation of the non-apprehension of the objective supports, because it is free from conceptual differentiation.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin du zin kyang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i tshig ni dran pa'i stobs kyis nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin du zin kyang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i tshig ni dran pa'i stobs kyis nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Although the applications of mindfulness have the nature of wisdom, the word 'mindfulness' is used because they are established by the power of mindfulness.

original: 'di dag gis dran pa nye bar gnas pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gis dran pa nye bar gnas pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, they are called 'applications of mindfulness' because mindfulness is applied by them.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i 'og tu yang dag par spong ba bsgom pa bshad de /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i 'og tu yang dag par spong ba bsgom pa bshad de /
translated: After the cultivation of the applications of mindfulness, the cultivation of the correct exertions is mentioned.

original: de ci'i @272b phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i @272b phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar /
translated: Hence he says:

original: mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po rnams //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po rnams //
translated: and the counteragents to the adverse elements,

original: rnam pa thams cad yongs shes nas //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad yongs shes nas //
translated: having understood them in all their aspects,

original: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: he should generate the counteragents.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms nas zhes khyad par med par brjod kyang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o//
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms nas zhes khyad par med par brjod kyang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o//
translated: Although it is said without distinction that he should cultivate the applications of mindfulness after he has cultivated the applications of mindfulness, it should be understood that he should cultivate just the application of the mindfulness of dharmas.

original: khams dang sa'i spangs pa dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / de bzhin du zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / khams dang / sa dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po rnam pa thams cad du yongs su shes na mi mthun pa'i phyogs gsal ba ni 'dir skyes pa rnams kyi rgyun chad pa dang /üîΩma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'o //
analyzed: khams dang sa'i spangs pa dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / de bzhin du zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / khams dang / sa dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po rnam pa thams cad du yongs su shes na mi mthun pa'i phyogs gsal ba ni 'dir skyes pa rnams kyi rgyun chad pa dang / ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'o //
translated: Having understood in all their aspects the adverse elements and the counteragents through the aspects of abandonment of the realms and spiritual levels, the general characteristics, etc., and likewise through the distinctions of the realms, spiritual levels, the training, the untrained, etc., the manifestation of the adverse elements is the termination of the series of those that have arisen and the non-production of those that have not arisen.

original: gnyen po bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyen po bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: For the sake of generating the counteragents.

original: gnyen po bskyed pa ni skyes pa rnams kyi rgyun gyis rjes su 'jug pa dang ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen po bskyed pa ni skyes pa rnams kyi rgyun gyis rjes su 'jug pa dang ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa'o //
translated: The development of the counteragent is the continuation of those that have arisen and the production of those that have not arisen.

original: brtson 'grus rnam pa bzhi rab tu 'byung zhes byang ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po gnyis skyes pa dang ma skyes pa tha dad pas brtson 'grus rnam pa bzhi 'byung ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rnam pa bzhi rab tu 'byung zhes byang ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po gnyis skyes pa dang ma skyes pa tha dad pas brtson 'grus rnam pa bzhi 'byung ste /
translated: The fourfold vigor is produced. The fourfold vigor is produced through the distinction of the two, the counteragent and its counter-correlate, in terms of what has arisen and what has not arisen.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir zhe rgya cher 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'dis ni lung gis brtson 'grus nyid rnam pa bzhi 'byung bar ston to //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir zhe rgya cher 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'dis ni lung gis brtson 'grus nyid rnam pa bzhi 'byung bar ston to //
translated: This shows through scripture that the fourfold vigor is produced.

original: rgya cher zhes bya ba ni tshig lhag ma dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: rgya cher zhes bya ba ni tshig lhag ma dang sbyar ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúgreat‚Äù is connected with the rest of the sentence.

original: de la 'di ni tshig lhag ma ste sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed do //üîΩ'bad do // brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: de la 'di ni tshig lhag ma ste sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed do // 'bad do // brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: The rest of the sentence is this: ‚ÄúOne generates will for the abandonment of evil unwholesome dharmas that have arisen.

original: sems rab tu 'dzin to //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin to //
translated: One makes an effort, one exercises vigor, one wields the mind, one exerts the faculty of exertion.

original: yang dag par rab tu 'jog go zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu 'jog go zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: And similarly, one generates will for the non-arising of evil unwholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen.

original: de bzhin du dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do zhes rgya cher bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do zhes rgya cher bya'o //
translated: And similarly, one generates will for the arising of wholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen.

original: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang phyir zhing 'byung ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang phyir zhing 'byung ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do //
translated: And one generates will for the endurance, non-forgetting, further arising, extension, greatness, and completion of wholesome dharmas that have already arisen.

original: 'bad do // brtson 'grus brtsam mo //üîΩsems rab tu 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'bad do // brtson 'grus brtsam mo // sems rab tu 'dzin to //
translated: One makes an effort, exerts one‚Äôs effort, and strives.

original: yang dag par rab tu 'jog go zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu 'jog go zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One focuses one‚Äôs mind and correctly settles it.

original: skyes pa rnams gnas pa ni yongs su mi nyams pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa rnams gnas pa ni yongs su mi nyams pa'o //
translated: Arisen wholesome dharmas endure without being forgotten.

original: phyir zhing 'byung ba ni rgyun du skye ba'o //
analyzed: phyir zhing 'byung ba ni rgyun du skye ba'o //
translated: They arise again and again.

original: yongs su rdzogs par bya ba ni phul du phyin par @273a * //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par bya ba ni phul du phyin par @273a * //
translated: They are completed and brought to perfection.

original: 'gyur ba'o // 'dun pa skyed ces bya ba ni gus par brtson 'grus bsgom pa'i sbyor ba ston to //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'o // 'dun pa skyed ces bya ba ni gus par brtson 'grus bsgom pa'i sbyor ba ston to //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should generate enthusiasm‚Äù shows the application of cultivating effort with respect.

original: 'bad ces bya ba ni le lo spangs te /
analyzed: 'bad ces bya ba ni le lo spangs te /
translated: ‚ÄúOne should strive‚Äù shows the abandonment of laziness.

original: lus dang sems mngon du byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lus dang sems mngon du byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that one should manifest the body and mind.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom zhes bya ba ni bying ba dang rgod pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom zhes bya ba ni bying ba dang rgod pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should generate effort‚Äù is for the sake of dispelling laxity and excitement.

original: ji ltar rtsom zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rtsom zhe na /
translated: How does one generate effort?

original: yang dag pa shes par bya ba dang / dga' bar bya ba'i chos yid la byed pas bying ba'i sems rab tu 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang dag pa shes par bya ba dang / dga' bar bya ba'i chos yid la byed pas bying ba'i sems rab tu 'dzin to //
translated: One should hold the lax mind by bringing to mind the phenomena that are to be known and delighted in.

original: sems rgod par gyur na dmigs pa de nyid la yang dag par rab tu 'jog ste /
analyzed: sems rgod par gyur na dmigs pa de nyid la yang dag par rab tu 'jog ste /
translated: When the mind is excited, one should correctly settle it on that very object.

original: 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means one should hold it.

original: de ltar yang dag par spong ba rnams ni brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag par spong ba rnams ni brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin du bstan pa yin te /
translated: Thus the correct abandonings are taught to have the nature of effort.

original: 'di rnams kyis lus dang ngag dang yid yang dag par 'dzin pas na yang dag par 'dzin pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis lus dang ngag dang yid yang dag par 'dzin pas na yang dag par 'dzin pa rnams so //
translated: They are called correct abandonings because they correctly hold body, speech, and mind.

original: der gnas las su rung ba nyid //
analyzed: der gnas las su rung ba nyid //
translated: and the workability of the mind is the basis for that.

original: ces rgya cher 'byung ba la der zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsal ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa de la'o //
analyzed: ces rgya cher 'byung ba la der zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsal ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa de la'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin that‚Äù refers to the practice of the four right efforts in order to eliminate the resistances.

original: sems gnas pa'i las su rung ba nyid ni don thams cad 'byor par nus pa nyid de las su rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: sems gnas pa'i las su rung ba nyid ni don thams cad 'byor par nus pa nyid de las su rung ba nyid do //
translated: The workability of the mind is the ability to attain all aims.

original: las su rung ba de yang 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems pa dang / dpyod pa'i dbang gis byung bas na de'i phyir /
analyzed: las su rung ba de yang 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems pa dang / dpyod pa'i dbang gis byung bas na de'i phyir /
translated: Since that workability arises from the power of aspiration, effort, intention, and investigation, it is said:

original: las su rung ba nyid ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi po dag ste zhes bya ba smos so ;
analyzed: las su rung ba nyid ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi po dag ste zhes bya ba smos so ;
translated: ‚ÄúThe workability of the mind is the four bases of psychic power.‚Äù

original: / mngon par shes pa la sogs pa don thams cad 'grub par byed pa ni rdzu 'phrul lo //
analyzed: / mngon par shes pa la sogs pa don thams cad 'grub par byed pa ni rdzu 'phrul lo //
translated: Psychic power is the attainment of all aims, such as the superknowledges.

original: de'i gnas yin pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i gnas yin pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since it is the basis of psychic power, it is called a base of psychic power.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called a cause.

original: de bas na don thams cad 'byor pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
analyzed: de bas na don thams cad 'byor pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that they are the cause for the acquisition of all aims.

original: de dag kyang 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang /üîΩdpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They are the basis of supernormal power that is endowed with will, concentration, and the thorough application of abandonment; the basis of supernormal power that is endowed with effort, concentration, and the thorough application of abandonment; the basis of supernormal power that is endowed with mind, concentration, and the thorough application of abandonment; and the basis of supernormal power that is endowed with investigation, concentration, and the thorough application of abandonment.

original: de la 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni gang gi tshe 'dun pa'i dbang gis brtson 'grus rtsom pa la gus par 'jug pa na sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni gang gi tshe 'dun pa'i dbang gis brtson 'grus rtsom pa la gus par 'jug pa na sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa'o //
translated: Will concentration is the one-pointedness of mind that occurs when, through the power of will, one engages in the practice of effort with respect.

original: brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin ni gang gi tshe brtson 'grus rtsom pa na rtag par sbyor bas sems @273b rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin ni gang gi tshe brtson 'grus rtsom pa na rtag par sbyor bas sems @273b rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa'o //
translated: The samadhi of effort is when one touches the one-pointedness of mind by constant application when one is making an effort.

original: sems kyi ting nge 'dzin ni gang gi tshe sngon gyi ting nge 'dzin gyi sa bon la brten nas sems 'dzin cing gang sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi ting nge 'dzin ni gang gi tshe sngon gyi ting nge 'dzin gyi sa bon la brten nas sems 'dzin cing gang sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa'o //
translated: The samadhi of mind is when one touches the one-pointedness of mind by holding the mind in dependence on the seed of previous samadhi.

original: dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni gang gi tshe dmigs pa rab tu rnam par 'byed pa na sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni gang gi tshe dmigs pa rab tu rnam par 'byed pa na sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa'o //
translated: The samadhi of investigation is when one touches the one-pointedness of mind by investigating the objective support.

original: gnas pa ni 'dir sems gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa ni 'dir sems gnas pa ste /
translated: Here, the basis is the stability of mind.

original: ting nge 'dzin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It should be known as samadhi.

original: ting nge 'dzin smos pa ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid las dbye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin smos pa ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid las dbye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of samadhi is for the sake of distinguishing it from the characteristics of the conditioned.

original: 'di ltar brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni sems las su rung ba nyid rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhir gyur pa de'i phyir yang dag par spong ba'i 'og tu rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ltar brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni sems las su rung ba nyid rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhir gyur pa de'i phyir yang dag par spong ba'i 'og tu rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams bstan to //
translated: Thus, the four bases of supernatural powers are the pliancy that arises from the practice of effort. Therefore, the bases of supernatural powers are taught after the correct exertions.

original: las su rang ba de yang dgos pa ni gang /
analyzed: las su rang ba de yang dgos pa ni gang /
translated: What is the purpose of that pliancy?

original: rgyu ni gang zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu ni gang zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: What is its cause?

original: nyes pa lnga spang ba'i phyir 'du byed bsgom pa'i rgyu las byung bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: nyes pa lnga spang ba'i phyir 'du byed bsgom pa'i rgyu las byung bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúOne should know that pliancy arises from the cause of the cultivation of the formative forces in order to abandon the five faults.‚Äù

original: nyes pa lnga po de dag mi shes nas /
analyzed: nyes pa lnga po de dag mi shes nas /
translated: If one does not know those five faults,üîΩone will not know how to cultivate the formative forces in order to abandon them. Therefore, in order to demonstrate them, he asks: What are those five faults?

original: de'i phyir / nyes pa lnga po de dag gang zhe na zhes dris pa dang / de dag bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir / nyes pa lnga po de dag gang zhe na zhes dris pa dang / de dag bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: and in order to demonstrate them, he says:

original: le lo dag ni gdams ngag rnams //
analyzed: le lo dag ni gdams ngag rnams //
translated: Laziness, forgetting the instruction,üîΩlaxness and excitedness,

original: brjed dang bying dang rgod pa dang // zhes rgya cher gsungs so /
analyzed: brjed dang bying dang rgod pa dang // zhes rgya cher gsungs so /
translated: and the absence of formative force and the excessive formative force in regard to the abandonment of laxity and excitedness.

original: de dag ni nyes pa drug tu 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: de dag ni nyes pa drug tu 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: One might think that these are six faults,

original: de'i phyir / de la bying ba dang rgod pa ni nyes pa gcig tu bsdu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de la bying ba dang rgod pa ni nyes pa gcig tu bsdu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚ÄúHere, laxity and excitement are subsumed into one fault.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, there are five.

original: de la le lo ni sbyor ba'i tshe na nyes pa ste /
analyzed: de la le lo ni sbyor ba'i tshe na nyes pa ste /
translated: Among them, laziness is a fault at the time of application,

original: des mi sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des mi sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not apply.

original: brtson pa'i tshe gdams ngag brjed pa ni nyes pa ste /
analyzed: brtson pa'i tshe gdams ngag brjed pa ni nyes pa ste /
translated: At the time of striving, forgetting the instruction is a fault,

original: des sems mnyam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des sems mnyam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it lacks mental equipoise.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa la bying ba dang rgod pa ni nyes pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa la bying ba dang rgod pa ni nyes pa ste /
translated: At the time of equipoise, laxity and excitement are faults,

original: des sems las su rung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des sems las su rung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they lack mental pliability.

original: bying ba dang rgod par gyur pa'i tshe mngon par 'du mi byed pa nyes pa'o //
analyzed: bying ba dang rgod par gyur pa'i tshe mngon par 'du mi byed pa nyes pa'o //
translated: At the time of laxity and excitement, non-application is a fault.

original: mngon par 'du mi byed pa ni btang snyoms te /
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed pa ni btang snyoms te /
translated: Non-application is equanimity,

original: des de gnyis rab tu zhi bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des de gnyis rab tu zhi bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not pacify those two.

original: rab tu zhi ba'i tshe ni mngon par 'du byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyes pa zhes bya bar snyegs so //
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba'i tshe ni mngon par 'du byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyes pa zhes bya bar snyegs so //
translated: At the time of pacification, application is a fault.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa ni sems pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa ni sems pa'o //
translated: The volition that is the instigation is the intention.

original: bying ba dang rgod pa dang bral bas mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa'i phyir rab tu zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bying ba dang rgod pa dang bral bas mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa'i phyir rab tu zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äútranquility‚Äù because it is the state of equilibrium that results from the absence of laxity and excitedness.

original: spang bar bya ba'i phyir 'du byed rnams ni spong ba'i 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba'i phyir 'du byed rnams ni spong ba'i 'du byed rnams so //
translated: The formative forces that are the relinquishment are the formative forces that are the relinquishment of the latter.

original: gang spang ba'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang spang ba'i phyir zhe na /
translated: In regard to the question, ‚ÄúWhat is it that is to be relinquished? ‚Äù,

original: bshad ma thag pa'i nyes pa lnga rnams spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i nyes pa lnga rnams spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it is the five faults that have just been described.

original: gal te de lta na des de dag spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad ji ltar rnam @274a * //üîΩpar gzhag pa brjod dgos so //
analyzed: gal te de lta na des de dag spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad ji ltar rnam @274a * // par gzhag pa brjod dgos so //
