translated: If this is so, then how can the eight formative forces that are the relinquishment of those be formulated?

original: de la le lo spang ba'i phyir bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la le lo spang ba'i phyir bzhi ste /
translated: In this regard, there are four formative forces that are the relinquishment of laziness.

original: 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
translated: They are: will, vigour, faith and serenity.

original: de la 'dun pa ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: Of these, will is desire.

original: rtsol ba ni brtson 'grus so //üîΩdad pa ni mgon par yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: rtsol ba ni brtson 'grus so // dad pa ni mgon par yid ches pa'o //
translated: Vigour is the effort.üîΩFaith is the conviction in the efficacy of the latter.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni las su rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni las su rung ba nyid do //
translated: Serenity is the fitness of the mind.

original: ji ltar na le lo spang ba'i phyir de dag rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na le lo spang ba'i phyir de dag rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: How are they established in order to abandon laziness?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / de dag kyang go rims bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de dag kyang go rims bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: They should be understood in orderüîΩas basis, that which is based on it,

original: gnas dang de la gnas pa dang // rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du'o /üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gnas dang de la gnas pa dang // rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du'o / zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: cause, and result.

original: de dag gcig las gcig 'byung bas na le lo spong bar 'gyur ba ston to//
analyzed: de dag gcig las gcig 'byung bas na le lo spong bar 'gyur ba ston to//
translated: Since they arise from one to another, laziness is abandoned.

original: rtsol ba'i gnas ni 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: rtsol ba'i gnas ni 'dun pa'o //
translated: The basis of striving is will.

original: gnas pa ni rtsol ba ste /
analyzed: gnas pa ni rtsol ba ste /
translated: That which is based on it is striving.

original: 'dod pa ni rtsol ba'i sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni rtsol ba'i sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since desire precedes striving,

original: gnas 'dun pa'i rgyu ni dad pa ste /
analyzed: gnas 'dun pa'i rgyu ni dad pa ste /
translated: the cause of the basis, will, is faith.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / yid ches par gyur na 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / yid ches par gyur na 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because of the desire to have confidence.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu la dad pa dang ldan pa ni bya ba la 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu la dad pa dang ldan pa ni bya ba la 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who has faith in cause and effect will have desire for action.

original: gnas pa rtsol ba de'i 'bras bu ni shin tu sbyangs pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa rtsol ba de'i 'bras bu ni shin tu sbyangs pa ste /
translated: The result of that basis, will, is serenity.

original: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: How is that? Therefore, it is said:

original: brtson 'grus brtsams na ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams na ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: because one attains a special meditative concentration when one has begun effort.

original: ting nge 'dzin khyad par du 'gro ba ni shin tu sbyangs pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin khyad par du 'gro ba ni shin tu sbyangs pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of pliancy is the progress of meditative concentration.

original: de'i phyir / brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i ting nge 'dzin khyad par du 'gro bas shin tu sbyangs pa ni rtsol ba'i 'bras bur bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir / brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i ting nge 'dzin khyad par du 'gro bas shin tu sbyangs pa ni rtsol ba'i 'bras bur bshad do //
translated: Therefore, pliancy is explained as the result of striving, because of the progress of meditative concentration in one who has begun effort.

original: de ltar brtson 'grus brtsams pa gnas ngan len gyi rnam par rtog pa'i nyes pa dang bral bas dga' ba skye'o //
analyzed: de ltar brtson 'grus brtsams pa gnas ngan len gyi rnam par rtog pa'i nyes pa dang bral bas dga' ba skye'o //
translated: In this way, one who has begun effort is free from the fault of discursive thought that is the cause of demerit. Joy arises.

original: yid dga' bas lus dang sems gnyis shin tu sbyangs te las su rung ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yid dga' bas lus dang sems gnyis shin tu sbyangs te las su rung ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: When the mind is joyful, both the body and mind become pliant, which is characterized by serviceability.

original: de bas na ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one attains a special meditative concentration.

original: 'dir ni brtson 'grus rgyu dang bcas shing 'bras bu dang bcas pa le lo'i gnyen por bshad do //
analyzed: 'dir ni brtson 'grus rgyu dang bcas shing 'bras bu dang bcas pa le lo'i gnyen por bshad do //
translated: Here, effort is explained as the antidote to laziness, together with its cause and result.

original: nyes pa bzhi'i gnyen por grangs bzhin no zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: nyes pa bzhi'i gnyen por grangs bzhin no zhes bya ba de la /
translated: The four faults are remedied by the four, respectively.

original: dran pa ni gdams ngag brjed pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: dran pa ni gdams ngag brjed pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: Mindfulness is the remedy for forgetting the instruction.

original: shes bzhin ni bying ba dang rgod pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin ni bying ba dang rgod pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: Alertness is the remedy for laxity and excitement.

original: sems pa ni mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: sems pa ni mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: Exertion is the remedy for non-application.

original: btang snyoms ni mngon par 'du byed pa'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni mngon par 'du byed pa'i gnyen po ste /
translated: Equanimity is the remedy for application.

original: 'dir 'du byed kyi btang snyoms su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'du byed kyi btang snyoms su shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, equanimity should be understood as the equanimity of application.

original: dran pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to state the characteristics of mindfulness, etc.,

original: de dag kyang ngan pa @274b la sogs pa rig par bya ste go rims bzhin zhes bya ba 'di smos so //üîΩdran pa ni dmigs pa ma brjed pa'o zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de dag kyang ngan pa @274b la sogs pa rig par bya ste go rims bzhin zhes bya ba 'di smos so // dran pa ni dmigs pa ma brjed pa'o zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThey should be understood as inferior, etc., respectively.‚ÄùüîΩMindfulness is not forgetting the object.

original: dran pa ni dmigs pa ma brjed pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems gnas par bya ba'i gdams ngag yid kyis brjod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dran pa ni dmigs pa ma brjed pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems gnas par bya ba'i gdams ngag yid kyis brjod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúMindfulness is not forgetting the object‚Äù means mentally reciting the instruction for stabilizing the mind.

original: shes bzhin ni dran pa ma brjed par gyur na bying ba dang rgod pa rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gnas pa shes bzhin dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes bzhin ni dran pa ma brjed par gyur na bying ba dang rgod pa rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gnas pa shes bzhin dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase when mindfulness is not lost, slackness and excitedness are discerned means that when mindfulness is well-established, there is vigilance.

original: de'i phyir dran pa ma brjed par gyur na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dran pa ma brjed par gyur na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, when mindfulness is not lost.

original: bying ba dang rgod pa rtogs nas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyis zung du 'brel par 'jug pa'i phyir bsgrim mi dgos par 'jug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bying ba dang rgod pa rtogs nas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyis zung du 'brel par 'jug pa'i phyir bsgrim mi dgos par 'jug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: When slackness and excitedness are discerned, serenity and insight are united. Therefore, the root text states, without the need for effort, they engage their objects.

original: btang snyoms zhes bya ba ni yul gzhan la mngon par 'du mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms zhes bya ba ni yul gzhan la mngon par 'du mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The phrase equanimity means that the mind is not directed toward other objects.

original: de ni 'di skad du gdams ngag la dran pa shin tu nye bar gnas pa ni bying ba dang rgod pa'i sems yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin du shes shing /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du gdams ngag la dran pa shin tu nye bar gnas pa ni bying ba dang rgod pa'i sems yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin du shes shing /
translated: This passage means that when the instructions are well-established in the mind, the mind that is afflicted by slackness and excitedness is correctly understood.

original: bying ba dang rgod pa dang 'bral ba'i phyir de mngon par 'du byed la /
analyzed: bying ba dang rgod pa dang 'bral ba'i phyir de mngon par 'du byed la /
translated: In order to be free of slackness and excitedness, the mind is directed toward its object.

original: bying ba dang rgod pa dang 'bral na yang btang snyoms su byed do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bying ba dang rgod pa dang 'bral na yang btang snyoms su byed do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: And when it is free from laxity and excitement, it is equanimity.

original: de ltar na de'i sems rnal du 'jug pa las su rung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de'i sems rnal du 'jug pa las su rung ba nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the mind is fit for the state of composure.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i 'og tu dbang po lnga rnams te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i 'og tu dbang po lnga rnams te /
translated: The five faculties of faith, etc., are established immediately after the bases of psychic power.

original: dad pa la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni bstan zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni bstan zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The text reads: ‚ÄúFaith, etc.‚Äù

original: de dag ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: How are they established?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / thar pa'i cha dang mthun bskyed na //
analyzed: de'i phyir / thar pa'i cha dang mthun bskyed na //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen the factors conducive to liberation are generated,

original: 'dun dang sbyor ba dbang byed do //
analyzed: 'dun dang sbyor ba dbang byed do //
translated: aspiration and application are dominant.

original: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: The text continues:üîΩ‚ÄúThe word ‚Äòdominant‚Äô should be supplied in each case.‚Äù

original: dbang byed pa zhes bya bar snyegs so zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'dun pa dang sbyor ba dbang byed ces bya ba'i sgra 'dir smos pa 'og ma rnams la yang snyegs so zhes ston to //
analyzed: dbang byed pa zhes bya bar snyegs so zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'dun pa dang sbyor ba dbang byed ces bya ba'i sgra 'dir smos pa 'og ma rnams la yang snyegs so zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that the words ‚Äúaspiration and application are dominant‚Äù should be supplied in the following passages.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyis sems las su rung ba thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas zhes bya ba ni sems las su rung ba sems kyi rgyud la thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rab tu 'jog pa
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyis sems las su rung ba thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas zhes bya ba ni sems las su rung ba sems kyi rgyud la thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rab tu 'jog pa
translated: Having generated the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation through the bases of supernatural power, the mind becomes workable.

original: 'thob ste / 'dun pa ni dbang byed pa nas rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni dbang byed pa'i bar du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'thob ste / 'dun pa ni dbang byed pa nas rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni dbang byed pa'i bar du 'gyur gyi /
translated: The mind becomes workable when one attains the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation in the mind-stream,

original: sems las su mi rung ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems las su mi rung ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not when the mind is not workable.

original: sems las su rung ba nyid de yang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems las su rung ba nyid de yang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyis 'gyur ro //
translated: And that workability of the mind is due to the bases of supernatural power.

original: @275a * // de bas na rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i 'og tu thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa la dbang byed pas dad pa la sogs pa dbang po lnga rnams rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: @275a * // de bas na rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i 'og tu thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa la dbang byed pas dad pa la sogs pa dbang po lnga rnams rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, after the bases of supernatural power, the five faculties of faith, etc. are presented, because they control the generation of the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation.

original: 'dun pa ni dbang byed zhes bya ba ni rgyu la 'bras bu btags nas dad pa nyid la 'dir 'dun pa'i sgrar bshad de /
analyzed: 'dun pa ni dbang byed zhes bya ba ni rgyu la 'bras bu btags nas dad pa nyid la 'dir 'dun pa'i sgrar bshad de /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúAspiration is the controlling power.‚Äù Here the term ‚Äúaspiration‚Äù is used to refer to faith, which is the cause, and the result is designated by the name of the cause.

original: dper na zho dang ga gon la 'phral du rims zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na zho dang ga gon la 'phral du rims zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the term ‚Äúfever‚Äù is used to refer to both milk and the plant Calotropis procera.

original: yang na yod pa nyid dang yon tan can dang nus pa rnams la go rims bzhin du mngon par yid ches pa dang / dang ba dang 'dod pa rnams ni dad pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yang na yod pa nyid dang yon tan can dang nus pa rnams la go rims bzhin du mngon par yid ches pa dang / dang ba dang 'dod pa rnams ni dad pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Alternatively, the definition of faith is that it is a mental factor that is characterized by a clear, calm, and confident attitude toward things that exist, have good qualities, and have the ability to perform a function.

original: de bas na 'dun pa smos pas 'dir 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid dad pa smos par 'gyur gyi 'dun pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dun pa smos pas 'dir 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid dad pa smos par 'gyur gyi 'dun pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the term ‚Äúaspiration‚Äù in the root text refers to faith, which is characterized by aspiration, and not to aspiration itself.

original: sbyor ba ni dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'dis sbyor bar byed pas na sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'dis sbyor bar byed pas na sbyor ba ste /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúExertion is the controlling power.‚Äù Exertion is so called because it is that which exerts.

original: sbyor ba'i sgra ni brtson 'grus la bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sgra ni brtson 'grus la bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúexertion‚Äù is intended to mean ‚Äúeffort.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa mi brjed pa ni dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i dbang po dbang byed pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa mi brjed pa ni dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i dbang po dbang byed pa ste /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe controlling power of mindfulness is the non-forgetting of the object.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa gsal ba'i mtshan nyid ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa gsal ba'i mtshan nyid ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The definition of clarity of meditative object is the faculty of mindfulness.

original: mi 'phro ba ni dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dbang byed pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'phro ba ni dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dbang byed pa ste /
translated: Non-diffusion is the faculty of concentration.

original: sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas mi 'phro ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //üîΩrab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi dbang po dbang byed pa ste /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas mi 'phro ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o // rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi dbang po dbang byed pa ste /
translated: Non-diffusion is the faculty of concentration, because it has the definition of one-pointedness of mind.üîΩThorough differentiation is the faculty of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi dbang po chos rnam par 'byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang po chos rnam par 'byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thorough differentiation is the faculty of wisdom, because the faculty of wisdom has the nature of differentiating dharmas.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa la dbang byed pas dad pa la sogs pa dbang po dag dang go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa la dbang byed pas dad pa la sogs pa dbang po dag dang go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that faith, etc., should be understood in order as the faculties, because they control the generation of the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation.

original: dad par gyur pa ni 'khor ba'i btson ra nas 'byung bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: dad par gyur pa ni 'khor ba'i btson ra nas 'byung bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: Faith is the cause of the arising of the roots of virtue, because one who has faith is freed from the prison of cyclic existence.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa bslab pa gsum sgrub ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa bslab pa gsum sgrub ste /
translated: One who has faith makes effort, because one who has faith makes effort to attain the three trainings.

original: dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi dbang po rnams go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi dbang po rnams go rims bzhin no //
translated: The faculties of mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom are the cause of the arising of the roots of virtue, because one who has mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom accomplishes the three trainings.

original: de ltar mthong ba'i lam la sbyor ba'i sa la dbang po di rnams gtso bor 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba'i lam la sbyor ba'i sa la dbang po di rnams gtso bor 'dod do //
translated: Thus, these faculties are considered to be the most important on the stage of preparation for the path of seeing.

original: gzhan dag na re thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa la dbang byed pa la dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa la dbang byed pa la dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Others say: The faculties of faith, etc., are not called faculties in the generation of the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas 'dun pa la sogs pa la dbang byed pas na @275b 'di dag dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas 'dun pa la sogs pa la dbang byed pas na @275b 'di dag dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called faculties because they control aspiration, etc., after the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation have been generated.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'dun pa ni dbang byed pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'dun pa ni dbang byed pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says: aspiration is the controlling power.

original: dad pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is to be connected with the statement: the faculty of faith.

original: sbyor ba ni byed pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni byed pa'o //
translated: Application is activity.

original: mi brjed pa ni dmigs pa chud mi za ba'o //
analyzed: mi brjed pa ni dmigs pa chud mi za ba'o //
translated: Nonforgetting is not losing the object.

original: 'phro ba med pas na mi 'phro ba'o /
analyzed: 'phro ba med pas na mi 'phro ba'o /
translated: Nondistraction is nondiffusion.

original: rab tu rnam par 'byed pas na rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu rnam par 'byed pas na rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: Thorough differentiation is thorough analysis.

original: sbyor ba dang mi brjed pa dang mi 'phro ba dang rab tu rnam par 'byed pa de dag la brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab ces bya ba'i sems las byung ba rnams dbang bas na /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang mi brjed pa dang mi 'phro ba dang rab tu rnam par 'byed pa de dag la brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab ces bya ba'i sems las byung ba rnams dbang bas na /
translated: Since effort, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom are dominant in those four‚Äîapplication, nonforgetting, nondistraction, and thorough differentiation‚Äî

original: dbang po rnams zhes bya bar gyur zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dbang po rnams zhes bya bar gyur zhes zer ro //
translated: they are called faculties.

original: 'dir ni ji skad du bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni ji skad du bshad par bya ste /
translated: Here, we should explain this as follows:

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang ma bskyed pa gnyis kyi dus na 'dun pa la sogs pa dbang byed pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa rang bzhin du bye brag tu gyur pa gang yang med de /
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang ma bskyed pa gnyis kyi dus na 'dun pa la sogs pa dbang byed pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa rang bzhin du bye brag tu gyur pa gang yang med de /
translated: When one has and has not generated the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation, there is no difference in the nature of aspiration and so on, which are dominant, and faith and so on, which are natural.

original: 'di ltar de'i dus na dbang byed pas de dag dbang por rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i dus na dbang byed pas de dag dbang por rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, they are established as faculties because they control at that time.

original: dad pa la sogs pa de dag nyid stobs dang ldan par gyur pa la stobs rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa de dag nyid stobs dang ldan par gyur pa la stobs rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: Those very faith, etc., when they become powerful are called powers.

original: dbang po'i 'og tu bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i 'og tu bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are explained immediately after the faculties.

original: de dag stobs ldan ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir / mi mthun phyogs ni bsrabs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de dag stobs ldan ji lta bu zhe na / de'i phyir / mi mthun phyogs ni bsrabs pa'i phyir //
translated: How are they powerful?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Because their resistance is diminished.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs srab mor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs srab mor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the resistance to faith, etc., is diminished.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgang gi tshe de dag nyid ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir / gang gi tshe de dag nyid ces bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:üîΩWhen they are not overpowered by their resistant tendencies,

original: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams so //
translated: the faculties of faith, etc.,üîΩare called powers.

original: ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams zhes bya ba ni ma dad pa dang le lo dang brjed pa dang g-yeng ba dang shes bzhin med pa rnams so//
analyzed: ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams zhes bya ba ni ma dad pa dang le lo dang brjed pa dang g-yeng ba dang shes bzhin med pa rnams so//
translated: The resistant tendencies to faith, etc., are lack of faith, laziness, forgetfulness, distraction, and lack of full awareness.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams dang / dad pa la sogs pa mi 'dre ba ni rab tu srab pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams dang / dad pa la sogs pa mi 'dre ba ni rab tu srab pa'i phyir te /
translated: The faculties are not mixed with their counteragents, faith, etc., because they are very weak.

original: skabs skabs su kun du 'byung ba med pas na skabs mi thod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skabs skabs su kun du 'byung ba med pas na skabs mi thod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are not mixed because they do not occur from time to time.

original: de'i tshe na stobs rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe na stobs rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: At that time they are called powers.

original: de'i tshe na ni de dag gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma bsrabs pas dbang po de dag mi mthun pa'i phyir rnams dang 'dre'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe na ni de dag gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma bsrabs pas dbang po de dag mi mthun pa'i phyir rnams dang 'dre'o //
translated: At that time, since their counteragents are not yet weak, the faculties are not mixed with their counteragents.

original: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams ma thul bar dbang po rnams zhes bya na //
analyzed: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams ma thul bar dbang po rnams zhes bya na //
translated: If the faculties are not called faculties when their counteragents are not subdued,

original: ji ltar mkhas pa'i de kho na nyid las 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa'i dbang gis dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang por bshad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar mkhas pa'i de kho na nyid las 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa'i dbang gis dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang por bshad ce na /
translated: how is it that the S≈´tra declares that faith, etc. are faculties in worldly people because of their supremacy in worldly purity?

original: der ni dbang po @276a * //
analyzed: der ni dbang po @276a * //
translated: There, the faculties

original: rnams la bye brag med par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rnams la bye brag med par dgongs pa'o //
translated: are intended without distinction.

original: 'dir ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir bye brag yod de /
analyzed: 'dir ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir bye brag yod de /
translated: Here, however, the distinction is taught in terms of the roots of good that are conducive to penetration.

original: de bas na 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de bas na 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction.

original: de'i phyir / 'dir dbang po de dag nyid stobs rnams zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'dir dbang po de dag nyid stobs rnams zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that these very faculties are the powers.

original: dad par gyur pa de rgyu dang 'bras bu la brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
analyzed: dad par gyur pa de rgyu dang 'bras bu la brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
translated: One who has faith in cause and effect initiates vigor.

original: 'bras bu 'di nyid kyi rgyu ni 'di'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'di nyid kyi rgyu ni 'di'o //
translated: This is the cause of that effect.üîΩThis is the effect of that cause.

original: rgyu 'di nyid kyi 'bras bu ni 'di'o zhes de ltar dad par gyur pa ni 'bras bu la dad pas de'i rgyu la brtsan 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: rgyu 'di nyid kyi 'bras bu ni 'di'o zhes de ltar dad par gyur pa ni 'bras bu la dad pas de'i rgyu la brtsan 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: One who has such faith in the effect initiates vigor in its cause.

original: brtson 'grus brtsoms  pa ni dran pa nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsoms  pa ni dran pa nye bar gnas so //
translated: One who has initiated vigor establishes mindfulness.

original: dran pa nye bar gnas pa ni g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir sems mnyam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gnas pa ni g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir sems mnyam par 'jog ste /
translated: One who has established mindfulness places the mind in equipoise because of non-distraction.

original: rtse gcig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtse gcig par 'gyur ro //
translated: It becomes one-pointed.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: One who has placed the mind in equipoise understands reality just as it is.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis rjes su bzung ba'i shes rab ni gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis rjes su bzung ba'i shes rab ni gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Wisdom that is sustained by concentration becomes clear.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa bskyed zin pa la dbang po rnams bstan na thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i 'og tu ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams dang dbang po rnams kyi 'og tu ni stobs rnams bstan na de'i phyir /üîΩnges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyi dbang po'i dus na rig par bya ba'am /
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa bskyed zin pa la dbang po rnams bstan na thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i 'og tu ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams dang dbang po rnams kyi 'og tu ni stobs rnams bstan na de'i phyir / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyi dbang po'i dus na rig par bya ba'am /
translated: If the faculties are taught to those who have already generated the factors conducive to liberation, then after the factors conducive to liberation, the factors conducive to penetrative insight are taught, and after the faculties, the powers are taught.

original: 'on te stobs kyi dus la rig par bya /
analyzed: 'on te stobs kyi dus la rig par bya /
translated: Therefore it must be stated whether the factors conducive to penetrative insight are to be known at the time of the faculties or at the time of the powers.

original: de bzhin du nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyi dbang po dang stobs kyi rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: de bzhin du nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyi dbang po dang stobs kyi rang bzhin nam /
translated: Similarly, it must be stated whether the factors conducive to penetrative insight are by nature the faculties and powers

original: 'on te de las gzhan pa'i rang bzhin yin pa brjod dgos te /üîΩde'i phyir / dbang po rnams dang stobs rnams la //üîΩnges 'byed cha mthun gnyis gnyis so //
analyzed: 'on te de las gzhan pa'i rang bzhin yin pa brjod dgos te / de'i phyir / dbang po rnams dang stobs rnams la // nges 'byed cha mthun gnyis gnyis so //
translated: or whether they are by nature something other than those.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore it is said:üîΩThe factors conducive to penetrative insightüîΩare the faculties and powers.

original: yang na ji ltar thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams gnyen po rnams bsgoms nas rab tu phye ba'am /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams gnyen po rnams bsgoms nas rab tu phye ba'am /
translated: Or else, just as those that are factors conducive to liberation are distinguished by cultivating the antidotes,

original: dad pa la sogs pas rab tu phye bar gyur pa de ltar nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pas rab tu phye bar gyur pa de ltar nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyang ngo //
translated: so too the factors conducive to penetrative insight are distinguished by faith and so on.üîΩTherefore, after generating the factors conducive to liberation, the faculties are taught.

original: de'i phyir thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa bskyed zin nas dbang po rnams bstan na zhes bya bya rgya cher smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa bskyed zin nas dbang po rnams bstan na zhes bya bya rgya cher smos so //
translated: Thus it is said:

original: de'i phyir / nges 'byed cha mthun gnyis gnyis so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / nges 'byed cha mthun gnyis gnyis so //
translated: Two pairs and two single [faculties] are the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: zhes bya ba thams cad gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba thams cad gsungs so //
translated: Thus all are mentioned.

original: dro bar gyur pa rnams dang rtse mo dag gi tshe ni dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa rnams dang rtse mo dag gi tshe ni dbang po rnams so //
translated: At the time of heat and summits, they are the faculties.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag chung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag chung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because those roots of virtue are small.

original: de dag rnams su mi rigs pas de dag dbang po nyid do //
analyzed: de dag rnams su mi rigs pas de dag dbang po nyid do //
translated: They are not suitable at that time, so they are faculties.üîΩAt the time of the acceptances and supreme mundane qualities, they are the powers.

original: bzod @276b da  dag dang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams kyi tshe ni stobs rnams so zhes bya ba ni de dag che ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bzod @276b da  dag dang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams kyi tshe ni stobs rnams so zhes bya ba ni de dag che ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are great.

original: bzod pa dang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog de dag ni dbang po rnams su mi rigs kyi stobs rnams nyid do //
analyzed: bzod pa dang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog de dag ni dbang po rnams su mi rigs kyi stobs rnams nyid do //
translated: Patience and the supreme mundane qualities are not the faculties, but rather the powers.üîΩFaith, etc., are threefold, weak, medium, and strong.

original: chung ngu dang 'bring po dang chen po'i bye brag gis dang ba la sogs pa ni rnam pa gsum mo / de la chung ngu dang 'bring po dag ni dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: chung ngu dang 'bring po dang chen po'i bye brag gis dang ba la sogs pa ni rnam pa gsum mo / de la chung ngu dang 'bring po dag ni dbang po rnams so //
translated: The weak and medium are the faculties;

original: chen po dag ni stobs rnams so //üîΩchung ngu gang yin pa dag ni dro bar gyur pa rnams so //
analyzed: chen po dag ni stobs rnams so // chung ngu gang yin pa dag ni dro bar gyur pa rnams so //
translated: the strong are the powers.üîΩThe weak and medium are the weak and medium heats.

original: 'bring po dag ni rtse mo rnams so //
analyzed: 'bring po dag ni rtse mo rnams so //
translated: The strong are the summits.

original: chen po la yang bzhir dbye ste /
analyzed: chen po la yang bzhir dbye ste /
translated: The strong are divided into four types.

original: de la chung ngu dang 'bring po dang chen po rnams ni bzod pa chung ngu dang 'bring po dang chen po dag go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de la chung ngu dang 'bring po dang chen po rnams ni bzod pa chung ngu dang 'bring po dang chen po dag go rims bzhin no //
translated: The weak, medium, and strong of the strong are the weak, medium, and strong patiences, respectively.

original: chen po'i yang chen po dag ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams so //
analyzed: chen po'i yang chen po dag ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams so //
translated: The great of the strong are the supreme mundane qualities.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'di dag thams cad ni ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'di dag thams cad ni ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: All of these are by nature meditative concentration and wisdom,

original: mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: together with their associated factors.

original: de la dro ba'i rnam pa ni dro bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de la dro ba'i rnam pa ni dro bar gyur pa ste /
translated: The stage of heat is so called because it is like heat,

original: dper na gtsub shing gtsubs pa las shing tshig par nus pa'i me'i mtshan ma thog mar byung ba ni dro bar 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: dper na gtsub shing gtsubs pa las shing tshig par nus pa'i me'i mtshan ma thog mar byung ba ni dro bar 'byung ba'o //
translated: just as when wood is rubbed together and the sign of fire‚Äôs initial production is the appearance of heat.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa'i lam gyi mes nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi shing sreg par nus pa'i thog ma'i rang bzhin yin pas dro bar gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa'i lam gyi mes nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi shing sreg par nus pa'i thog ma'i rang bzhin yin pas dro bar gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the stage of heat is the initial nature of the ability of the fire of the noble path to burn away all the wood of the passions.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba rnams las rtse mor phyin pas na rtse mo'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba rnams las rtse mor phyin pas na rtse mo'o //
translated: The stage of the summit is so called because it is the culmination of the unstable roots of virtue.

original: bden pa'i don la rab tu bzod pas na bzod pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa'i don la rab tu bzod pas na bzod pa'o //
translated: The stage of tolerance is so called because one is able to tolerate the meaning of the truths.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa yang yin la /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa yang yin la /
translated: It is both with and without impurity.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos gzhan pas dam pa yin pas na 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos gzhan pas dam pa yin pas na 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called the supreme mundane factors because they are superior to other defiled factors.

original: de ma thag tu mthong ba'i lam skye bas na de dag mchog ces bya ste /
analyzed: de ma thag tu mthong ba'i lam skye bas na de dag mchog ces bya ste /
translated: They are called supreme because the path of insight arises immediately after them.

original: de dag ni skad cig pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni skad cig pa'o //
translated: They are momentary.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa lhag ma rnams ni rgyun can no //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa lhag ma rnams ni rgyun can no //
translated: The remaining factors conducive to penetration are continuous.

original: de la thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni 'khor bar rab tu skye ba'i mthu 'joms pa'i tshul du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni 'khor bar rab tu skye ba'i mthu 'joms pa'i tshul du rig par bya'o //
translated: In this regard, the roots of the wholesome that are conducive to liberation should be understood as the power to destroy the ability of samsara to arise.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i zag pa med pa'i chos 'byung ba'i mthu skyed pa'i tshul du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i zag pa med pa'i chos 'byung ba'i mthu skyed pa'i tshul du rig par bya ste /
translated: The factors conducive to penetration should be understood as the power to generate the ability for the arising of the uncontaminated factors.

original: chos kyi mchog gi 'og tu mthong ba'i lam 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog gi 'og tu mthong ba'i lam 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the path of insight arises immediately after the supreme factors.

original: de yang byang chub kyi yan lag gis rab tu phye ba'i phyir stobs kyi 'og tu byang chub kyi yan lag @277a * //üîΩrnams bshad do //
analyzed: de yang byang chub kyi yan lag gis rab tu phye ba'i phyir stobs kyi 'og tu byang chub kyi yan lag @277a * //üîΩrnams bshad do //
translated: And because it is distinguished by the limbs of enlightenment, the limbs of enlightenment are explained after the powers.

original: de dag ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir rnam par gzhag ces bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir rnam par gzhag ces bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: What is the purpose of their establishment?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / rang bzhin yan lag gnas yan lag / ces rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rang bzhin yan lag gnas yan lag / ces rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: The limbs of nature and the limbs of practice.

original: ma blong ba'i lam la byang chub kyi yan lag tu gyur pa dag ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams so zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid ma mthong ba las de thog ma nyid du mthong ba'i phyir mthong ba'o //
analyzed: ma blong ba'i lam la byang chub kyi yan lag tu gyur pa dag ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams so zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid ma mthong ba las de thog ma nyid du mthong ba'i phyir mthong ba'o //
translated: The limbs of enlightenment are those factors that are the limbs of enlightenment on the unadorned path.

original: 'phags pa'i sar phyin par byed pa'i phyir lam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i sar phyin par byed pa'i phyir lam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The path is so called because it causes one to reach the stage of the noble one.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba'i lam zhes bya ba'o //üîΩnges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i tshe na ni dar las chod pa lta bur bden pa rnams rtogs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba'i lam zhes bya ba'o // nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i tshe na ni dar las chod pa lta bur bden pa rnams rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called the path of insight.üîΩAt the time of the aids to insight, one comprehends the truths as if from a distance.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi tshe na ni de bsal ba lta bur rtogs so //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi tshe na ni de bsal ba lta bur rtogs so //
translated: At the time of the path of insight, one comprehends them as if they were right in one‚Äôs hand.

original: de la de kho na mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de la de kho na mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The enlightenment of thatness is nonconceptual intuition.

original: de la dran pa la sogs pa drug ni byang chub dang mthun pa'i phyir de'i yan lag rnams so //
analyzed: de la dran pa la sogs pa drug ni byang chub dang mthun pa'i phyir de'i yan lag rnams so //
translated: The six beginning with mindfulness are its members because they are conducive to enlightenment.

original: chos rnam par 'byed pa ni rtogs pa'i bdag nyid pas na byang chub ste /
analyzed: chos rnam par 'byed pa ni rtogs pa'i bdag nyid pas na byang chub ste /
translated: The discernment of the teaching is enlightenment because it is the nature of realization.

original: de dag gis grogs su gyur pas cha yan lag go //
analyzed: de dag gis grogs su gyur pas cha yan lag go //
translated: Since they are its auxiliaries, they are its members.

original: gzhan na re bar chad med pa'i lam du gtogs pa'i chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: gzhan na re bar chad med pa'i lam du gtogs pa'i chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag go //
translated: Others say: The discernment of the teaching belonging to the uninterrupted path is the member of enlightenment.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam du gtogs pa ni byang chub ces bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam du gtogs pa ni byang chub ces bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: That belonging to the path of liberation is called enlightenment.

original: de la dran pa ni byang chub kyi gnas kyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: de la dran pa ni byang chub kyi gnas kyi yan lag ste /
translated: Among them, mindfulness is the member of enlightenment as foundation,

original: dran pa'i stobs kyis dmigs pa de las mi g-yeng ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa'i stobs kyis dmigs pa de las mi g-yeng ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because through the power of mindfulness, one is not distracted from that meditative object.

original: chos rnam par 'byed pa ni rang bzhin gyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: chos rnam par 'byed pa ni rang bzhin gyi yan lag ste /
translated: The discernment of the teaching is the member of enlightenment as nature,

original: byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the essence of enlightenment.

original: brtson 'grus ni nges par 'byung ba'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni nges par 'byung ba'i yan lag ste /
translated: Effort is the limb of definite emergence,

original: brtson 'grus kyis so so'i skye bo'i sa las shin tu 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis so so'i skye bo'i sa las shin tu 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because through effort one passes completely beyond the stage of the ordinary person.

original: dga' ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: dga' ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag ste /
translated: Joy is the limb of benefit,

original: des lus dang sems la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrnam pa gsum ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: des lus dang sems la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro // rnam pa gsum ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: because it benefits body and mind.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang btang snyoms so //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang btang snyoms so //
translated: The three, serenity, concentration, and equanimity, are the limbs of non-affliction.

original: de dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the limbs of non-affliction because they are the antidotes to affliction.

original: yang na nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi dang / gnas dang / ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi dang / gnas dang / ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, the three are taught as the limbs of non-affliction because the basis, the abode, and the essence of non-affliction are distinct.üîΩWhy are the three limbs of non-affliction taught?

original: ci'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag rnam pa gsum bstan zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir rnam pa gsum @277b du bshad snyam du bsams pa ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag rnam pa gsum bstan zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir rnam pa gsum @277b du bshad snyam du bsams pa ste /
translated: Why are the three taught as the limbs of non-affliction?

original: de'i phyir / 'di la gzhi dang gnas dang ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'di la gzhi dang gnas dang ni //
translated: The basis, the abode, and the essence of non-affliction are distinct.

original: ngo bo nyid du bstan pa yin //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du bstan pa yin //
translated: Are taught to be the essence.üîΩ

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is taught as the nature itself.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi ste /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi ste /
translated: Lightness is the basis of non-affliction.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ni rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ni rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Non-affliction is purification.

original: gzhi ni rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gzhi ni rgyu yin no //
translated: The basis is the cause.

original: ji ltar gzhi zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhi zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How is it the basis?

original: de'i phyir / kun nas nyon mongs pa ni gnas ngan len gyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir de ni de'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / kun nas nyon mongs pa ni gnas ngan len gyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir de ni de'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that affliction arises from the cause of negative plasticity, and that is its antidote.

original: de ni 'di skad du kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is taught as follows: Because it is the antidote to the basis of affliction, it is the basis of non-affliction.

original: lus dang sems las su mi rung ba nyid ni gnas ngan len zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lus dang sems las su mi rung ba nyid ni gnas ngan len zhes bya ste /
translated: Negative plasticity is called the unserviceability of body and mind.

original: de yod na sems rtse gcig pa med pa'i phyir sems g-yengs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yod na sems rtse gcig pa med pa'i phyir sems g-yengs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When it exists, the mind is distracted because there is no single-pointedness of mind.

original: sems g-yengs pa la 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung ste /üîΩde ltar gnas pa na len ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sems g-yengs pa la 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung ste / de ltar gnas pa na len ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The afflictions such as passion arise in a distracted mind.üîΩThus, when it is in a state of distraction, it is the cause of affliction.

original: gnas ngan len de'i gnyen po ni shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan len de'i gnyen po ni shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
translated: The antidote to that is serenity.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: shin tu sbyangs pas na lus dang sems gnyis las su rung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pas na lus dang sems gnyis las su rung bar 'gyur te /
translated: When there is serenity, the body and mind become fit.

original: de ltar na shin tu sbyangs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhir rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar na shin tu sbyangs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhir rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, serenity is posited as the basis of non-affliction.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni gnas so zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems gnyis shin tu sbyangs pas rjes su bzung bas na sems mnyam par 'jog go //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni gnas so zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems gnyis shin tu sbyangs pas rjes su bzung bas na sems mnyam par 'jog go //
translated: Concentration is the basis. When the body and mind are fit by being taken care of with serenity, the mind becomes concentrated.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: When the mind is concentrated, one knows and sees things as they really are.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong bas nyon mongs pa rnams spong ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong bas nyon mongs pa rnams spong ste /
translated: When one sees things as they really are, one abandons the afflictions.

original: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gnas ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gnas ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Thus, concentration is the basis of the absence of defilement.üîΩEquanimity is the essential nature.

original: btang snyoms ni ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba ni gnas pa kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa dang mthun pa'i sems mi mnyam pa dang / sems rnal du mi 'jug pa dang / sems rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba ni gnas pa kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa dang mthun pa'i sems mi mnyam pa dang / sems rnal du mi 'jug pa dang / sems rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the antidote to the mind that is not in equipoise, the mind that is not in a natural state, and the mind that is accompanied by effort, which are conducive to the defilement of stability.

original: de ltar na btang snyoms ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //üîΩgzhan na de spong ba'i lam rnams kyis mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pas nyon mongs pa'i rjes su 'ching ba dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i rnam par grol ba'i @278a * //
analyzed: de ltar na btang snyoms ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid do // gzhan na de spong ba'i lam rnams kyis mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pas nyon mongs pa'i rjes su 'ching ba dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i rnam par grol ba'i @278a * //
translated: Thus, equanimity is the essential nature of the absence of defilement.üîΩIn other scriptures, equanimity is described as the wisdom that is included in the path of liberation and that is free from the bonds of the defilements that are to be abandoned by the path of vision.

original: lam du gtogs pa'i shes rab shes bya la nges pa skye ba de 'dir btang snyoms zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lam du gtogs pa'i shes rab shes bya la nges pa skye ba de 'dir btang snyoms zhes bya ste /
translated: It is the wisdom that is generated with regard to the knowable in the path of liberation that is pure by nature, free from the bonds of the defilements that are to be abandoned by the path of vision.

original: dgos pa byas pa'i phyir zad pa la zad do snyam du btang snyoms su byed pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: dgos pa byas pa'i phyir zad pa la zad do snyam du btang snyoms su byed pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: because one is indifferent to the exhaustion of the latter, thinking: ‚ÄúI have done what was to be done. ‚Äù

original: byang chub kyi yan lag gi 'og tu lam gyi yan lag rnams te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag gi 'og tu lam gyi yan lag rnams te /
translated: The limbs of the path are immediately after the limbs of enlightenment.

original: de dag ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi 'og tu bsgom pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi 'og tu bsgom pa'i lam ste /
translated: How are they respectively determined? The path of meditative development is immediately after the path of vision.

original: de la lam gyi yan lag rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la lam gyi yan lag rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: The limbs of the path are described in relation to that.

original: de'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag gi 'og tu lam gyi yan lag rnams brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag gi 'og tu lam gyi yan lag rnams brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the limbs of the path are mentioned immediately after the limbs of enlightenment.

original: de dag gang gi don du rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: de dag gang gi don du rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: For whose sake are they respectively determined?

original: de'i phyir / yongs su gcod dang go byed dang // zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / yongs su gcod dang go byed dang // zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: Hence he says: for the sake of complete discernment, for the sake of the act of convincing others, etc.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs log par lta ba nas mi mthun pa'i phyogs log pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar gyis yang dag par lta ba la sogs pa lam gyi yan lag brgyad po dag go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs log par lta ba nas mi mthun pa'i phyogs log pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar gyis yang dag par lta ba la sogs pa lam gyi yan lag brgyad po dag go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The limbs of the path, beginning with correct view, are respectively determined in relation to the counteragents, i.e. from wrong view up until wrong meditative concentration.

original: yang de dag gi go rims ni byed pa'i rim gyis te /
analyzed: yang de dag gi go rims ni byed pa'i rim gyis te /
translated: Moreover, their order is according to the order of their performance.

original: bsgom pa'i lam zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: The path of meditative development is to be cultivated through meditative development.

original: brten par bsgom pas bsgom par bya ba yin pas na bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: brten par bsgom pas bsgom par bya ba yin pas na bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: It is the path of meditative development because it is to be cultivated through meditative development which is based on the latter.

original: bsgom pa'i lam de la mthong ba'i lam thob par bsgom pas bsgom pa yongs su gcod pa'i yan lag ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam de la mthong ba'i lam thob par bsgom pas bsgom pa yongs su gcod pa'i yan lag ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: The limb of the elimination of what is to be relinquished through meditative development on the path of meditative development is right view.

original: 'jig rten pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i //

original: de 'byung ba'i mthu rnyed pas lam la mnyam par gzhag na yang de rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de 'byung ba'i mthu rnyed pas lam la mnyam par gzhag na yang de rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Since it is attained through the power of that, it is also established when one is concentrated on the path.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o //üîΩrnam par mi rtog par gyur kyang yang dag par lta ba'i gnas su gyur pas na /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o // rnam par mi rtog par gyur kyang yang dag par lta ba'i gnas su gyur pas na /

original: yang dag par lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par lta ba zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes las thob pa zhes smos te /

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa mthong ba'i lam gyi rjes las thob pa ni skyes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa mthong ba'i lam gyi rjes las thob pa ni skyes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: de'i yul gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i yul gang zhe na /

original: de'i phyir des rang gis rtogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir des rang gis rtogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //

analyzed: de 'byung ba'i mthu rnyed pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa na yang de gnyis dang ldan par rig par bya'i /

analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang las kyi 'tsho ba'o //

analyzed: gzhan la rnam par rig byed 'dod //üîΩces bya ba smos te /
translated: One should know that the three, view, morality, and few desires, are the three branches that cause others to believe.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: The wise person who is skilled in the means of yoga is endowed with the three forms of wisdom.üîΩThe three forms of wisdom are: the wisdom that arises from the teaching, the wisdom that arises from thinking, and the wisdom that arises from cultivating the mind.üîΩThe wisdom that arises from the teaching is the wisdom that arises from listening to the teachings of the scriptures.üîΩThe wisdom that arises from thinking is the wisdom that arises from reflection on the meaning of the scriptures.üîΩThe wisdom that arises from cultivating the mind is the wisdom that arises from meditation on the meaning of the scriptures.üîΩThe wise person who is skilled in the means of yoga is endowed with these three forms of wisdom.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag gis zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la //üîΩbsnyad pa zhes bya ba ni chos bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag gis zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la // bsnyad pa zhes bya ba ni chos bstan pa'o //

original: 'brel ba'i gtam rnam par nges pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'brel ba'i gtam rnam par nges pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The wisdom that arises from cultivating the mind is the wisdom that arises from meditation on the meaning of the scriptures.üîΩThe wise person who is skilled in the means of yoga is endowed with these three forms of wisdom.üîΩThe wise person who is skilled in the means of yoga is endowed with the three forms of wisdom.

original: mngon par rtogs pa las brtsams nas gzhan dag la rgol zhing lan 'debs pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa las brtsams nas gzhan dag la rgol zhing lan 'debs pa ste /
translated: The three forms of wisdom are: the wisdom that arises from the teaching, the wisdom that arises from thinking, and the wisdom that arises from cultivating the mind.üîΩThe wisdom that arises from the teaching is the wisdom that arises from listening to the teachings of the scriptures.üîΩThe wisdom that arises from thinking is the wisdom that arises from reflection on the meaning of the scriptures.üîΩThe wisdom that arises from cultivating the mind is the wisdom that arises from meditation on the meaning of the scriptures.

original: bsnyad pa dang 'brel ba'i gtam rnam par nges pa 'dis ni 'di ltar 'di thogs pa med pa dang / don shin tu gtan la phab pa dang 'gal ba med pa dang don gsal ba brjod pa las na 'dis de kho na nges par rtogs so zhes shes rab la gzhan dag yid ches par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsnyad pa dang 'brel ba'i gtam rnam par nges pa 'dis ni 'di ltar 'di thogs pa med pa dang / don shin tu gtan la phab pa dang 'gal ba med pa dang don gsal ba brjod pa las na 'dis de kho na nges par rtogs so zhes shes rab la gzhan dag yid ches par 'gyur ro //
translated: The wise person who is skilled in the means of yoga is endowed with these three forms of wisdom.

original: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni tshul khrims la ste zhes bya ba ni yid ches par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni tshul khrims la ste zhes bya ba ni yid ches par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The wise person who is skilled in the means of yoga is endowed with the three forms of wisdom.

original: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: The three forms of wisdom are: the wisdom that arises from the teaching, the wisdom that arises from thinking, and the wisdom that

original: bya ba ma yin pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: because he does not do what should not be done.

original: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni nyes par spyod pa dang mi mthun pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni nyes par spyod pa dang mi mthun pa ste /
translated: Right action is the opposite of misconduct.

original: de'i phyir de dang ldan na srog gi phyir yang bya ba ma yin pa mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dang ldan na srog gi phyir yang bya ba ma yin pa mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, when one possesses it, one does not do what should not be done even for the sake of one's life.

original: de'i phyir 'dir ni 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan no zhes yid ches pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir ni 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan no zhes yid ches pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, here it is said that one possesses morality which delights the noble ones.

original: yang dag pa'i 'tsho bas ni yo byad @279a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho bas ni yo byad @279a * //
translated: Right livelihood is the opposite of wrong livelihood.

original: bsnyungs pa la ste zhes bya ba ni yid ches par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bsnyungs pa la ste zhes bya ba ni yid ches par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should understand that it is the opposite of wrong livelihood.

original: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: How so? Therefore it is said:

original: chos kyis gos la sogs pa tshod zin par tshol ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: chos kyis gos la sogs pa tshod zin par tshol ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: because one seeks robes, etc. in accordance with the Dharma, to the proper extent.

original: 'tsho ba'i yo byad kyi phyir tshul 'chos pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa med pa'i lus dang ngag gis kun du spyod pa ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ste /
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i yo byad kyi phyir tshul 'chos pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa med pa'i lus dang ngag gis kun du spyod pa ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ste /
translated: Right livelihood is the conduct of body and speech which is free from the faults of hypocrisy, etc. for the sake of the requisites of livelihood.

original: des 'di ltar 'di ni lus gnas pa tsam du bya ba'i phyir rigs pa dang tshod zin par chos gos la sogs pa tshol bas na gdon mi za bar 'di ni yo byad rnams la sred pa spangs so zhes yo byad bsnyungs par yid ches par 'gyur ro
analyzed: des 'di ltar 'di ni lus gnas pa tsam du bya ba'i phyir rigs pa dang tshod zin par chos gos la sogs pa tshol bas na gdon mi za bar 'di ni yo byad rnams la sred pa spangs so zhes yo byad bsnyungs par yid ches par 'gyur ro
translated: Thus, he is convinced that he has certainly abandoned craving for the necessities, since he seeks robes, etc. only to the extent that is suitable and proper, just for the sake of maintaining his body.

original: // de la yang dag pa'i lta bas ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: // de la yang dag pa'i lta bas ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal med par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, he is without conceit due to right view,

original: rang gi rtog pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rtog pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he knows his own thoughts just as they are.

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pas kun nas bslang ba'i tshig gis ni seng ge'i sgra sgrog go //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pas kun nas bslang ba'i tshig gis ni seng ge'i sgra sgrog go //
translated: He roars the lion‚Äôs roar with speech that is motivated by right thought.

analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang ; 'tsho ba rnams kyis ni rang gis dam bcas pa yang dag par brjod do //
translated: He proclaims his own vow with right speech, right action, and right livelihood.

original: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po'i yan lag rnam gsum mi shes nas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po'i yan lag rnam gsum mi shes nas de'i phyir /
translated: Here, one should understand that the three branches of antidotes to the adverse elements are:

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang dran ba dang ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang dran ba dang ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.

original: de dag kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang gi gnyen po yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang gi gnyen po yin zhe na /
translated: What are the antidotes to the resistances to those?
