analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni go rims bzhin du / nyon mongs nye ba'i nyon mongs dbang //
translated: Therefore it is said:üîΩThey are antidotes to the resistances

original: mi mthun phyogs kyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs kyi gnyen po'o //
translated: of defilement, secondary defilement,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: and the small.

original: de la dang po'i gnyen po ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la dang po'i gnyen po ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therein, the antidote to the first is right effort.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang po ste /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang po ste /
translated: The first resistance is the defilements that are to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: de'i gnyen po ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba'o //üîΩji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba'o // ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Its antidote is right effort.üîΩHow so? Therefore it is said:

original: des zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: des zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: By it,

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol bas lam bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol bas lam bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the cultivation of the path by right effort.

original: bying ba dang rgod pa dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dus kyi brtson 'grus yang dag pa'i lta bas bsdus pa ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ste /
analyzed: bying ba dang rgod pa dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dus kyi brtson 'grus yang dag pa'i lta bas bsdus pa ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ste /
translated: Right effort is the effort of the time of samadhi free from laxity and excitement, and it is included in right view.

original: des bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir de'i gnyen po lam bsgom mo //
analyzed: des bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir de'i gnyen po lam bsgom mo //
translated: Because of that, one cultivates the path that is the antidote to the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: de'i phyir yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgrub pas yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni dang po'i gnyen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgrub pas yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni dang po'i gnyen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, right effort is called the antidote to the first because it accomplishes right samadhi.

original: lam bsgom pa de nyid la gnyis pa @279b nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bying ba dang rgod pa'i mtshan nyid ni yang dag pa'i dran pa ste zhes bya ba ni gnyen po zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: lam bsgom pa de nyid la gnyis pa @279b nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bying ba dang rgod pa'i mtshan nyid ni yang dag pa'i dran pa ste zhes bya ba ni gnyen po zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: In that cultivation of the path, right mindfulness is the antidote to the second, the characteristics of laxity and excitement.

original: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: How is that?

original: zhi gnas la sogs pa'i rgyu rnams la dran pa shin tu nye bar gnas pas bying ba dang rgod pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhi gnas la sogs pa'i rgyu rnams la dran pa shin tu nye bar gnas pas bying ba dang rgod pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because laxity and excitement are absent due to the extreme stability of mindfulness of the causes of shamatha and so on.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu dang / btang snyoms kyi rgyu yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu dang / btang snyoms kyi rgyu yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù should be understood to indicate the cause of equanimity.

original: de la g-yeng ba'i rgyu nye bar zhi bar byed pas zhi gnas so //
analyzed: de la g-yeng ba'i rgyu nye bar zhi bar byed pas zhi gnas so //
translated: Among these, serenity is the cause of non-distraction.

original: zhi gnas la sogs pa'i rgyu ni zhi gnas la sogs pa'i byed rgyu'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas la sogs pa'i rgyu ni zhi gnas la sogs pa'i byed rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of serenity and so on is the efficient cause of serenity and so on.

original: de la sems rgod pa'am rgod du dogs pa zhig tu gyur na /
analyzed: de la sems rgod pa'am rgod du dogs pa zhig tu gyur na /
translated: If your mind is excited or you fear it will become excited,

original: skyo bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po yid la byed pa ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu'o //üîΩsems bying ba'am /
analyzed: skyo bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po yid la byed pa ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu'o // sems bying ba'am /
translated: then attend to an object that induces serenity.

original: bying du dogs pa zhig tu gyur na /
analyzed: bying du dogs pa zhig tu gyur na /
translated: If your mind is lax or you fear it will become lax,

original: mngon par dga' bar gyur pa'i dngos po yid la byed pa ni rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: mngon par dga' bar gyur pa'i dngos po yid la byed pa ni rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: then attend to an object that induces full awareness.

original: zhi gnas la gcig tu nges pa'i lam mam /
analyzed: zhi gnas la gcig tu nges pa'i lam mam /
translated: The path is either exclusively the serenity side,

original: lhag mthong la gcig tu nges pa'am /
analyzed: lhag mthong la gcig tu nges pa'am /
translated: or exclusively the insight side,

original: zung du 'brel bas 'jug pa'ang rung ste /
analyzed: zung du 'brel bas 'jug pa'ang rung ste /
translated: or else it is the union of the two.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de gnyis kyis nye bar nyon mongs par gyur pa la lhun gyis grub pa yid la byed pa ni btang snyoms kyi rgyu'o //üîΩmngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi rang bzhin gyi dbang 'byor ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang yin pa ni /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de gnyis kyis nye bar nyon mongs par gyur pa la lhun gyis grub pa yid la byed pa ni btang snyoms kyi rgyu'o // mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi rang bzhin gyi dbang 'byor ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang yin pa ni /
translated: The cause of equanimity is the spontaneous mental attention to the afflictedness of those two secondary mental afflictions.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa'i rang bzhin nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa'i rang bzhin nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa'o //
translated: The obscuration to mastery, which has the nature of the spiritual qualities such as the superknowledges, is the nonafflictive nescience that is an obscuration to meditative absorption.

original: gsum pa ni de'i yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te gnyen po zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gsum pa ni de'i yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te gnyen po zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The third is the correct meditative concentration that is the antidote to that.

original: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: How is that?

original: bsam gtan la gnas nas mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: bsam gtan la gnas nas mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause one who is established in meditative absorption accomplishes the spiritual qualities such as the superknowledges.‚Äù

original: bsam gtan ni yon tan khyad par can thams cad mngon par bsgrub pa'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan ni yon tan khyad par can thams cad mngon par bsgrub pa'i gnas yin te /
translated: Meditative absorption is the basis for the accomplishment of all the special spiritual qualities.

original: de bas na mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan mngon par sgrub pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa ni /üîΩsnyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de bas na mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan mngon par sgrub pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa ni / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: The correct effort is the favorable condition for the attainment of the higher knowledges and so on.

original: de bas na de ltar yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba ston to //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba ston to //
translated: Therefore, the correct effort is taught as the freedom from the obscurations of the afflictions.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pas ni ting nge 'dzin yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pas ni ting nge 'dzin yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The correct mindfulness is the complete purity of meditative concentration.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The correct meditative concentration is the freedom from the obscurations of meditative absorption.

original: gnyen po bsgom pa mdor bsdus na rnam pa gsum du rig @280a * //üîΩpar bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyen po bsgom pa mdor bsdus na rnam pa gsum du rig @280a * // par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The cultivation of the antidotes should be understood in brief as threefold.

original: rtsom pa dang thob pa dang grub pa'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: rtsom pa dang thob pa dang grub pa'i bye brag gis so //
translated: This is because of the differences in undertaking, attainment, and accomplishment.

original: rgyas par byas na rnam pa du ma yod do //
analyzed: rgyas par byas na rnam pa du ma yod do //
translated: If it is done extensively, there are many aspects.

original: de ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta zhe na /
translated: What are they?üîΩIn accordance, distorted,

original: rjes su mthun la phyin ci log / ces rgya cher 'byung ba de la /
analyzed: rjes su mthun la phyin ci log / ces rgya cher 'byung ba de la /
translated: and so on.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i rjes su mthun pa la phyin ci log pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i rjes su mthun pa la phyin ci log pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The conformity to the non-erroneous is called the erroneous.

original: phyin ci ma log pa ni mthong ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa ni mthong ba'i lam ste /
translated: The non-erroneous is the path of insight,

original: de kho na yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because reality is its object.

original: de'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: It is the conformity to the non-erroneous because it conforms to that.

original: 'di ni so so'i skye bo'i sgom pa yin pas de kho na yul du ma gyur pa'i phyir phyin ci log ste /
analyzed: 'di ni so so'i skye bo'i sgom pa yin pas de kho na yul du ma gyur pa'i phyir phyin ci log ste /
translated: This is the cultivation of the ordinary man, therefore, it is erroneous because reality is not its object,

original: so so'i skye bos nyon mongs pa rnams ma lus pa ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bos nyon mongs pa rnams ma lus pa ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the ordinary man has not completely abandoned the passions.

original: ji ltar na phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyin ci log med pa'i rjes su mthun par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyin ci log med pa'i rjes su mthun par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can it be the conformity to the non-erroneous, which is the erroneous?

original: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mthun pa thos pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mthun pa thos pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises from the habitual propensities of hearing, which are the natural outcome of the extremely pure Dharma-element.

original: de yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Moreover, it is from the cultivation of the applications of mindfulness

original: stobs bsgom pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: stobs bsgom pa'i bar du'o //
translated: up to the cultivation of the powers.

original: phyin ci log med la phyin ci log rjes su 'brel ba zhes bya ba 'di ni slob ma rnams kyi byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa dang / lam bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log med la phyin ci log rjes su 'brel ba zhes bya ba 'di ni slob ma rnams kyi byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa dang / lam bsgom pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe absence of error and the presence of error‚Äù refers to the disciples‚Äô cultivation of the factors for enlightenment and the path.

original: de kho na yul du gyur pas na phyin ci log med pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na yul du gyur pas na phyin ci log med pa'o //
translated: The absence of error is due to the fact that reality is their object.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa yod pa'i phyir phyin ci log rjes su 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa yod pa'i phyir phyin ci log rjes su 'brel ba'o //
translated: The presence of error is due to the fact that they have the afflictions that are to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: phyin ci log kyang med la phyin ci log kyang rjes su 'brel ba yang med pa zhes bya ba 'di ni dgra bcom pa mi slob pa'i bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log kyang med la phyin ci log kyang rjes su 'brel ba yang med pa zhes bya ba 'di ni dgra bcom pa mi slob pa'i bsgom pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe absence of error and the absence of the presence of error‚Äù refers to the arhats‚Äô non-learner stage.

original: de kho na yul du gyur pas na phyin ci log med pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na yul du gyur pas na phyin ci log med pa'o //
translated: The absence of error is due to the fact that reality is their object.

original: dgra bcom pas ni dri ma rnams ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir phyin ci log rjes su 'brel ba med do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pas ni dri ma rnams ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir phyin ci log rjes su 'brel ba med do //
translated: The absence of the presence of error is due to the fact that the arhats have abandoned all the impurities without exception.

original: da ni nyan thos rnams las byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnyen po bsgom pa khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni nyan thos rnams las byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnyen po bsgom pa khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the difference between the bodhisattvas and the disciples with regard to the cultivation of the antidotes, the text reads:

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni //
translated: The bodhisattvas'

original: dmigs dang yid la byed pa dang // 'thob pas de ni khyad par 'phags //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dmigs dang yid la byed pa dang // 'thob pas de ni khyad par 'phags // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: is superior by its object, mental activity, and attainment.

original: de la dmigs pa khyad par du 'phags pa ni /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa khyad par du 'phags pa ni /
translated: Therein, the superiority of its object is as follows.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i lus la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i lus la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The disciples and hermit buddhas take as their objects those things belonging to their own mental continuum,

original: lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams la dmigs so //
analyzed: lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams la dmigs so //
translated: namely, body, feelings, mind, and things.üîΩThe bodhisattvas take as their objects those things belonging to their own and others' mental continuums,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa rnams @280b so zhes bya ba ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams la dmigs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa rnams @280b so zhes bya ba ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams la dmigs so //
translated: namely, body, feelings, mind, and things.

original: ci'i phyir dmigs pa tha dad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dmigs pa tha dad ce na /
translated: Why are their objects different?

original: 'di ltar nyan thos la sogs pa ni rang gi don gyi dbang du byas nas gnyen po bsgom pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyan thos la sogs pa ni rang gi don gyi dbang du byas nas gnyen po bsgom pa la 'jug go //
translated: Thus, the disciples and so on engage in the cultivation of the antidote with reference to their own aim.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas do so with reference to their own and others' aims.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam par ro //
translated: In the aspects of impermanence, etc. means in the aspects of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.

original: ci'i phir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la sogs pa de ltar yid la byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la sogs pa de ltar yid la byed ce na /
translated: Why do the Disciples and Hermit Buddhas pay attention in this way?

original: de dag la skyo bar byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag la skyo bar byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are disgusted with the lifecycle.

original: skyo bar ma gyur pa de dag 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyo bar ma gyur pa de dag 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are not disgusted with it are not liberated from it.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dmigs pa'i tshul du'o zhes bya ba ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dmigs pa'i rnam par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dmigs pa'i tshul du'o zhes bya ba ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dmigs pa'i rnam par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The Bodhisattvas pay attention in the manner of objectification. This means in the aspect of the imagined reality.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar yid la mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar yid la mdzad ce na /
translated: Why do they pay attention in this way?

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad spang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad spang ba'i phyir te /
translated: In order to eliminate all conceptualization.

original: 'di ni de dag gi khyad par zhes bya'o //üîΩmi dmigs pa'i tshul 'ba' zhig tu yid la mdzad pa yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni de dag gi khyad par zhes bya'o // mi dmigs pa'i tshul 'ba' zhig tu yid la mdzad pa yang ma yin gyi /
translated: This is their difference.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par yang yid la mdzad de /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par yang yid la mdzad de /
translated: They do not pay attention only in the manner of nonapprehension, but also in the aspects of impermanence, etc.

original: de ltar na yid la byed pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par gdu 'phags so //
analyzed: de ltar na yid la byed pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par gdu 'phags so //
translated: Thus, they are distinguished by the distinction of their mental attentions.üîΩIn order to become completely free from the body, etc.

original: ci nas kyang lus la sogs pa dang 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa dang bral ba ni /
analyzed: ci nas kyang lus la sogs pa dang 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa dang bral ba ni /
translated: means that freedom from the body, etc.

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin /
translated: is the nirvana without remainder of the aggregates and the relinquishment of the mental afflictions that focus on it.

original: mi 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin te /
translated: Bodhisattvas are neither for the sake of becoming free nor for the sake of not becoming free.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lus la sogs pa dang shin tu bral ba dang ma bral na yang sems can gyi don bya bar mi nus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa dang shin tu bral ba dang ma bral na yang sems can gyi don bya bar mi nus par 'gyur te /
translated: If they were completely free from the body, etc., or not free from it, they would be unable to act on behalf of sentient beings,

original: nyon mongs pa zad pa dang / sems can phal ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zad pa dang / sems can phal ba bzhin no //
translated: like those whose mental afflictions have been terminated and like ordinary beings.

original: gal te 'bral ba'i phyir yang ma yin mi 'bral ba'i phyir yang ma yin na ci'i phyir gnyen po rnams bsgom zhen de'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te 'bral ba'i phyir yang ma yin mi 'bral ba'i phyir yang ma yin na ci'i phyir gnyen po rnams bsgom zhen de'i phyir /
translated: If they are neither for the sake of becoming free nor for the sake of not becoming free, why do they cultivate the antidotes?

original: ci nas kyang mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir bsgom mo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ci nas kyang mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir bsgom mo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: One should meditate in order to attain the nirvana that does not abide anywhere.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that nirvana that does not abide anywhere?üîΩWhen a bodhisattva has attained power over karma and rebirth, he is born in cyclic existence out of compassion.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshe na ni las dang skye ba la dbang ba la gnas nas snyong rje dang ldan pa'i phyir 'khor bar skye ba yang shes rab kyi stobs kyis der kun nas @281a * //üîΩnyon mongs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshe na ni las dang skye ba la dbang ba la gnas nas snyong rje dang ldan pa'i phyir 'khor bar skye ba yang shes rab kyi stobs kyis der kun nas @281a * // nyon mongs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: By the power of wisdom, he is not defiled by the addictions there.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes brjod do //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva's nirvana that does not abide anywhere.

original: 'khor ba na gnas kyang so so'i skye bo bzhin du nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'khor ba na gnas kyang so so'i skye bo bzhin du nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: Even though he remains in cyclic existence, he is not defiled by the addictions, as are the ordinary, unregenerate persons.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa bzhin du nye bar len pa med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa bzhin du nye bar len pa med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And he does not attain the nirvana that is devoid of appropriation, as do the disciples and hermit buddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dus na yang nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas 'khor ba la mi gnas la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dus na yang nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas 'khor ba la mi gnas la /
translated: And when he is a transcendent, he does not abide in cyclic existence because he has abandoned the addictive and objective obscurations.

original: chos kyi sku rgyun mi 'chad cing longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku gnyis kyis 'jig rten ji srid pa de srid du gzhan gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi sku rgyun mi 'chad cing longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku gnyis kyis 'jig rten ji srid pa de srid du gzhan gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the Dharma Body is uninterrupted and the Enjoyment Body and the Transformation Body work for the welfare of others for as long as the world exists,

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la yang mi gnas so //
translated: they do not remain in the Nirvana that is the extinction of the remnants of existence.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnyen po bsgom pa 'di ni dmigs pa dang yid la byed pa dang 'bras bu'i khyad par rnams kyis nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par du 'phags so //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnyen po bsgom pa 'di ni dmigs pa dang yid la byed pa dang 'bras bu'i khyad par rnams kyis nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par du 'phags so //
translated: Thus, the cultivation of the counteragent of the bodhisattvas is superior to that of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc., on account of the distinction of its object, mental attention, and result.

original: gnyen po bsgom pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: gnyen po bsgom pa bshad zin to //
translated: The cultivation of the counteragent has now been described.üîΩThe Station of the Counteragent

original: gnyen po bsgom pa'i 'og tu de'i gnas bshad de /
analyzed: gnyen po bsgom pa'i 'og tu de'i gnas bshad de /
translated: The station of the counteragent is explained after the cultivation of the counteragent.

original: de'i phyir de'i gnas gang zhe na zhes dris so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i gnas gang zhe na zhes dris so //
translated: Hence, he asks: What is its station?

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni gnyen po bsgom pa de'i ste /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni gnyen po bsgom pa de'i ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúits‚Äù refers to the cultivation of the counteragent.

original: de'i phyir / rgyu yi gnas skabs zhugs pa dang // zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rgyu yi gnas skabs zhugs pa dang // zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: Hence, he says: ‚ÄúThe state of the cause having been entered‚Äù and so on in detail.

original: de la rgyu'i gnas ni gang rigs la gnas pa'i gang zag go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la rgyu'i gnas ni gang rigs la gnas pa'i gang zag go zhes bya ba la /
translated: The stage of cause is the person who is situated in the spiritual gene.

original: rigs ni rgyu dang sa bon zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rigs ni rgyu dang sa bon zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The spiritual gene is a synonym for cause and seed.

original: de la gang rigs nyid du gyur gyi sems bskyed pa la sogs pa la ma yin te /
analyzed: de la gang rigs nyid du gyur gyi sems bskyed pa la sogs pa la ma yin te /
translated: Therein, one who is situated in the spiritual gene, but not in the generation of the thought of enlightenment, etc.

original: de ni 'dir rigs la gnas par 'dod do //
analyzed: de ni 'dir rigs la gnas par 'dod do //
translated: is considered here as situated in the spiritual gene.

original: de ni gong ma'i gnas rnams su rjes su 'jug ste mi ldog go //
analyzed: de ni gong ma'i gnas rnams su rjes su 'jug ste mi ldog go //
translated: He is situated in the higher stages, and does not turn back.

original: kha cig na de rigs de yang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rang bzhin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na de rigs de yang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rang bzhin no zhes zer te /
translated: Some say that the spiritual gene is of the nature of the wholesome roots.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba nyid la kha cig ni nyan thos kyi rigs zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyi bar du'o zhe'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba nyid la kha cig ni nyan thos kyi rigs zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyi bar du'o zhe'o //
translated: The wholesome roots themselves are called the spiritual gene of the disciple, etc., up to the spiritual gene of the bodhisattva.

original: kha cig na re so so'i skye bo'i gnas las brtsams te /
analyzed: kha cig na re so so'i skye bo'i gnas las brtsams te /
translated: Some say that the spiritual gene is to be understood as beginning with the stage of ordinary people.

original: dbang po'i bye brag la rigs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i bye brag la rigs zhes bya ste /
translated: The difference in faculties is called the spiritual gene.

original: sems kyi sa bon gyi mthu la rigs zhes de skad kyang zer te de yod na so so'i skye bo'i dus dang slob pa'i dus na nyan thos kyi rigs zhes bya ba nas byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyi bar du'o zhe'o //
analyzed: sems kyi sa bon gyi mthu la rigs zhes de skad kyang zer te de yod na so so'i skye bo'i dus dang slob pa'i dus na nyan thos kyi rigs zhes bya ba nas byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyi bar du'o zhe'o //
translated: The power of the seed of mind is called gotra. When it exists, it is called the ≈õrƒÅvaka gotra in the state of ordinary beings and in the state of training, and so on up to the bodhisattva gotra.

original: mi slob pa'i dus na ni nyan thos she'am /üîΩrang sangs rgyas she 'am /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i dus na ni nyan thos she'am / rang sangs rgyas she 'am /
translated: In the state of no more learning, it is called the ≈õrƒÅvaka,üîΩor the pratyekabuddha,

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
translated: or the buddha.

original: de ni @281b gnas skabs kyi mthar thug pa'i phyir de ni rigs ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni @281b gnas skabs kyi mthar thug pa'i phyir de ni rigs ma yin no //
translated: But it is not a gotra, because it is the final limit of the states.

original: de yang nyan thos la sogs pa'i bye brag gis gsum du dbye'o //
analyzed: de yang nyan thos la sogs pa'i bye brag gis gsum du dbye'o //
translated: It is divided into three by the distinctions of ≈õrƒÅvaka, etc.

original: nges pa dang ma nges pa'i bye brag gis drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges pa dang ma nges pa'i bye brag gis drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: It is divided into six by the distinctions of definite and indefinite.

original: zhugs pa'i gnas ni sems bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs rnams dang go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: zhugs pa'i gnas ni sems bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs rnams dang go rims bzhin du /
translated: The state of engagement is the generation of the mind.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed pas rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro //üîΩde ni sbyor ba'i rtsa bar gyur pa'i phyir de byung na sbyor bar zhugs pa yin pas na /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed pas rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro // de ni sbyor ba'i rtsa bar gyur pa'i phyir de byung na sbyor bar zhugs pa yin pas na /
translated: The generation of the thought of enlightenment is threefold: for the disciple, for the hermit buddha, and for the perfect enlightenment of the buddha.

original: de bskyed pa la sbyor bar zhugs pa'i gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bskyed pa la sbyor bar zhugs pa'i gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: Since one who has generated it is engaged in the application, it is called the stage of engagement through generation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir sbyor ba'i gnas ni sems bskyed nas 'bras bu ma thob tshun chad do zhes bya ba ste /üîΩsems bskyed pa'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa nas stobs bsgom pa la thug gi bar du /
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyor ba'i gnas ni sems bskyed nas 'bras bu ma thob tshun chad do zhes bya ba ste / sems bskyed pa'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa nas stobs bsgom pa la thug gi bar du /
translated: The stage of application is the period from the generation of the thought of enlightenment until the attainment of the result.üîΩThe application is the cultivation of the roots of virtue, from the generosity and morality that are preceded by the generation of the thought of enlightenment up to the cultivation of the powers.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par brtsams shing thog ma'i 'bras bu thob par byed pa'i thabs yin pas de la sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par brtsams shing thog ma'i 'bras bu thob par byed pa'i thabs yin pas de la sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the means for attaining the first result.

original: ji ltar rgyun du zhugs pa'i gnas la byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa'i gnas zhes bshad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyun du zhugs pa'i gnas la byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa'i gnas zhes bshad ce na /
translated: How is the stage of the stream-winner called the stage of cultivation of the factors of enlightenment?

original: de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de bas na 'di skad du rigs nas sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba phyi ma phyi ma 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad do ;üîΩ/'bras bu'i gnas ni thob pa'o zhes bya ba ni dang po'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de bas na 'di skad du rigs nas sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba phyi ma phyi ma 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad do ; /'bras bu'i gnas ni thob pa'o zhes bya ba ni dang po'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: Because it is the cause of that, therefore it is explained as follows: ‚ÄúThe generation of the thought from the lineage‚Äù is the subsequent result.üîΩThe stage of the result is the attainment.

original: 'bras bu'i phyir sbyor ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i phyir sbyor ro //
translated: The first result is the stage of the result because one applies oneself for the sake of the result.

original: de bas na sbyor ba'i 'og tu 'bras bu'i gnas so //
analyzed: de bas na sbyor ba'i 'og tu 'bras bu'i gnas so //
translated: Therefore, after the application, there is the stage of the result.

original: bya ba med pa'i gnas ni mi slob pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bya ba med pa'i gnas ni mi slob pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The stage of the absence of action is the stage of no learning.

original: khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral pa'i phyir mi slob pa ste /
analyzed: khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral pa'i phyir mi slob pa ste /
translated: One is a nonlearner because one is free from attachment to the three realms.

original: de'i 'bras bu rnams yongs su rdzogs pas na /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu rnams yongs su rdzogs pas na /
translated: Since one‚Äôs results are complete,

original: 'bras bu gzhan thob par bya ba med pa'i phyir bya ba med pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan thob par bya ba med pa'i phyir bya ba med pa'i gnas so //
translated: there is no other result to be attained. Therefore, it is the stage of the absence of action.

original: khyad par gyi gnas ni mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad par gyi khyad par dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom par mtshungs pa las mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad par rnams dang ldan pas /üîΩgzhan las khyad zhugs par mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad par bsgrub pa'i gnas la khyad par gyi gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi gnas ni mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad par gyi khyad par dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom par mtshungs pa las mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad par rnams dang ldan pas / gzhan las khyad zhugs par mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad par bsgrub pa'i gnas la khyad par gyi gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: The special stage is the stage of the distinctive qualities of the higher cognitions and so forth.

original: bla ma'i gnas ni nyan thos la sogs pa bas /üîΩsar zhugs pa'i byang chub sems @282a * //
analyzed: bla ma'i gnas ni nyan thos la sogs pa bas / sar zhugs pa'i byang chub sems @282a * //
translated: The stage of the distinctive qualities of the higher cognitions and so forth is called the special stage because it is the stage for accomplishing the distinctive qualities of the higher cognitions and so forth, which are superior to those of others, on the basis of the equality of the arhats.

original: dpa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dpa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The stage of the superior is the stage of the bodhisattvas who have entered the levels.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don byed pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam bdag med pa gnyis rtogs par byed pa thob pas /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don byed pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam bdag med pa gnyis rtogs par byed pa thob pas /
translated: The stage of the superior is called the stage of the bodhisattvas who have entered the levels because they have attained the supramundane path that accomplishes the benefit of self and other, which is the realization of the two kinds of no self.

original: de las gzhan pa'i theg pa'i bla mar gyur pas na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i theg pa'i bla mar gyur pas na /
translated: Since it is superior to the vehicles of the others,

original: gnas de la bla ma'i gnas zhes bya'o /
analyzed: gnas de la bla ma'i gnas zhes bya'o /
translated: that stage is called the stage of the superior.

original: bla na med pa'i gnas ni sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i gnas ni sangs rgyas te /
translated: The stage of the unsurpassed is the stage of the Buddha.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i gong na gnas med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i gong na gnas med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because there is no higher stage than that.

original: yon tan dang nyes pa thams cad phul du phyin pa dang brtsal ba'i mthar phyin pas na sangs rgyas su grub pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan dang nyes pa thams cad phul du phyin pa dang brtsal ba'i mthar phyin pas na sangs rgyas su grub pa ste /
translated: One becomes a Buddha because one has reached the culmination of all virtues and the end of all efforts.

original: de'i gong du khyad par can gyi gnas gzhan med pas de nyid la bla na med pa zhes bya'o /
analyzed: de'i gong du khyad par can gyi gnas gzhan med pas de nyid la bla na med pa zhes bya'o /
translated: Since there is no other higher stage than that, it alone is called unsurpassed.

original: de snyed du bshad pas gnas ma lus par yongs su rdzogs kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa bcu gcig tu rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de snyed du bshad pas gnas ma lus par yongs su rdzogs kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa bcu gcig tu rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Although all the stages are completely fulfilled by explaining that many, in order to demonstrate the eleven stages of the bodhisattvas,

original: mos pas spyod pa la sogs pa'i gnas nas /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa la sogs pa'i gnas nas /
translated: the stages of devoted conduct and so on,

original: dbang bskur ba'i gnas la thug gi bar du yang bshad do //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i gnas la thug gi bar du yang bshad do //
translated: up to the stage of consecration are also explained.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku gsum rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku gsum rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the division of the three bodies of the Buddhas,

original: phyi ma'i gnas la sogs pa yang gsum du bstan te //
analyzed: phyi ma'i gnas la sogs pa yang gsum du bstan te //
translated: the later stages and so on are also taught as three.

original: de la rgyu dang zhugs pa'i gnas ni byang chub sems dpa' dang gzhan dag thun mong par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu dang zhugs pa'i gnas ni byang chub sems dpa' dang gzhan dag thun mong par rig par bya'o //
translated: The causal and engaged bases should be understood as common to the bodhisattvas and others.

original: de la mos pa'i gnas ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pas spyod pa'i sa thams cad do zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed nas sa la ma zhugs tshun chad de /
analyzed: de la mos pa'i gnas ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pas spyod pa'i sa thams cad do zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed nas sa la ma zhugs tshun chad de /
translated: The based on imagination is all the levels of the bodhisattvas devoted to imagination, that is, from the generation of the will until the entry to the levels.

original: bar der de kho na ma mthong yang de kho na mthong ba dang 'dra bar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mos pas ngo bo nyid gsum gyi sgo nas chos rnams sgrub cing /
analyzed: bar der de kho na ma mthong yang de kho na mthong ba dang 'dra bar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mos pas ngo bo nyid gsum gyi sgo nas chos rnams sgrub cing /
translated: Although one does not see reality in the interval, one imagines that one sees reality, and one accomplishes the teachings by means of the three natures.

original: de las gzhan pa sems can rnams kyi bya dka' ba sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa sangs rgyas su 'grub pa'i tshogs rnams la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa sems can rnams kyi bya dka' ba sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa sangs rgyas su 'grub pa'i tshogs rnams la 'jug pa ste /
translated: One engages in the difficult practices of generosity, morality, etc. for the sake of the other, i.e. for the sake of the Buddha, and one engages in the accumulations for the achievement of Buddhahood.

original: de bas na gnas mos pas rab tu phye ba yin pas mos pas spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gnas mos pas rab tu phye ba yin pas mos pas spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the basis is distinguished by imagination, and so it is called the level of devoted engagement.

original: de yang bskal pa grangs med pa'am de bas lhag pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bskal pa grangs med pa'am de bas lhag pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it lasts for one measureless kalpa or more.

original: 'jug pa'i gnas ni sa dang po'o zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid gsum la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i gnas ni sa dang po'o zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid gsum la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis /
translated: The stage of entry is the first stage.

original: dang po kho nar de kho na rang gis rig cing rtogs pas na 'jug pa'i gnas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dang po kho nar de kho na rang gis rig cing rtogs pas na 'jug pa'i gnas zhes bya ste /
translated: Since the nonconceptual intuition of the three realities is realized and perceived by oneself on the first stage alone, it is called the stage of entry.

original: 'di nyid ni byang chub sems dpa'i mthong ba'i lam mo //üîΩdes par 'byung ba'i gnas ni de'i gong ma sa drug po dag go zhes bya ba ni @282b bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i mtshan ma rnam pa sna tshogs la mngon par zhen pa spangs pa'i mthar thug par 'gro ba dang rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba'i
analyzed: 'di nyid ni byang chub sems dpa'i mthong ba'i lam mo // des par 'byung ba'i gnas ni de'i gong ma sa drug po dag go zhes bya ba ni @282b bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i mtshan ma rnam pa sna tshogs la mngon par zhen pa spangs pa'i mthar thug par 'gro ba dang rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba'i
translated: This is the path of insight of the bodhisattva.üîΩThe stage of definite emergence is the six stages above it.

original: mthar thug par 'gro ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mthar thug par 'gro ba'i phyir /
translated: Since one goes to the end of the abandonment of attachment to the various signs that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation, and since one goes to the end of the application of effort,

original: sa 'di dag la nges par 'byung ba'i gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa 'di dag la nges par 'byung ba'i gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: these stages are called the stage of definite emergence.

original: lung bstan pa'i gnas ni sa brgyad pa'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma thams cad la 'bad pa dang 'du shes rnam pa thams cad du bral pas sa brgyad pa ni sangs rgyas su 'grub par nges pa yin te /üîΩsangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mngon sum du lung bstan pas lung ston to //
analyzed: lung bstan pa'i gnas ni sa brgyad pa'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma thams cad la 'bad pa dang 'du shes rnam pa thams cad du bral pas sa brgyad pa ni sangs rgyas su 'grub par nges pa yin te / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mngon sum du lung bstan pas lung ston to //
translated: The stage of prediction is the eighth, because the eighth stage is certain to achieve buddhahood, since all signs are abandoned and all conceptualization is abandoned.

original: brjod pa'i gnas ni dgu pa'o zhes bya ba ni sa dgu par nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnam pas so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi khyad par du 'phags pa rnyed pas na bla na med pa'i chos chen po brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa'i gnas ni dgu pa'o zhes bya ba ni sa dgu par nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnam pas so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi khyad par du 'phags pa rnyed pas na bla na med pa'i chos chen po brjod pa yin no //
translated: The stage of expression is the ninth, because on the ninth stage one finds the four specific correct knowledges that are superior to those of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, and thus one expresses the unexcelled great Dharma.

original: dbang bskur ba'i gnas ni bcu pa'o zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa la byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi mthar phyin pas na /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i gnas ni bcu pa'o zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa la byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi mthar phyin pas na /
translated: The stage of consecration is the tenth, because on the tenth stage one perfects the bodhisattva path.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na rnam par bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis 'od zer dag gis mngon par dbang bskur bas dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na rnam par bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis 'od zer dag gis mngon par dbang bskur bas dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: He is consecrated by the Buddhas, the Lords dwelling in the world-realms of the ten directions, by means of rays of light.

original: phyin pa'i gnas ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku'o zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa dang / de'i gnyen po zag pa med pa'i chos kyi sa bon rab tu rgyas pas gnas gyur pa'i rang bzhin chos thams cad la dbang byed pa /
analyzed: phyin pa'i gnas ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku'o zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa dang / de'i gnyen po zag pa med pa'i chos kyi sa bon rab tu rgyas pas gnas gyur pa'i rang bzhin chos thams cad la dbang byed pa /
translated: The state of arrival is the Dharma Body of the Buddhas. The Dharma Body is the transformation of the basis, which is the mastery over all dharmas, due to the abandonment of all obscurations and the expansion of the seeds of the undefiled dharmas which are the counteragents to those obscurations.

original: kun gzhi med pa zhes bya ba sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi med pa zhes bya ba sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The Dharma Body of the Buddhas is called the absence of the store-consciousness.

original: des na chos rtogs par bya ba'i mthar phyin pas na phyin pa'i gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na chos rtogs par bya ba'i mthar phyin pas na phyin pa'i gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the state of arrival because it is the culmination of the realization of the Dharma.

original: gzhan dag na re glo bur gyi dri ma ma lus par bstsal bas chos kyi dbyings rab tu rnam par dag pa nyid ni chos kyi sku yin pas chos kyi sku'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re glo bur gyi dri ma ma lus par bstsal bas chos kyi dbyings rab tu rnam par dag pa nyid ni chos kyi sku yin pas chos kyi sku'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the Dharma Body is the purification of the dharmadhatu, due to the removal of all the adventitious stains.

original: gzhan dag na re shes bya thams cad la yang chags pa med pa dang thogs pa med par 'jug pa'i ye shes khyad par can ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re shes bya thams cad la yang chags pa med pa dang thogs pa med par 'jug pa'i ye shes khyad par can ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Others believe that the dharmakƒÅya is the special intuition that penetrates all knowable objects without obstruction and without attachment.

original: phan yon gyi gnas ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku ste /üîΩsku gang la bzhugs nas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ste /
analyzed: phan yon gyi gnas ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku ste / sku gang la bzhugs nas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ste /
translated: The sambhogakƒÅya is the basis of the qualities because it is the basis of the qualities of the powers, etc.üîΩThe nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya is the basis of the performance of action because it is the basis of the performance of actions that benefit sentient beings.üîΩThe svƒÅbhƒÅvikakƒÅya is the basis of the Dharma Body because it is the basis of the Dharma Body.

original: sku de mthar phyin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang lhan cig tu 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams ni chos kyi 'gro ba myong bar 'gyur ba de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //

translated: The result of the counteragent is the path of elimination.

original: thog ma'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de nyid de /üîΩmi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid 'bras bu yin pas na /
analyzed: thog ma'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de nyid de / mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid 'bras bu yin pas na /
translated: It is the same as the initial result.üîΩThe counteragent itself is the result.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi 'bras bu ste /
translated: Therefore, it is the result of the counteragent.

original: spong ba'i lam des nyon mongs pa rnams dang 'bral lo //
analyzed: spong ba'i lam des nyon mongs pa rnams dang 'bral lo //
translated: By means of this path of elimination, one becomes separated from the afflictions.

original: thog ma'i 'bras bu ni gong du bshad pa'i thog mar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thob pa'o zhes bya ba gang yin pa'o //üîΩmi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sgra ni gnyen po'i gegs yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thog ma'i 'bras bu ni gong du bshad pa'i thog mar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thob pa'o zhes bya ba gang yin pa'o // mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sgra ni gnyen po'i gegs yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The initial result is that which was previously explained as the initial attainment of the supramundane dharmas.

original: sgrib pa la byar zin kyang /üîΩ'dri ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyen po la bya bar 'dod do //üîΩsgrib pa gzhom pa'i phyogs yin pas na /
analyzed: sgrib pa la byar zin kyang / 'dri ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyen po la bya bar 'dod do // sgrib pa gzhom pa'i phyogs yin pas na /
translated: Although the term ‚Äúcounteragent‚Äù is already known to refer to the obscurations,üîΩit is held here to refer to the counteragent that is the counteraction of the counteragent.

original: gnyen po zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
analyzed: gnyen po zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúcounteragent‚Äù is applied because it is the side that conquers the obscurations.

original: bral ba'i 'bras bu ni goms par byas pa'i 'bras bu dang rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: bral ba'i 'bras bu ni goms par byas pa'i 'bras bu dang rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: The effect of separation is the effect of practice and the effect of completion.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba ni slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / rim bzhin no zhes bya ba la goms pas byas pa'i 'bras bu bral ba ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa la sogs pa slob pa lnga rnams te /üîΩnyon mongs pa'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba ni slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / rim bzhin no zhes bya ba la goms pas byas pa'i 'bras bu bral ba ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa la sogs pa slob pa lnga rnams te / nyon mongs pa'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The effect of separation that is accomplished by practice is the five learners who are candidates for the result of once return and so on, since they are learners who are not free of all afflictions.

original: rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa'i mi slob pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa'i mi slob pa rnams yin te /
translated: The effect of completion is the six nonlearners who are those liable to fully degenerate and so on,

original: de drug kyang khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa rnams ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de drug kyang khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa rnams ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since they are nonlearners who are free of all afflictions of the three realms.

original: gong ma ni phye ste bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gong ma ni phye ste bshad pa'o //
translated: The former is explained by differentiating it.

original: 'dir ni ma phye ba ste khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni ma phye ba ste khyad par ro //
translated: But here it is not differentiated, it is distinguished.

original: khyad par gyi 'bras bu ni mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad par ro zhes bya ba 'di la yang goms par byas pa dang / rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi 'bras bu ni mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad par ro zhes bya ba 'di la yang goms par byas pa dang / rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The result of completion should be understood as the special result.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩphyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams yin te /üîΩrang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' @285a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams yin te / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' @285a * //
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause the result of the steadfast is the attainment of the special qualities of the nonreturners,üîΩthe arhats, the pratyekabuddhas,

original: rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yon tan gyi khyad par can thob pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yon tan gyi khyad par can thob pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the bodhisattvas, and the tathagatas.

original: bla ma'i 'bras bu ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams te /
analyzed: bla ma'i 'bras bu ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams te /
translated: The superior result is the bodhisattva stages.

original: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
translated: The cause is mentioned here:

original: de ma yin pa'i theg pa las bla mar gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams ni /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i theg pa las bla mar gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o // byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams ni /
translated: because they are superior to the vehicles that are not that.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin yin pas /
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin yin pas /
translated: The bodhisattva stages are the nature of the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: thog ma'i 'bras bu dang / goms par bya ba'i 'bras bu yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: thog ma'i 'bras bu dang / goms par bya ba'i 'bras bu yin du zin kyang /
translated: Although it is the initial result and the result of practice,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la ltos nas /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la ltos nas /
translated: in relation to the vehicles of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs yin pa dang / byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu yin pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bla ma'i 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs yin pa dang / byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu yin pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bla ma'i 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: it is the result of the bodhisattvas because it is nonconceptual, the buddha lineage, and the result of great enlightenment.üîΩThe unsurpassed result is the stage of the buddhas.

original: bla na med pa'i 'bras bu ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'o zhes bya ba 'di yang rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu nyid yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i 'bras bu ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'o zhes bya ba 'di yang rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu nyid yin du zin kyang /
translated: This is also the perfect result,

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: but it is called the unsurpassed result because it is the abandonment of all afflictions and branch afflictions together with their traces and the abandonment of nonafflicted ignorance.

original: de'i gong na gzhan med pas bla na med pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gong na gzhan med pas bla na med pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
translated: There is nothing higher than that, so it is called the unsurpassed result.

original: 'bras bu gzhan 'di dag ni mdor bstan te /
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan 'di dag ni mdor bstan te /
translated: These other results are taught in brief.

original: rgyas par bya na dpag tu med do zhes bya ba ni rgyas par bya na /
analyzed: rgyas par bya na dpag tu med do zhes bya ba ni rgyas par bya na /
translated: If it is elaborated, it is immeasurable.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'bras bu rnams rab tu phye ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'bras bu rnams rab tu phye ste /
translated: If it is elaborated, the results of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and perfect buddhas are distinguished.

original: bshad na tshad med par 'gyur ro //üîΩgnyen po bsgom pa'i don bsdus pa las byang bar bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: bshad na tshad med par 'gyur ro // gnyen po bsgom pa'i don bsdus pa las byang bar bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa ni /
translated: If explained, it becomes immeasurable.üîΩThe cultivation for the purpose of summarizing the cultivation of the antidotes is

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa ste ;
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa ste ;
translated: the cultivation of the foundations of mindfulness,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi pa byang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi pa byang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: for the purpose of purifying the four noble truths.

original: bsrab pa'i bsgom pa ni yang dag par spong ba bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: bsrab pa'i bsgom pa ni yang dag par spong ba bsgom pa ste /
translated: The cultivation of reduction is the cultivation of the correct abandonments,

original: mi dge ba'i chos rnams bsrab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rnams bsrab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: for the purpose of reducing non-virtuous dharmas.

original: yongs su sbyang bar bya ba'i bsgom pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su sbyang bar bya ba'i bsgom pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bsgom pa ste /
translated: The cultivation of thorough purification is the cultivation of the bases of supernatural power,üîΩfor the purpose of thoroughly purifying the four bases of supernatural power.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir nyes pa lnga spangs pa'i 'du byed brgyad brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir nyes pa lnga spangs pa'i 'du byed brgyad brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cultivation of the aids to penetration is the cultivation of concentration, because one relies on the eight formative forces that abandon the five faults in order to purify concentration.

original: gong ma yang dag par brtsam pa'i bsgom pa ni dbang po bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: gong ma yang dag par brtsam pa'i bsgom pa ni dbang po bsgom pa ste /
translated: The cultivation of the faculties is the cultivation of the correct application of the higher,

original: de ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it generates the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation.

original: 'dre ba'i bsgom pa ni stobs bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: 'dre ba'i bsgom pa ni stobs bsgom pa ste /
translated: The cultivation of the powers is the cultivation of the powers,

original: mthong ba'i lam @285b dang 'dre ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam @285b dang 'dre ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is connected with the path of vision.

original: zhugs pa'i bsgom pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: zhugs pa'i bsgom pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa ste /
translated: The cultivation of the limbs of enlightenment is the cultivation of the path of application,

original: der de kho na la zhugs pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: der de kho na la zhugs pa'i phyir ram /
translated: because it is applied to reality there,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la zhugs pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la zhugs pa'i phyir ram /
translated: or because it is applied to supramundane dharmas,

original: 'phags pa'i lam la zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam la zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or because it is applied to the noble path.

original: mchog gi bsgom pa ni lam bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: mchog gi bsgom pa ni lam bsgom pa ste /
translated: The cultivation of the path is the cultivation of the supreme,

original: mthong ba'i lam pas bsgom pa'i lam mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam pas bsgom pa'i lam mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the path of cultivation is supreme in comparison with the path of vision.

original: thog ma'i bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: thog ma'i bsgom pa ni /
translated: The cultivation of the beginning is the cultivation of the path of vision,üîΩbecause it is the beginning of the noble path.

original: so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs te /
translated: The stage of the common man is the stage of the ordinary man.

original: rjes su mthun la phyin ci log pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su mthun la phyin ci log pa'o //
translated: It is in conformity with reality, but is erroneous.

original: bar ma'i bsgom pa ni slob pa'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: bar ma'i bsgom pa ni slob pa'i gnas skabs te /
translated: The intermediate cultivation is the stage of the learner.

original: phyin ci log med la phyin ci log rjes su 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log med la phyin ci log rjes su 'brel ba'o //
translated: It is not erroneous, but is associated with error.

original: mtha'i bsgom pa ni mi slob pa'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: mtha'i bsgom pa ni mi slob pa'i gnas skabs te /
translated: The final cultivation is the stage of the adept.

original: phyin ci log kyang med la phyin ci log rjes su 'brel ba yang med pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log kyang med la phyin ci log rjes su 'brel ba yang med pa'o //
translated: It is neither erroneous nor associated with error.

original: bla ma dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'o //
translated: The cultivation with superior beings is that of the Sravakas, etc.

original: bla na med pa'i bsgom pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i bsgom pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ste /
translated: The unsurpassed cultivation is that of the Bodhisattvas.

original: gang dmigs pa dang yid la byed pa dang thob pa khyad par du 'phags pa zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang dmigs pa dang yid la byed pa dang thob pa khyad par du 'phags pa zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that the object, mental attention, and attainment are superior.

original: gnas skabs rnams kyi don bsdus pa ni skal ba yod pa'i gnas skabs ni rgyu'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: gnas skabs rnams kyi don bsdus pa ni skal ba yod pa'i gnas skabs ni rgyu'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The summary of the stages: The stage of the possibility of fortune is the causal stage.

original: rtsom pa'i gnas skabs ni sems bskyed pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rtsom pa'i gnas skabs ni sems bskyed pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The stage of undertaking is the application with the generation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: ma dag pa dang dag pa'i gnas skabs ni gnas gnyis te /
analyzed: ma dag pa dang dag pa'i gnas skabs ni gnas gnyis te /
translated: The impure and pure states are the two states.

original: 'bras bu'i gnas dang / bya ba dang bcas pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gnas dang / bya ba dang bcas pa'i gnas so //
translated: The state of result and the state of activity.

original: shin tu dag pa'i gnas skabs ni bya ba med pa'o gnas skabs so //
analyzed: shin tu dag pa'i gnas skabs ni bya ba med pa'o gnas skabs so //
translated: The state of complete purity is the state of inactivity.

original: rgyan dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs ni khyad par gyi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: rgyan dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs ni khyad par gyi gnas skabs so //
translated: The state of adornment is the state of distinction.

original: khyad par bya ba'i gnas skabs ni bla ma'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: khyad par bya ba'i gnas skabs ni bla ma'i gnas skabs te /
translated: The state of distinctive activity is the state of supremacy.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcus khyab pas na khyab par bya ba'i gnas skabs so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcus khyab pas na khyab par bya ba'i gnas skabs so zhes bya'o //
translated: The state of pervasion is the state of pervasion by the ten bodhisattva stages.

original: bla na med pa'i gnas skabs ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams te /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i gnas skabs ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams te /
translated: The state of supremacy is the state of the transcendent lords, the buddhas,

original: de'i gong na gnas gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gong na gnas gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other state above it.

original: de yang phyin pa'i gnas skabs dang / phan yon gyi gnas skabs dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: de yang phyin pa'i gnas skabs dang / phan yon gyi gnas skabs dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i gnas skabs te /
translated: Moreover, it is the state of arrival, the state of benefit, and the state of accomplishing activity,

original: gang sngar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gang sngar bshad pa'o //
translated: as previously explained.

original: 'bras bu rnams kyi don bsdus pa ni bsdus pa dang de'i bye brag dang / sngon goms par byas pa dang / gong nas gong du sgrub pa dang / bstan pa dang / bshad pa'o zhes bya ba 'di dag ni bshad pa byed pa nyid kyis bshad pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnams kyi don bsdus pa ni bsdus pa dang de'i bye brag dang / sngon goms par byas pa dang / gong nas gong du sgrub pa dang / bstan pa dang / bshad pa'o zhes bya ba 'di dag ni bshad pa byed pa nyid kyis bshad pa ste /
translated: The summary of the results is summarized as: summary, its divisions, prior habituation, higher achievement, teaching, and explanation.

original: de la bsdus pa ni rnam par smin pa'i phyi ma @286a * //
analyzed: de la bsdus pa ni rnam par smin pa'i phyi ma @286a * //
translated: The summary is the result of evolutionary development.

original: 'bras bu ni rigs las sems bskyed pa dang sems bskyed pa las sbyor ba dang de lta bu la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rigs las sems bskyed pa dang sems bskyed pa las sbyor ba dang de lta bu la sogs pa ste /
translated: The result of human action is the generation of the thought of enlightenment from the spiritual gene, and the practice from the generation of the thought of enlightenment, and so on.

original: gnas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa zhes ji skad du bshad pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa zhes ji skad du bshad pas rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as explained in the passage beginning with ‚Äúthe transmission from one stage to another.‚Äù

original: thog ma'i 'bras bu ni dang por 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thob pa'o zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam thob pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma'i 'bras bu ni dang por 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thob pa'o zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam thob pa'o //
translated: The result of separation is the first attainment of supramundane dharmas, i.e., the attainment of the path of insight.

original: goms par byas pa'i 'bras bus ni de'i pha rol slob pa'i gnas so zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam phan chad slob pa'i gnas la /
analyzed: goms par byas pa'i 'bras bus ni de'i pha rol slob pa'i gnas so zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam phan chad slob pa'i gnas la /
translated: The result of habituation is the stage of learning beyond that, i.e., the stage of learning beyond the path of insight.

original: gang zag lngas rab tu phye ba lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: gang zag lngas rab tu phye ba lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: The result of once-returner and the result of non-returner are distinguished by five persons.

original: sbyor ba dang bcas pa'i rjes la bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin yin pas goms par byas pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang bcas pa'i rjes la bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin yin pas goms par byas pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: They are the result of cultivation because they are the nature of the path of cultivation subsequent to the path of preparation.üîΩThe perfected result is the dharmas of no-more-learning.

original: rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu ni mi slob pa'i chos rnams so zhes bya ba ni de dag kyang yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / rtog pa dang / ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dang / rtsol ba dang / dran pa dang ;
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu ni mi slob pa'i chos rnams so zhes bya ba ni de dag kyang yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / rtog pa dang / ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dang / rtsol ba dang / dran pa dang ;
translated: They are also called right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes ma thong ba zhes bya ba rnams te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes ma thong ba zhes bya ba rnams te /
translated: right concentration, right liberation, and right knowledge of liberation.

original: 'bras bu thams cad kyi mtha' la gnas pa'i phyir rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu thams cad kyi mtha' la gnas pa'i phyir rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called the perfected result because they abide at the end of all results.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni rgyu'i dngos pos phyi ma phyi ma 'bras bur rig par bya'o zhes bya ba de la sems bskyed pa ni rigs dang rjes su mthun pa'i sems bskyed pa ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni rgyu'i dngos pos phyi ma phyi ma 'bras bur rig par bya'o zhes bya ba de la sems bskyed pa ni rigs dang rjes su mthun pa'i sems bskyed pa ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The generation of the resolve is the cause. The generation of the resolve that is in accordance with the spiritual lineage is the result.üîΩThe subsequent result, etc., and the result that is in accordance with the cause, etc., are mentioned individually in order to demonstrate and explain the sequence.üîΩThe result that is the counteragent is the path of relinquishment.

original: phyi ma phyi ma 'bras bu la sogs pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa so sor smos pa ni bstan pa dang bshad par rim bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma 'bras bu la sogs pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa so sor smos pa ni bstan pa dang bshad par rim bzhin du rig par bya'o //
