original: 'thob par 'gyur bas na yang dag par 'grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'thob par 'gyur bas na yang dag par 'grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called correct achievement because it is achieved, is attained, from the spiritual gene, etc.

original: de yang @288a * //
analyzed: de yang @288a * //
translated: Moreover,

original: de las yang dag par 'grub pa khyad par du 'phags pa gzhan med pas na bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las yang dag par 'grub pa khyad par du 'phags pa gzhan med pas na bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called unsurpassed because there is no other achievement superior to it.

original: de bas na 'dir yang dag par 'grub pa de las khyad par du 'phags pa gzhan med pa'i dngos po nyid bla na med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir yang dag par 'grub pa de las khyad par du 'phags pa gzhan med pa'i dngos po nyid bla na med pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, here, the very fact that there is nothing superior to that correct achievement is its unsurpassability.

original: 'dir ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrub pa bzhi dang bcas pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa la theg pa chen po zhes bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrub pa bzhi dang bcas pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa la theg pa chen po zhes bshad pa yin te /
translated: Here, the Great Vehicle is explained as the four practices of the bodhisattvas together with their result.

original: de yang bla na med pa nyid rnam pa gsum bshad ma thag pas bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang bla na med pa nyid rnam pa gsum bshad ma thag pas bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it is called unsurpassed because of the three types of unsurpassability just explained.

original: yang na theg pa chen po ni rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ye shes mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa tshogs dang bcas pa /
analyzed: yang na theg pa chen po ni rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ye shes mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa tshogs dang bcas pa /
translated: Or else, the Great Vehicle is the intuition free from all conceptual elaborations, together with its associates, its accumulations,

original: sbyor ba dang bcas pa /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang bcas pa /
translated: its applications,

original: rjes las thob pa'i ye shes dang bcas pa /
analyzed: rjes las thob pa'i ye shes dang bcas pa /
translated: its subsequent intuition,

original: khyad par can gyi yon tan dang bcas pa /üîΩdmigs pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi yon tan dang bcas pa / dmigs pa dang bcas pa /
translated: its special qualities,

original: 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o //
translated: its objective supports, and its results.

original: de la dmigs pa ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Its objective support is thusness.

original: 'bras bu ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Its result is nonabiding nirvana.üîΩAlso, the discourses, etc.

original: theg pa chen po 'di ston pa'i mdo sde la sogs pa bshad pa gang yin pa de dag kyang theg pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: theg pa chen po 'di ston pa'i mdo sde la sogs pa bshad pa gang yin pa de dag kyang theg pa chen po yin no //
translated: which teach this Great Vehicle are the Great Vehicle.

original: tshig kyang gzhi dang 'dra bar gdags te /
analyzed: tshig kyang gzhi dang 'dra bar gdags te /
translated: The words are designated in the same way as the basis.

original: dper na khar ba bsad pa dang rin po che phrogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na khar ba bsad pa dang rin po che phrogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like killing a dog or stealing jewels.

original: 'dis theg chen mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pas theg pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis theg chen mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pas theg pa'o //
translated: It is a vehicle because it causes one to attain the nonabiding nirvana of the Great Vehicle.

original: de yang chen po rnam pa bdun dang ldan pas na chen po'o //
analyzed: de yang chen po rnam pa bdun dang ldan pas na chen po'o //
translated: It is great because it possesses seven kinds of greatness.

original: de ni theg pa yang yin la chen po yang yin pas theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: de ni theg pa yang yin la chen po yang yin pas theg pa chen po'o //
translated: It is the Great Vehicle because it is a vehicle and it is great.

original: chen po rnam pa bdun ni dmigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / ye shes dang / brtson 'grus dang / thabs mkhas pa dang / 'thob pa dang / las chen po'o //
analyzed: chen po rnam pa bdun ni dmigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / ye shes dang / brtson 'grus dang / thabs mkhas pa dang / 'thob pa dang / las chen po'o //
translated: The seven kinds of greatness are greatness of objective, practice, knowledge, effort, skillful means, attainment, and action.

original: de la dmigs pa chen po ni stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa mdo sde mtha' yas pa'i chos rnams byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa chen po ni stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa mdo sde mtha' yas pa'i chos rnams byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The greatness of objective is that the objective of the bodhisattva path is the infinite teachings of the scriptures, such as the Hundred Thousand.

original: sgrub pa chen po ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don mtha' dag sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don mtha' dag sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The greatness of practice is that it accomplishes the aims of both self and other.

original: ye shes chen po ni gang zag dang / chos la bdag med par shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes chen po ni gang zag dang / chos la bdag med par shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The greatness of knowledge is that it knows the selflessness of persons and things.

original: brtson 'grus chen po ni bskal ba grangs med pa gsum du bya dka' ba brgya stong phrag du ma la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen po ni bskal ba grangs med pa gsum du bya dka' ba brgya stong phrag du ma la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The greatness of effort is that it is applied for many hundreds of thousands of difficult tasks over three measureless kalpas.

original: thabs mkhas pa chen po ni 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa chen po ni 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great skill in means, because it does not dwell in either cyclic life or in the frozenness of personal salvation.

original: @288b 'thob pa chen po ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa yon tan dpag tu med pa grangs med pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @288b 'thob pa chen po ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa yon tan dpag tu med pa grangs med pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great attainment, because it attains the immeasurable and innumerable excellences of the powers, the fearlessnesses, the unique qualities of a Buddha, and so on.

original: lam chen po ni 'khor ba ji srid pa de srid du byang chub mngon par ston pas sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam chen po ni 'khor ba ji srid pa de srid du byang chub mngon par ston pas sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great path, because it accomplishes the deeds of a Buddha by manifesting enlightenment for as long as cyclic life lasts.

original: 'di dag nyid ni theg pa chen po bla na med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag nyid ni theg pa chen po bla na med pa ste /
translated: This very vehicle is unsurpassed,

original: de las theg pa khyad par can gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las theg pa khyad par can gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other vehicle more distinguished than it.

original: de yang sgrub pa dang dmigs pa dang yang dag par 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: de yang sgrub pa dang dmigs pa dang yang dag par 'grub pa ste /
translated: It is also unsurpassed in its practice, in its objective, and in its realization.

original: 'di ltar de dag dang ldan pas na theg pa chen po bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag dang ldan pas na theg pa chen po bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is called the unsurpassed Great Vehicle because it is endowed with these.

original: sgrub pa nyid bla na med pa yin pas sgrub pa bla na med pa nyid de /
analyzed: sgrub pa nyid bla na med pa yin pas sgrub pa bla na med pa nyid de /
translated: It is unsurpassed in practice, because there is no other practice higher than this one.

original: de bzhin du dmigs pa dang yang dag par 'grub pa bla na med pa nyid kyang rig par bya'o //üîΩbla na med pa nyid de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang / de'i gnas dang de'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dmigs pa dang yang dag par 'grub pa bla na med pa nyid kyang rig par bya'o // bla na med pa nyid de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang / de'i gnas dang de'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas te /
translated: Likewise, the supremacy of the object and of the accomplishment should be understood.

original: go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag go //üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag go // 'di lta ste /
translated: These supremacies are established in order with reference to the bodhisattva path, its support, and its result.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab kyis kyang sgrub pa dang dmigs pa dang de'i 'bras bu dang 'di rnams tsam zhig bshad par zad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab kyis kyang sgrub pa dang dmigs pa dang de'i 'bras bu dang 'di rnams tsam zhig bshad par zad do //
translated: Thus, the scriptures of the Buddha teach only these: practice, object, and result.

original: dmigs pa ni sgrub pa'i sngon du 'gro bas dmigs pa sngar bshad pa'i rigs pa las /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni sgrub pa'i sngon du 'gro bas dmigs pa sngar bshad pa'i rigs pa las /
translated: Since the object is the prerequisite for practice, the object is explained first, in accordance with the principle.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sgrub pa snying por bya ba bstan pa'i phyir sgrub pa sngar bshad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sgrub pa snying por bya ba bstan pa'i phyir sgrub pa sngar bshad do //
translated: But practice is explained first in order to show that practice is essential for the bodhisattvas.

original: de la ji ltar na sgrub pa bla na med pa nyid ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na sgrub pa bla na med pa nyid ces bya zhe na /
translated: How is the practice supreme?

original: de'i phyir / sgrub pa bla na med pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu la sgrub par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / sgrub pa bla na med pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu la sgrub par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: One should know that the highest practice is the practice of the ten perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams sgrub pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la nan tan byed pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams sgrub pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la nan tan byed pa'o //
translated: The practice of the perfections is the cultivation of the perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa de yang theg pa chen po nyid du bshad kyi ;
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa de yang theg pa chen po nyid du bshad kyi ;
translated: And that practice of the perfections is explained as the Great Vehicle itself,

original: gzhan ni ma yin pas na theg pa chen po nyid bla na med par ston to //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin pas na theg pa chen po nyid bla na med par ston to //
translated: and not as anything else. Thus, the Great Vehicle is shown to be the highest.

original: sgrub pa de yang rnam pa gang gis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sbyor ba ni bla na med par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa de dag bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgrub pa de yang rnam pa gang gis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sbyor ba ni bla na med par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa de dag bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: And that practice, by which one applies oneself to the perfections, becomes the highest. In order to demonstrate those aspects,üîΩit is said:

original: sgrub pa dag ni rnam drug ste //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs so //üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sgrub pa ji ltar na dam par 'gyur ba nas /
analyzed: sgrub pa dag ni rnam drug ste // zhes bya ba gsungs so // pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sgrub pa ji ltar na dam par 'gyur ba nas /
translated: The practices are of six kinds.üîΩOne does not know how the practice of the perfections becomes the best,

original: ji ltar na khyad par can med pa'i bar du 'gyur ba mi shes nas /
analyzed: ji ltar na khyad par can med pa'i bar du 'gyur ba mi shes nas /
translated: up to how it becomes without distinction.

original: de'i phyir de la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: dam pa bcu gnyis bdag nyid de //
analyzed: dam pa bcu gnyis bdag nyid de //
translated: The twelve perfections are its nature.

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: dam pa ni rnam pa bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: dam pa ni rnam pa bcu gnyis te /
translated: The perfection is of twelve kinds.

original: che ba dang bla na med ces bya ba'i @289a * //
analyzed: che ba dang bla na med ces bya ba'i @289a * //
translated: It is called great and unsurpassed.

original: tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: de'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate its kinds,üîΩit is said:

original: rgya che ba dang yun ring dang // zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: rgya che ba dang yun ring dang // zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: Extensive, long-lasting,

original: rgya che ba dam pa nas 'grub pa dam pa zhes bya ba'i bar du rnam pa bcu gnyis pa de dag ni dam pa'o //
analyzed: rgya che ba dam pa nas 'grub pa dam pa zhes bya ba'i bar du rnam pa bcu gnyis pa de dag ni dam pa'o //
translated: The twelve kinds beginning with the perfection of generosity and ending with the perfection of direct intuition are the perfections.

original: de la rgya cher dam pa ni 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mi 'dod pa dang mchog tu rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la rgya cher dam pa ni 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mi 'dod pa dang mchog tu rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therein, the perfection of generosity is to be known as the desire for all mundane perfections and the highest.

original: phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par mtho ba'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par mtho ba'o //
translated: Perfection is the clear manifestation of the highest.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, it is twofold:

original: rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa'o //
translated: gain and non-gain.

original: de la bdag gi bde ba la mi chags pa dang / gzhan gyi sdug bsngal ba bsal bar zhugs pa'i phyir rnyed pa la mi chags shing ma rnyed pa mi 'tshol ba'o //
analyzed: de la bdag gi bde ba la mi chags pa dang / gzhan gyi sdug bsngal ba bsal bar zhugs pa'i phyir rnyed pa la mi chags shing ma rnyed pa mi 'tshol ba'o //
translated: Because he is not attached to his own happiness and is engaged in removing the suffering of others, he is not attached to gain and does not seek what is not gain.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dge ba khyod kyi bsod nams 'bras bu gang //
analyzed: dge ba khyod kyi bsod nams 'bras bu gang //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever the fruit of your merit,

original: thams cad gzhan gyi don te bdag gi don rgyur min //üîΩzhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: thams cad gzhan gyi don te bdag gi don rgyur min // zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: all is for the sake of others, not for your own sake.‚Äù

original: spong ba dang ye shes dang mthu phun sum tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir mchog go //
analyzed: spong ba dang ye shes dang mthu phun sum tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir mchog go //
translated: It is supreme because the result is the perfection of abandonment, intuition, and power that is buddhahood.

original: yang na 'jig rten na rgya che ba ni rnam pa gnyis su brjod de /
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten na rgya che ba ni rnam pa gnyis su brjod de /
translated: Or, in the world, greatness is said to be twofold:

original: che bar mngon pa dang lan du phan 'dogs pa mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: che bar mngon pa dang lan du phan 'dogs pa mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: greatness of non-desire and greatness of non-aversion.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mi 'dod kyang sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la je bas je cher sbyor te /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mi 'dod kyang sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la je bas je cher sbyor te /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva, though not desiring any mundane excellence, engages in the transcendences such as generosity more and more.

original: de bas na de sgrub pa rgya che ba nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de sgrub pa rgya che ba nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúvast in its accomplishment.‚Äù

original: yun ring ba dam pa ni yun ring ba'i phyir mchog ste /
analyzed: yun ring ba dam pa ni yun ring ba'i phyir mchog ste /
translated: Supreme in its duration: it is supreme because it lasts a long time.

original: yun ring ba nyid kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la yun ring por goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yun ring ba nyid kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la yun ring por goms par byed pa'o //
translated: Its duration is the repeated practice of the transcendences for a long time.

original: de yang dus ji srid pa mi shes nas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang dus ji srid pa mi shes nas de'i phyir /
translated: Since one does not know how long that is, it is said:

original: bskal ba grangs med pa gsum du yongs su bsgom pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bskal ba grangs med pa gsum du yongs su bsgom pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it is cultivated for three incalculable eons.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa bsgom pa bskal ba grangs med pa gsum gyi mthar thug par byed pas shin tu yun ring ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa bsgom pa bskal ba grangs med pa gsum gyi mthar thug par byed pas shin tu yun ring ba yin no //
translated: The transcendences are cultivated for a very long time, since the bodhisattvas bring them to culmination over three incalculable eons.

original: ched du bya ba dam pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i ched kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ched du bya ba dam pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i ched kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Supreme in its aim: because it is aimed at the benefit of all beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bdag gi bde ba la mi chags pa rnams ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bdag gi bde ba la mi chags pa rnams ni /
translated: The bodhisattvas, not attached to their own happiness,

original: sems can la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i ched du sbyin pa la zhugs pas de'i phyir ched du bya ba dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i ched du sbyin pa la zhugs pas de'i phyir ched du bya ba dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the highest object because it is engaged in generosity for the sake of benefiting and bringing happiness to sentient beings.

original: zad mi shes pa @289b dam pa ni mi zad pa'i phyir dam pa ste /
analyzed: zad mi shes pa @289b dam pa ni mi zad pa'i phyir dam pa ste /
translated: The highest inexhaustibility is the highest because it is inexhaustible.

original: zad mi shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: zad mi shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is inexhaustibility?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir / byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pas /
translated: Because it is dedicated to great enlightenment,

original: gtan du yongs su gtugs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gtan du yongs su gtugs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it is never exhausted.

original: byang chub chen por yongs su bsngo ba'i sbyin pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub chen por yongs su bsngo ba'i sbyin pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: Generosity and so on that are dedicated to great enlightenment

original: skye pa'i gnas thams cad du rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu byin yang gtan du rgyun chad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye pa'i gnas thams cad du rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu byin yang gtan du rgyun chad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: give the fruitional effect in all births, but they are never exhausted.

original: gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid chos kyi sku sgrub pa dang / de yang mi zad pas phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par gtan du yongs su gtugs par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid chos kyi sku sgrub pa dang / de yang mi zad pas phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par gtan du yongs su gtugs par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because it is dedicated to great enlightenment, it is never exhausted in the nirvana that is the elimination of the remnants of the aggregates, which is the attainment of the dharmakƒÅya that is the characteristic of the transformation of the basis.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su lus rnam pa thams cad du rgyun chad pas rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su lus rnam pa thams cad du rgyun chad pas rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The dedication to the enlightenment of ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc. is interrupted, because the body is completely interrupted in the realm of nirvƒÅ·πáa without remainder.

original: yang na byang chub chen por yongs su bsngo bas sbyin pa la sogs pa mi zad par 'gyur te ;
analyzed: yang na byang chub chen por yongs su bsngo bas sbyin pa la sogs pa mi zad par 'gyur te ;
translated: Or else, generosity, etc. become inexhaustible through dedication to great enlightenment,

original: rnam par smin pa mang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa mang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the abundance of evolutionary development.

original: mang ba la yang mi zad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mang ba la yang mi zad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Abundance is called inexhaustible,

original: rnam par smin pa sbyin pas gtan du yongs su gtugs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa sbyin pas gtan du yongs su gtugs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the evolutionary development from generosity is never exhausted.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa la ni de ltar mi zad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa la ni de ltar mi zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But the dedication to the enlightenment of ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc. is not inexhaustible in that way.

original: yang na sems can rnams kyi don du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa dang / sems can gyi khams bzhin du mi zad pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na sems can rnams kyi don du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa dang / sems can gyi khams bzhin du mi zad pa yin te /
translated: Or else, the roots of virtue of the bodhisattvas, dedicated to great enlightenment for the sake of sentient beings, are inexhaustible like the realm of sentient beings.

original: de bas na sems can gyi khams bzhin du gtan du yongs su gtugs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na sems can gyi khams bzhin du gtan du yongs su gtugs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, like the realm of sentient beings, they are never exhausted.

original: rgyun mi 'chad pa dam pa ni bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du mos pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pa dam pa ni bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du mos pa'i phyir te /
translated: The highest continuity is due to the conviction of the sameness of oneself and others,

original: sems can thams cad la sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because the perfections such as generosity are perfected in all sentient beings.

original: sa rab tu dga' ba la byang chub sems dpas chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i don rtogs pas bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du mos so //
analyzed: sa rab tu dga' ba la byang chub sems dpas chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i don rtogs pas bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du mos so //
translated: On the Joyful stage, the bodhisattva realizes the meaning of the allpervading dharmadhatu and is convinced of the sameness of oneself and others.

original: de bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du mos pa'i phyir bdag dang gzhan du rnam par rtog pa spangs pas /
analyzed: de bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du mos pa'i phyir bdag dang gzhan du rnam par rtog pa spangs pas /
translated: Because of that conviction of the sameness of oneself and others, he abandons the discrimination of self and others.

original: rang gi sbyin pa la sogs pa bzhin du gzhan gyi sbyin pa la sogs pas kyang sems shin tu dga' ba thob po //
analyzed: rang gi sbyin pa la sogs pa bzhin du gzhan gyi sbyin pa la sogs pas kyang sems shin tu dga' ba thob po //
translated: Just as with one's own generosity, etc., one also obtains a very joyful mind through the generosity, etc., of others.

original: de bas na skad cig re @290a * //üîΩre'am yud tsam re re'am nyi ma re rer yang rgyun mi 'chad par de'i sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na skad cig re @290a * // re'am yud tsam re re'am nyi ma re rer yang rgyun mi 'chad par de'i sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in every moment,üîΩin every instant, in every day, the perfections of generosity, etc., are fulfilled without interruption.üîΩThe supreme accumulation is the fulfillment of the perfections through mere sympathetic joy in the generosity, etc., of others.

original: tshogs med pa dam pa ni gzhan gyi sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su yi rang ba tsam gyis pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ci nas kyang de dag la rjes su yi rang ba tsam gyis
analyzed: tshogs med pa dam pa ni gzhan gyi sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su yi rang ba tsam gyis pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ci nas kyang de dag la rjes su yi rang ba tsam gyis
translated: This is the supreme accumulation because the perfections are fulfilled through mere sympathetic joy in the generosity, etc., of others.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can rnams kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la rab tu dga' ba'i yid kyis rjes su yi rang bar byed
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can rnams kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la rab tu dga' ba'i yid kyis rjes su yi rang bar byed
translated: Thus, bodhisattvas rejoice with a delighted mind in the roots of virtue of beings' generosity and so on.

original: do // dbang 'byor ba dam pa ni nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pas sbyin pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: do // dbang 'byor ba dam pa ni nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pas sbyin pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The highest mastery is the perfection of generosity and so on through the concentration of the sky treasury and so forth.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa bsgom pas ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa bsgom pas ;
translated: Through their meditation on the realization of the expanse of reality,

original: ting nge 'dzin nam mkha' mdzod ces bya ba 'thob ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin nam mkha' mdzod ces bya ba 'thob ste /
translated: bodhisattvas acquire the concentration known as the sky treasury.

original: de thob pas sems can rnams kyi bsam pa thams cad yongs su bskang ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de thob pas sems can rnams kyi bsam pa thams cad yongs su bskang ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: By acquiring that, they perfect the transcendent generosity that fulfills all the wishes of beings.

original: de'i dbang gis nam mkha' nyid mdzod dam yang na nam mkha' la mdzod 'cha' ba'i ting nge 'dzin la nam mkha' mdzod ces bya bar brjod de /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis nam mkha' nyid mdzod dam yang na nam mkha' la mdzod 'cha' ba'i ting nge 'dzin la nam mkha' mdzod ces bya bar brjod de /
translated: Therefore, the concentration in which the sky itself is a treasure, or in which a treasure is placed in the sky, is called the sky treasure.

original: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin de'i mthus yo byad thams cad nam mkha' las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin de'i mthus yo byad thams cad nam mkha' las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by the power of that concentration, all the articles come from the sky.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni shes rab kyi rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa mdo las 'byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni shes rab kyi rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa mdo las 'byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin rnams bsdu'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include the concentrations taught in the scriptures, such as the perfection of wisdom.

original: yongs su bzung ba dam pa ni /
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba dam pa ni /
translated: The highest possession is

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because it is possessed by nonconceptual intuition.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni sbyin bdag dang sbyin par bya ba dang / len pa gsum ni dmigs pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni sbyin bdag dang sbyin par bya ba dang / len pa gsum ni dmigs pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The nonconceptual intuition of the bodhisattvas is the nonconceptual intuition of the three spheres, that is, the giver, the giving, and the recipient.

original: de bzhin du shes par byed pa dang / shes par bya ba dang / shes pa gsum gyis bar du mi dmigs pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes par byed pa dang / shes par bya ba dang / shes pa gsum gyis bar du mi dmigs pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Similarly, it is nonconceptual intuition because it does not objectify the three spheres of the act of knowing, the object of knowledge, and the knower.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dam pa des yongs su gzung ba'i sbyin pa la sogs pa sgrub po //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dam pa des yongs su gzung ba'i sbyin pa la sogs pa sgrub po //
translated: One accomplishes the giving, etc., which are embraced by that sublime nonconceptual intuition.

original: ji lta zhe na de'i rjes su 'brang ba dang de la dmigs @290b pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na de'i rjes su 'brang ba dang de la dmigs @290b pa'i phyir te /
translated: How so? Because it follows that and objectifies that.

original: de'i phyir dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called sublime.

original: rtsol ba dam pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la bzod pa cher gyur pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtsol ba dam pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la bzod pa cher gyur pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The sublime effort is the great patience on the stage of action in faith.

original: bskal ba grangs med pa dang po ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bskal ba grangs med pa dang po ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa zhes bya ste /
translated: The first incalculable eon is called the stage of action in faith.

original: rigs dang bshes gnyen gyi stobs kyis byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
analyzed: rigs dang bshes gnyen gyi stobs kyis byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
translated: Having generated the thought of enlightenment by the power of the spiritual gene and of a spiritual friend,

original: ngo bo nyid gsum gyi sgo nas chos thams cad la bdag med par shin tu mos pa'i bzod pa che ba ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum gyi sgo nas chos thams cad la bdag med par shin tu mos pa'i bzod pa che ba ste /
translated: one has great patience in the faith that all things are selfless in the three natures.

original: ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthu pa'i phyogs las rgyal ba la bya'o //
analyzed: ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthu pa'i phyogs las rgyal ba la bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúvictory over the side of weakness‚Äù because it is victory over the side of weakness such as lack of faith.üîΩ

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtsom pa'i dus te /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtsom pa'i dus te /
translated: It is called the time of the bodhisattva's undertaking.

original: de'i phyir bzod pa chen po ni rtsom pa dam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bzod pa chen po ni rtsom pa dam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, great patience is called the highest undertaking.üîΩThe highest attainment is the first stage.

original: 'thob pa dam pa ni sa dang po'o zhes bya ba ni sa dang po la chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba rtogs pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams 'thob po //
analyzed: 'thob pa dam pa ni sa dang po'o zhes bya ba ni sa dang po la chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba rtogs pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams 'thob po //
translated: On the first stage, the bodhisattva attains the universal domain of the Dharma realm, and thus attains the supramundane perfections.

original: sngar sa dang po la sbyor bas bsdus pa ni 'jig rten pa nyid de /
analyzed: sngar sa dang po la sbyor bas bsdus pa ni 'jig rten pa nyid de /
translated: Previously, on the stage of preparation, they were mundane.üîΩTherefore, the highest attainment is on the first stage.

original: de'i phyir sa dang po la 'thob pa dam pa zhes bya'o rgyu mthun pa dam pa ni de ma yin pa gzhan brgyad po dag la'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir sa dang po la 'thob pa dam pa zhes bya'o rgyu mthun pa dam pa ni de ma yin pa gzhan brgyad po dag la'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The highest natural outcome is on the other eight stages.

original: de ma yin pa gzhan sa brgyad po dag la gong nas gong du khyad par thob pa ni sa dang po la thob pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa yin pas rgyu mthun pa dam pa'o //
analyzed: de ma yin pa gzhan sa brgyad po dag la gong nas gong du khyad par thob pa ni sa dang po la thob pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa yin pas rgyu mthun pa dam pa'o //
translated: The other eight levels are the excellent natural outcome of the attainment of the first level, since they are the natural outcome of the transcendent perfections attained on the first level.

original: yang na mos pas spyod pa'i sa la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis sa dang po 'thob pa ni 'thob pa dam pa ste /
analyzed: yang na mos pas spyod pa'i sa la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis sa dang po 'thob pa ni 'thob pa dam pa ste /
translated: Or else, the excellent attainment is the attainment of the first level through the power of cultivating the transcendent perfections on the level of earnest aspiration.

original: sa dang po byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthong ba'i lam du bsdus pa der zhugs na /
analyzed: sa dang po byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthong ba'i lam du bsdus pa der zhugs na /
translated: If bodhisattvas enter that first level, which is included in the path of seeing,

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi chos rab tu thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi chos rab tu thob pa'i phyir /
translated: they acquire the qualities that are its nature

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin no zhes mdo las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin no zhes mdo las 'byung ngo //
translated: and are born in the family of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: sa lhag ma rnams pha rol tu phyin pa rnams bsgom pa'i stobs kyis thob pa'i sa dang po'i rgyu mthun pa dam pa'o //
analyzed: sa lhag ma rnams pha rol tu phyin pa rnams bsgom pa'i stobs kyis thob pa'i sa dang po'i rgyu mthun pa dam pa'o //
translated: The remaining levels are the excellent natural outcome of the first level, which is attained through the power of cultivating the transcendent perfections.

original: yang na sa brgyad po 'di dag ni sa dang po la rab tu thob pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rgyun mthun par gyur pas rgyu mthun pa dam pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sa brgyad po 'di dag ni sa dang po la rab tu thob pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rgyun mthun par gyur pas rgyu mthun pa dam pa'o //
translated: Or else, these eight stages are the highest natural outcome of the perfections that were fully attained on the first stage, because they are the continuity of those perfections.

original: 'grub pa dam pa ni sa bcu pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la /
analyzed: 'grub pa dam pa ni sa bcu pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la /
translated: The highest accomplishment is on the tenth stage and the tathagata stage.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'grub pa dang sangs rgyas 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /üîΩsa bcu pa la byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad tshar phyin nas de bzhin @291a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'grub pa dang sangs rgyas 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la / sa bcu pa la byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad tshar phyin nas de bzhin @291a * //
translated: Because bodhisattvas are accomplished and buddhas are accomplished.

original: gshegs pa rnams kyi rgyal chab tu dbang bskur te /
analyzed: gshegs pa rnams kyi rgyal chab tu dbang bskur te /
translated: On the tenth stage, bodhisattvas complete all the bodhisattva activities and are consecrated by the tathagatas with the empowerment of the tathagatas.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / chos thams cad la rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba dang / rnam pa thams cad du bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / chos thams cad la rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba dang / rnam pa thams cad du bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: They fully complete the inconceivable accumulations of merit and wisdom, are free from all conceptual thoughts about all phenomena and accomplish the benefit of self and others in every way.

original: sa bcu pa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'grub pa dam pa'o //
analyzed: sa bcu pa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'grub pa dam pa'o //
translated: On the tenth stage, the bodhisattvas have the highest achievement.

original: spong ba dang ye shes dang mthu khyad par can rnams thob pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi ston pa yin pas de'i phyir sangs rgyas su 'grub pas 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: spong ba dang ye shes dang mthu khyad par can rnams thob pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi ston pa yin pas de'i phyir sangs rgyas su 'grub pas 'grub pa'o //
translated: Because of the attainment of special abandonment, knowledge, and power, the Lord is the teacher of all beings. Therefore, the achievement of buddhahood is the achievement.

original: 'grub pa de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'grub pa de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that achievement?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams rnam pa thams cad du mngon par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams rnam pa thams cad du mngon par sgrub pa'o //
translated: It is the complete achievement of the bodhisattva qualities and the buddha qualities.

original: yang na slob pa'i sar bsdus pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi phul du byung ba ni sa bcu pa ste /
analyzed: yang na slob pa'i sar bsdus pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi phul du byung ba ni sa bcu pa ste /
translated: Or else, the culmination of the perfections included in the stage of learning is the tenth stage.

original: de bas na de la byang chub sems dpa' yongs su 'grub po //
analyzed: de bas na de la byang chub sems dpa' yongs su 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva is completely achieved on that stage.

original: mi slob pa'i sar bsdus pa rnams kyi phul du byung ba ni sangs rgyas kyi sa ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i sar bsdus pa rnams kyi phul du byung ba ni sangs rgyas kyi sa ste /
translated: The culmination of those included in the stage of no more learning is the buddha stage.

original: sa de na pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la slob pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa de na pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la slob pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: On that stage, there is no more learning in regard to the perfections.

original: sangs rgyas su yongs su 'grub pas 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su yongs su 'grub pas 'grub pa ste /
translated: It is established by the establishment of Buddhahood.

original: de ltar sa bcur byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su 'grub pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas yongs su grub pas 'grub pa dam par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sa bcur byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su 'grub pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas yongs su grub pas 'grub pa dam par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the establishment of the bodhisattva on the ten stages and the establishment of the Tathagata in Buddhahood should be understood as the highest establishment.

original: de'i phyir dam pa'i don gyis na /
analyzed: de'i phyir dam pa'i don gyis na /
translated: Therefore, in the highest sense,üîΩthe ten perfections are accepted.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcur 'dod do zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar dam pa rnam pa bcu gnyis po 'di dag / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa la yod kyi /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcur 'dod do zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar dam pa rnam pa bcu gnyis po 'di dag / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa la yod kyi /
translated: In this way, the ten perfections are called highest because they exist in the giving, etc. of the bodhisattvas in these twelve highest ways,

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa la ni med pa de'i phyir /üîΩdam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa la ni med pa de'i phyir / dam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: but not in the giving, etc. of the sravakas, etc.

original: don 'dis byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyid kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa ye shes la thug pa rnams nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po dag tu ston to //
analyzed: don 'dis byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyid kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa ye shes la thug pa rnams nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po dag tu ston to //
translated: By this meaning, the giving, etc. of the bodhisattvas up to the knowledge are shown to be the ten perfections in the manner of verbal definition.

original: de bas na pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sgrub pa gang yin pa de yang dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sgrub pa gang yin pa de yang dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the practice of the perfections is also called the highest.

original: kha cig ces bya ba ni gang dag pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi ming tsam yang mi shes pa de rnams la de dag gi ming bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: kha cig ces bya ba ni gang dag pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi ming tsam yang mi shes pa de rnams la de dag gi ming bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Some refers to those who do not even know the names of the perfections. In order to teach them the names of the perfections, it is said:

original: sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod brtson 'grus //
analyzed: sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod brtson 'grus //
translated: Generosity, morality, patience, diligence,

original: bsam gtan dang ni shes rab thabs //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang ni shes rab thabs //
translated: concentration, wisdom, skillful means,üîΩaspirations, power, and knowledge

original: smon lam stobs dang ye shes dang // @291b 'di dag pha rol phyin bcu'o //üîΩzhes bya ba brjod de /üîΩched du bya ba dam pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i ched kyi phyir ro zhes bshad pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: smon lam stobs dang ye shes dang // @291b 'di dag pha rol phyin bcu'o // zhes bya ba brjod de / ched du bya ba dam pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i ched kyi phyir ro zhes bshad pa de'i phyir /
translated: are the ten perfections.

original: 'di dag gi so so'i las ci zhe na zhes dris pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di dag gi so so'i las ci zhe na zhes dris pa de'i phyir /
translated: The highest purpose is for the sake of accomplishing the welfare of all sentient beings. Therefore, it is asked: What is the individual function of these?

original: las ni rjes su 'dzin byed dang // gnod mi byed dang de la bzod //
analyzed: las ni rjes su 'dzin byed dang // gnod mi byed dang de la bzod //
translated: Therefore, it is said: The function is to take care, not to harm, to be patient with that,

original: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: and to be skilled in means.

original: snying rje sngon du btang ste sems can rnams la mi gnod pa'i 'tsho ba dang / bstan bcos dang / sgyu rtsal dang / bzo rnams ston pa dang / bde 'gro dang thar pa'i lam ston pa ni chos kyi sbyin pa ste /

analyzed: 'dis kyang 'tsho ba med pa dang / ngan 'gro 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal sel bas sems can rjes su 'dzin to //
translated: And this also takes care of sentient beings, by removing the suffering of having no livelihood and the suffering of the unfortunate realms and cyclic existence.

analyzed: rgyal po dang chom rkun dang bgo skal la spyod pa dang / gcan gzan la sogs pas zin pa de dag las thar par byed pa ni mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ste /
translated: Giving freedom from fear is the protection from kings, thieves, family members, wild animals, and so on.

original: 'dis kyang srog dang longs spyod dang / bu dang chung ma la sogs pas phongs pa'i 'jigs pa sel bas sems can rnams rjes su 'dzin to ;
analyzed: 'dis kyang srog dang longs spyod dang / bu dang chung ma la sogs pas phongs pa'i 'jigs pa sel bas sems can rnams rjes su 'dzin to ;
translated: And this also takes care of sentient beings, by removing the fear of losing one's life, property, children, spouse, and so on.

original: / tshul khrims kyis ni de dag la gnod par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gis nyes par spyod pa thams cad spyod pa dang / 'jig rten dang mthun pa'i bkag pa dang / bsgo bas lus dang ngag gi las ldog cing sgrub pa ni tshul khrims te /
analyzed: / tshul khrims kyis ni de dag la gnod par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gis nyes par spyod pa thams cad spyod pa dang / 'jig rten dang mthun pa'i bkag pa dang / bsgo bas lus dang ngag gi las ldog cing sgrub pa ni tshul khrims te /
translated: Morality does not harm them means that morality is the avoidance of and engagement in all physical and verbal misdeeds, and the avoidance of and engagement in physical and verbal actions that are prohibited and enjoined by worldly convention.

original: tshul khrims de la rnam par gnas pas sems can la gnod pa dang mi bde bar sgrub pa srog gi phyir yang bdag nyid kyang mi byed cing gzhan la yang byed du mi 'jug pa'o //üîΩbzod pa ni gzhan dag gis gnod par byas pa la ji mi snyam par byed do zhes bya ba ni snying rje'i sems sngon du btang bas sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa @292a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims de la rnam par gnas pas sems can la gnod pa dang mi bde bar sgrub pa srog gi phyir yang bdag nyid kyang mi byed cing gzhan la yang byed du mi 'jug pa'o // bzod pa ni gzhan dag gis gnod par byas pa la ji mi snyam par byed do zhes bya ba ni snying rje'i sems sngon du btang bas sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa @292a * //
translated: And by abiding in that morality, he does not harm or injure sentient beings even at the cost of his life, nor does he induce others to do so.üîΩPatience is the acceptance of suffering and the tolerance of harm from others.

original: thams cad la ji mi snyam par byed cing dang du len pa'i bdag nyid kyi bzod pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad la ji mi snyam par byed cing dang du len pa'i bdag nyid kyi bzod pa ste /
translated: The acceptance of suffering refers to the patience of one who, through the force of compassion, is indifferent to all the forms of suffering and willingly accepts them.

original: des gzhan dag gis gsod pa dang 'ching ba dang rdeg pa la sogs pa byas pa la slar gnod pa mi byed pas ji mi snyam par byed pa'o //
analyzed: des gzhan dag gis gsod pa dang 'ching ba dang rdeg pa la sogs pa byas pa la slar gnod pa mi byed pas ji mi snyam par byed pa'o //
translated: The tolerance of harm from others refers to the patience of one who, through the force of compassion, is indifferent to the killing, binding, beating, and so on, that others inflict on him.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni yon tan rnams 'phel bar byed do zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i phyir spro ba ni brtson 'grus te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni yon tan rnams 'phel bar byed do zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i phyir spro ba ni brtson 'grus te /

analyzed: des sbyin pa la sogs pa'i yon tan goms par byas pas yon tan khyad par du 'phags par 'grub pa ni 'phel ba'o //

original: bsam gtan gyis ni rdzu 'phrul la sogs pas mgu bar byas te 'dzud do zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis ni rdzu 'phrul la sogs pas mgu bar byas te 'dzud do zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /

original: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa bsdu'o //
translated: refers to the knowledge of the range of activity of others' minds.

original: bsam gtan ni ting nge 'dzin la sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni ting nge 'dzin la sems rtse gcig pa'o //

original: rdzu 'phrul ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The performance of miracles is the going through space, etc.

original: 'dzud pa ni bstan pa'i chos nyid ston pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzud pa ni bstan pa'i chos nyid ston pa ste /
translated: The causing of entry is the teaching of the Dharma which is the subject matter of the teaching.

original: bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu rdzu 'phrul dang / kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul gnyis kyis mgu bar byas na bstan pa la 'dzud nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu rdzu 'phrul dang / kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul gnyis kyis mgu bar byas na bstan pa la 'dzud nus par 'gyur ro //

original: shes rab kyis ni yang dag pa'i gdams ngag byin pas rnam par grol bar byed do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni yang dag pa'i gdams ngag byin pas rnam par grol bar byed do zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: shes rab ni rnam pa thams cad du chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //

original: de'i las ni yang dag pa'i gdams ngag sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i las ni yang dag pa'i gdams ngag sbyin pa ste /

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa mi zad par byed do zhes bya ba ni chos gang 'grub par bya ba dang / rnam par 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'thob par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba'i phyir rigs pa gang yin pa de ni thabs yin no ;üîΩ/ de la mkhas pa ni thog tu phebs pa ste /

original: thabs la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'o //

analyzed: de'i las ni sbyin pa la sogs pa byas shing bsags pa rnams byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pas mi zad par byed pa'o //

analyzed: byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ni byang chub @292b chen po bzhin du mi zad par 'gyur ro //

original: smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni mthun pa'i skye ba yongs su 'dzin pas tshe rabs thams cad du sangs rgyas 'byung ba mnyes par byed cing sbyin pa la sogs pa la rtag tu 'jug go zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: smon lam ni rnam pa du mar smon pa'i bdag nyid yin mod kyi /

original: 'dir ni dge ba dang mthun pa'i skye ba la smon pas smon lam du 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir ni dge ba dang mthun pa'i skye ba la smon pas smon lam du 'dod do //

analyzed: de'i las ni skad cig re re la yang gdon mi za bar sbyin pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa'o //

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni /
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni /

analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa 'brel pa'i gtam nges par mdzad pa dang / sems can rnams la phyin ci ma log pa'i chos bstan pas /

original: mdo la sogs pa'i chos bstan pa ni /

original: gnyis su snang bar gyur pa ni //
analyzed: gnyis su snang bar gyur pa ni //

analyzed: de ltar yod pa ma yin te //

original: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //

analyzed: gnyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba ste zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ce na /

analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i sa bon dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'di la snang ba'i don gang zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rnam par 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /

original: de ltar yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: de ltar yod pa ma yin te //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnyis po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pas ji ltar snang ba'i rnam pa de ltar med pa'o //

original: don gyi yod pa spangs pa zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: don gyi yod pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yod pa'o //

analyzed: de spangs pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pas stong pa'i phyir ro //

original: med pa spangs pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: med pa spangs pa ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: der snang ba'i 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba'i 'khrul pa yod do zhes @297b bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: phyin ci ma log par shes pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral bar rab tu rtogs so //
