original: sgyu ma la sogs pa dang 'dra bas na /
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa dang 'dra bas na /
translated: Because it is similar to an illusion, etc.,

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: it is like an illusion, etc.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: dper na sgyu ma ni rang gi bdag nyid kyis med bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma ni rang gi bdag nyid kyis med bzhin du /
translated: For example, an illusion, although it does not exist by way of its own nature,

original: glang po che la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du snang bas na /
analyzed: glang po che la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du snang bas na /
translated: appears as having the nature of an elephant, etc.üîΩTherefore, it exists as an entity of an elephant, etc.

original: glang po che la sogs pa'i dngos por yod pa yin la zhes bya ba ni glang po che la sogs pa'i dngos por med pas /
analyzed: glang po che la sogs pa'i dngos por yod pa yin la zhes bya ba ni glang po che la sogs pa'i dngos por med pas /
translated: Since it does not exist as an entity of an elephant, etc.,

original: rnam pa thams cad du med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: it is not nonexistent in every way.

original: de ni 'khrul pa tsam du yod pa'i phyir med pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'khrul pa tsam du yod pa'i phyir med pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: It is not nonexistent because it exists as a mere error.

original: glang po che la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba de ni /
analyzed: glang po che la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba de ni /
translated: That appearance as an elephant, etc.,

original: 'khrul pa tsam du yod pa'i phyir ye med pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa tsam du yod pa'i phyir ye med pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: is not utterly nonexistent because it exists as a mere error.

original: de bzhin du yod kyang ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba ltar yod pa'ang ma yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du yod kyang ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba ltar yod pa'ang ma yin la /
translated: Likewise, although they exist, they do not exist as they appear, as the grasped and the grasper.

original: khams gsum pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang gi ngo bo de /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang gi ngo bo de /
translated: The nature of the mind and mental functions of the three realms

original: de lta bur snang ba de 'khrul pa tsam du @298b yod pa'i phyir med pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur snang ba de 'khrul pa tsam du @298b yod pa'i phyir med pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: exists as mere error, in the way that they appear.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni smig rgyu dang rmi lam dang / chu zla la sogs pa chu dang skyes pa dang bud med kyi bdag nyid du ji ltar snang ba de bzhin du yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni smig rgyu dang rmi lam dang / chu zla la sogs pa chu dang skyes pa dang bud med kyi bdag nyid du ji ltar snang ba de bzhin du yod pa ma yin la /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes mirages, dreams, and reflections of the moon in water, which do not exist as they appear, as water, men, and women.

original: de la 'khrul pa tsam du yod pa'i phyir med pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: de la 'khrul pa tsam du yod pa'i phyir med pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: But they do exist as mere error.

original: de bzhin du don la rgya cher so sor sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du don la rgya cher so sor sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in detail to all objects.

original: 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgras ni dri za'i grong khyer dang / brag ca la sogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgras ni dri za'i grong khyer dang / brag ca la sogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù should be understood to include fairy cities and echoes.

original: de ltar don la sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bur mthong nas /
analyzed: de ltar don la sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bur mthong nas /
translated: Thus, seeing objects as like illusions, etc.,

original: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs la sems mi 'phro ste /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs la sems mi 'phro ste /
translated: The mind does not move toward the positions of existence and non-existence.

original: g-yeng ba med par mthong ba gang yin pa de ni mi 'phro ba la phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: g-yeng ba med par mthong ba gang yin pa de ni mi 'phro ba la phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: The vision that is free from distraction is the non-erroneous in regard to non-movement.

original: mi 'pho ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'pho ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is non-movement?

original: gzhan dag na re dbu ma'i lam gyi ting nge 'dzin to zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dbu ma'i lam gyi ting nge 'dzin to zhe'o //
translated: Others believe that it is the meditative concentration of the middle way.

original: gal te de lta na ji ltar mi 'phro ba la phyin ci ma log par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ji ltar mi 'phro ba la phyin ci ma log par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how can it be non-erroneous in regard to non-movement?

original: de'i phyir / des yod pa dang med pa la sems 'phro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / des yod pa dang med pa la sems 'phro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Hence he says: because the mind does not move towards existence and non-existence.

original: phyin ci ma log pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa' yod pa dang med par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa' yod pa dang med par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of this non-erroneous state, the bodhisattva does not conceive of existence and non-existence.

original: stong pa nyid la dmigs pa las mi g-yeng ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la dmigs pa las mi g-yeng ste /
translated: He is not distracted from the objective support of emptiness.

original: de bas na mi 'phro ba la phyin ci ma log pa zhes bya'o //üîΩ'di yang kun rdzob tu phyin ci ma log pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na mi 'phro ba la phyin ci ma log pa zhes bya'o // 'di yang kun rdzob tu phyin ci ma log pa yin gyi /
translated: Hence, it is described as the non-erroneous in regard to non-movement.

original: don dam par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, this is the non-erroneous in regard to the conventional, but not in regard to the ultimate,

original: de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the latter is devoid of conceptual differentiation.

original: da ni rang gi mtshan nyid la phyin ci ma log pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rang gi mtshan nyid la phyin ci ma log pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the non-erroneous nature of the own-characteristic, he says:

original: rtog pa thams cad mi 'jug phyir //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad mi 'jug phyir //
translated: Because all conceptual differentiation does not operate,

original: thams cad ming tsam kho na ste //
analyzed: thams cad ming tsam kho na ste //
translated: everything is just name-only.

original: zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs so //üîΩgang 'di mig dang gzugs rnams nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs so // gang 'di mig dang gzugs rnams nas /
translated: This is stated extensively.

original: yid dang chos rnams zhes bya ba'i bar 'di dag thams cad ni ming tsam mo /
analyzed: yid dang chos rnams zhes bya ba'i bar 'di dag thams cad ni ming tsam mo /
translated: All this, from the eye and form up to the mind and mental objects, is just name-only.

original: zhes bya ba ni skye mched bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid shes bya thams cad ni ming tsam mo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skye mched bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid shes bya thams cad ni ming tsam mo //
translated: Name-only refers to all that is knowable, which has the twelve sense-fields for its own-being.

original: de la ming gi ngo bo nyid dang khyad par du 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la ming gi ngo bo nyid dang khyad par du 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Name is the designation of an entity and of its attributes.

original: gdags par bya ba'i don dang btags pa ni ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: gdags par bya ba'i don dang btags pa ni ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: The object of designation and the designation itself are devoid of an essential nature,

original: de'i bdag nyid du kun brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du kun brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are imagined to have that essential nature.

original: kun brtags pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun brtags pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the imagined is also non-existent.

original: gzhan du na ni ming la mi ltos par mig la sogs par 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na ni ming la mi ltos par mig la sogs par 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, one would apprehend the eye etc. without relying on the name.

original: brda la ma byang bar mi 'dzin pa med do //
analyzed: brda la ma byang bar mi 'dzin pa med do //
translated: There is no apprehension without being skilled in the conventional symbol.

original: de bas na mig dang gzugs zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: de bas na mig dang gzugs zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: Therefore, the so-called eye and form

original: don gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pas mig dang gzugs nas yid dang / chos rnams zhes bya ba'i bar dag ni ming tsam mo @299a * //
analyzed: don gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pas mig dang gzugs nas yid dang / chos rnams zhes bya ba'i bar dag ni ming tsam mo @299a * //
translated: are not the nature of objects. Thus, from the eye and form up to the mind and mental objects are mere names.

original: zhes / de ltar gang shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pas 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid la phyin ci ma log pa'o zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i chos kyi sgo nas /
analyzed: zhes / de ltar gang shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pas 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid la phyin ci ma log pa'o zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i chos kyi sgo nas /
translated: Thus, knowing this is the antidote to all conceptual thoughts. This is the non-erroneous with regard to the specific characteristics.

original: chos thams cad la rnam par rtog pa thams cad 'jug ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad la rnam par rtog pa thams cad 'jug ste /
translated: All conceptual thoughts engage all phenomena through the door of imputed phenomena.

original: de bas na ming tsam du rtogs pa'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi gnyen po ni /
analyzed: de bas na ming tsam du rtogs pa'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi gnyen po ni /
translated: Therefore, the knowledge that realizes mere names is the antidote to all conceptual thoughts.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la phyin ci ma log pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la phyin ci ma log pa zhes bstan to //
translated: This is taught to be the non-erroneous with regard to the specific characteristics.

original: de'ang ci don dam pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la'am 'on te kun rdzob kyi la bya ba mi shes nas /
analyzed: de'ang ci don dam pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la'am 'on te kun rdzob kyi la bya ba mi shes nas /
translated: Moreover, if one does not know whether this is with regard to the specific characteristics of the ultimate or the relative,

original: de'i phyir / rang gi mtshan nyid gang la zhe na zhes dris pa dang / de'i phyir don dam pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / rang gi mtshan nyid gang la zhe na zhes dris pa dang / de'i phyir don dam pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: And therefore it is said, ‚ÄúIt is in regard to the ultimate own-characteristic.‚Äù

original: 'di ni phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: This is non-erroneous.

original: don dam pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni brjod du med pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni brjod du med pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu ni ma yin no //
translated: The ultimate own-characteristic is not conventional because it is inexpressible.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar kun rdzob tu ni ming 'di tsam mo zhes 'dzin pa med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar kun rdzob tu ni ming 'di tsam mo zhes 'dzin pa med de /
translated: Because in the conventional there is no apprehension of mere name.

original: brjod pa'i sgo nas chos kyi ngo bo nyid la kun tu rtog pa 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brjod pa'i sgo nas chos kyi ngo bo nyid la kun tu rtog pa 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the imagination of what is unreal operates in regard to the essential nature of dharmas through verbal description.

original: 'di ni kun rdzob nyid yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni kun rdzob nyid yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin te /
translated: This is conventional, not ultimate,

original: ming tsam du rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming tsam du rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the imagination of mere name.

original: phyin ci ma log pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa' kun rdzob dang don dam pa la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa' kun rdzob dang don dam pa la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through this non-erroneous understanding, the bodhisattva becomes skilled in the conventional and the ultimate.

original: da ni spyi'i mtshan nyid la phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: da ni spyi'i mtshan nyid la phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate non-erroneous understanding in regard to the universal characteristic, he says:

original: chos kyi dbyings ni ma rtogs par //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni ma rtogs par //
translated: The realm of the Dharma is not realized

original: 'di ltar chos yod ma yin te //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos yod ma yin te //
translated: because the Dharma does not exist in this way.

original: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said extensively.

original: chos la dbang med pa ma rtogs pa'i chos /
analyzed: chos la dbang med pa ma rtogs pa'i chos /
translated: The Dharma is not realized as powerless.

original: gzugs can nam gzugs med pa gang yang med de /
analyzed: gzugs can nam gzugs med pa gang yang med de /
translated: There is no form or formlessness at all.

original: chos thams cad ni brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin la /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin la /
translated: All dharmas are of the nature of inexpressibility,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: free from the substantiality of grasped and grasper.

original: de bas na chos kyi dbyings ni /üîΩchos thams cad ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na chos kyi dbyings ni / chos thams cad ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the realm of the DharmaüîΩis the general characteristic of all dharmas.

original: chos thams cad la bye brag med par de yod pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la bye brag med par de yod pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: It is called the general characteristic because it exists without distinction in all dharmas.

original: de ltar shes pa gang yin pa de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid la phyin ci ma log pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar shes pa gang yin pa de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid la phyin ci ma log pa ste /
translated: Whoever knows it thus is unmistaken regarding the general characteristic.

original: kun rdzob tu yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin te de rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin te de rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is conventionally, not ultimately, because that is non-conceptual.

original: phyin ci ma log pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa' rnams par dag pa'i dmigs pa la mkhas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa' rnams par dag pa'i dmigs pa la mkhas par 'gyur te /
translated: By this non-error, the bodhisattvas become skilled in the pure objective supports,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the objects of non-conceptual intuition.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the two, the specific and the general characteristics?

original: brjod pa'i @299b ngo bo nyid du sgro btags pa'i gnyen por brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni don dam pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: brjod pa'i @299b ngo bo nyid du sgro btags pa'i gnyen por brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni don dam pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The reality of the inexpressible is the characteristic of the ultimate, as the antidote to the superimposition of the reality of the expressible.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bdag med pa ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bdag med pa ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: The selflessness of the imagined reality is the nature of all things,

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the general characteristic.

original: de ltar mthong ba tha dad pa'i dbang gis khyad par du gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba tha dad pa'i dbang gis khyad par du gyur gyi /
translated: Thus, it is distinguished by the power of different views,

original: don las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don las ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by the object.

original: da ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par ma dag pa dang / rnam par dag pa la phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par ma dag pa dang / rnam par dag pa la phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the non-error with regard to the impure and the pure dharmadhatu, he says:

original: phyin ci log gi yid la byed //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi yid la byed //
translated: The mental activity of error

original: ma spangs pa dang spangs pa las //
analyzed: ma spangs pa dang spangs pa las //
translated: is from the non-abandonment and abandonment of the two.

original: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is extensively stated.

original: phyin ci log gi yid la byed pa ma spangs pa ni /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi yid la byed pa ma spangs pa ni /
translated: The non-abandonment of mistaken mental activity

original: chos kyi dbyings de rnam par ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de rnam par ma dag pa'o //
translated: is the impure dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: spangs pa ni rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: spangs pa ni rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba de la /
translated: The abandonment is the pure.

original: phyin ci log gi yid la byed pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu phyin ci log tu rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi yid la byed pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu phyin ci log tu rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: There, mistaken mental activity is the conceptualization of the cause of the store consciousness as mistaken.

original: de ma spangs pa ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: de ma spangs pa ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par ma dag pa'o //
translated: The non-abandonment of that is the impure dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: spangs pa ni rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: spangs pa ni rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The abandonment is the pure.

original: de ltar shes pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par ma dag pa dang / rnam par dag pa la phyin ci ma log pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar shes pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par ma dag pa dang / rnam par dag pa la phyin ci ma log pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of that is the non-mistaken regarding the impure and the pure,

original: go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: respectively.

original: phyin ci log gi yid la byed pa ma spangs pa ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par ma dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par ma dag pa la phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi yid la byed pa ma spangs pa ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par ma dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par ma dag pa la phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: There, the non-abandonment of mistaken mental activity is the impure dharmadhƒÅtu. This is the non-mistaken regarding the impure dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: de spangs pa ni rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa la phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: de spangs pa ni rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa la phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: The abandonment of that is purity. This is the non-erroneous understanding of purity.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos kyi dbyings la glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pas nyon mongs par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pas nyon mongs par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the realm of the Dharma is defiled by adventitious afflictions.

original: 'di yang kun rdzob tu phyin ci ma log pa ste /
analyzed: 'di yang kun rdzob tu phyin ci ma log pa ste /
translated: This is also non-erroneous in terms of the conventional,

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in terms of the ultimate.

original: phyin ci ma log pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi dbyings la sgrib pa spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi dbyings la sgrib pa spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa rab tu shes so //
translated: By this non-erroneous understanding, the bodhisattva knows the abandonment and non-abandonment of obscurations to the realm of the Dharma.

original: da ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / rnam par ma dag pa glo bur du 'byung ba la phyin ci ma log pa bstan pa'i phyir //üîΩchos kyi dbyings ni rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: da ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / rnam par ma dag pa glo bur du 'byung ba la phyin ci ma log pa bstan pa'i phyir // chos kyi dbyings ni rang bzhin gyis //
translated: Now, in order to teach the non-erroneous understanding of the purity and impurity of the realm of the Dharma arising adventitiously,üîΩit is said:üîΩThe realm of the Dharma is pure by nature,

original: rnam par dag phyir nam mkha' bzhin //
analyzed: rnam par dag phyir nam mkha' bzhin //
translated: like space.

original: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: This is stated extensively.

original: chos kyi dbyings nam mkha' bzhin du rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nam mkha' bzhin du rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the realm of the Dharma is pure by nature like space,

original: rnam par ma dad pa dang phyis rnam par dag ces bya ba 'di gnyis kyang glo bur yin zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: rnam par ma dad pa dang phyis rnam par dag ces bya ba 'di gnyis kyang glo bur yin zhes bya ba de la /
translated: these two, impurity and later purification, are adventitious.

original: chos kyi dbyings sa la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pas rnam par ma dag pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings sa la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pas rnam par ma dag pa zhes bshad do //
translated: The realm of the Dharma is explained as impure due to the secondary defilement of false imagination.

original: phyis gnyen po byung nas de @300a * //
analyzed: phyis gnyen po byung nas de @300a * //
translated: Later, when the antidote arises,

original: spangs pas rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: spangs pas rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: it is purified by the elimination of that.

original: de gnyi ga yang chos kyi dbyings la glo bur yin no //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang chos kyi dbyings la glo bur yin no //
translated: Both of these are adventitious to the realm of the Dharma.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nam mkha' bzhin du chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the realm of the Dharma is pure by nature like space.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la rnam par ma dag pa ni glo bur yin grang na rnam par dag pa ni rtag tu rnam par dag pa yin pas ji ltar glo bur du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la rnam par ma dag pa ni glo bur yin grang na rnam par dag pa ni rtag tu rnam par dag pa yin pas ji ltar glo bur du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If impurity is adventitious to that which is pure by nature, then since purification is always pure, how could it be adventitious?

original: dri ma dang bral bas rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de 'dir brjod pas 'dod pas na nyes pa 'di med de /
analyzed: dri ma dang bral bas rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de 'dir brjod pas 'dod pas na nyes pa 'di med de /
translated: Since it is said here that it is pure because it is free from defilements, this fault does not exist.

original: de bas na 'di skad du rnam par dag pa ni phyis rnam par dag ces bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na 'di skad du rnam par dag pa ni phyis rnam par dag ces bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that purity is later purity.

original: de ltar shes pa gang yin pa de ni chos kyi dbyings la rnam par ma dag pa dang rnam par dag pa glo bur du byung ba nyid la phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar shes pa gang yin pa de ni chos kyi dbyings la rnam par ma dag pa dang rnam par dag pa glo bur du byung ba nyid la phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: That which is known in this way is the non-erroneous understanding of the adventitious nature of impurity and purity in the dharma-dhƒÅtu.

original: 'di yang kun rdzob tu yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang kun rdzob tu yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: This is also conventional, not ultimate.

original: phyin ci ma log pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dbyings la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i dus na bcos ma ma yin par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dbyings la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i dus na bcos ma ma yin par rab tu shes so //
translated: By this non-erroneous understanding, the bodhisattva knows the non-fabricated nature of the dharma-dhƒÅtu when it is afflicted and purified.üîΩNow, in order to show the non-erroneous understanding of non-fear and non-arrogance,

original: da ni mi skrag pa dang ma khengs pa la phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mi skrag pa dang ma khengs pa la phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: chos rnams dang ni gang zag gi / kun nas nyon mongs rnam dag med //
analyzed: chos rnams dang ni gang zag gi / kun nas nyon mongs rnam dag med //
translated: There is no affliction and purification of phenomena and persons.

original: ces rgya cher gsungs so //üîΩgang zag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa med /
analyzed: ces rgya cher gsungs so // gang zag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa med /
translated: Thus it is extensively taught.üîΩThere is no person,

original: rnam par dag pa med /üîΩchos kyang med de /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa med / chos kyang med de /
translated: no defilement, and no purification.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par dag pa zhes bya bar bsnyegs so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par dag pa zhes bya bar bsnyegs so //
translated: The defilement and purification of phenomena are also not apprehended.

original: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
translated: Here, the reason is stated:

original: 'di ltar gang zag med cing chos med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zag med cing chos med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause there is no person and no phenomena.‚Äù

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba gnyis kyi dus na /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba gnyis kyi dus na /
translated: At the time of defilement and purification,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba ma gtogs par gang zhig yod na ni /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba ma gtogs par gang zhig yod na ni /
translated: apart from defilement and purification, what else could there be?

original: de'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'am rnam par byang bar yongs su brtag tu rung ste /
analyzed: de'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'am rnam par byang bar yongs su brtag tu rung ste /
translated: It is possible to impute the defilement or purification of that,

original: de tha dad pas 'grib pa dang 'phel bar yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: de tha dad pas 'grib pa dang 'phel bar yang 'gyur na /
translated: and its decrease or increase would occur due to that difference.

original: de lta bu'i gang zag ni med de /
analyzed: de lta bu'i gang zag ni med de /
translated: But such a person does not exist,

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not an object of direct perception or inference.

original: dngos po gcig la du mar yongs su rtog pa 'jug pa'i phyir kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po gcig la du mar yongs su rtog pa 'jug pa'i phyir kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Since many are imagined in one thing, the imagined nature of phenomena also does not exist.

original: gcig ni du ma'i bdag nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gcig ni du ma'i bdag nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: One is not suitable as the nature of many.

original: de bas na gang zag dang chos gnyis mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du med pas na /
analyzed: de bas na gang zag dang chos gnyis mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du med pas na /
translated: Therefore, since both persons and phenomena do not exist like the son of a barren woman,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med do //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med do //
translated: there is no affliction and no purification.

original: dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gzhan gyi @300b dbang la ni /
analyzed: dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gzhan gyi @300b dbang la ni /
translated: The other dependent that is the domain of pure mundane wisdom

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar mi 'dod do //
translated: is not asserted to be either afflicted or purified.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: brjod du med pa dang gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod du med pa dang gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is inexpressible and has the nature of nonduality.

original: gal te gzhan gyi dbang gi yang ma yin par 'dod na go de dag gi yin te /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi dbang gi yang ma yin par 'dod na go de dag gi yin te /
translated: If it is asserted that it is not even the dependent, then it is that of those two.

original: de med na kun nas nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / rnam par byang ba thob par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de med na kun nas nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / rnam par byang ba thob par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it did not exist, then the effort to abandon the defilement and to obtain purification would be pointless.

original: chos kyi dbyings kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par dag par 'gyur bas nyes pa 'di med do /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par dag par 'gyur bas nyes pa 'di med do /
translated: This fault does not exist, because the dharmadhatu is purified and defiled.

original: chos kyi dbyings de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid la de dag rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid la de dag rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: They are established in the dharmadhatu itself, which is not itself either.

original: chos kyi dbyings la de gnyi ga la yang glo bur yin la chos kyi dbyings kyang nam mkha' bzhin du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la de gnyi ga la yang glo bur yin la chos kyi dbyings kyang nam mkha' bzhin du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Both of them are adventitious to the dharmadhatu, and the dharmadhatu is like space, without change.

original: de'i phyir / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs la su'i 'grib pa yang med la /
analyzed: de'i phyir / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs la su'i 'grib pa yang med la /
translated: Therefore, there is no decrease in the side of defilement,

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la su'i khyad par du 'gyur ba yang med na /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la su'i khyad par du 'gyur ba yang med na /
translated: and there is no increase in the side of purification.

original: gang gi phyir skrag pa'am nga rgyal du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skrag pa'am nga rgyal du 'gyur te /
translated: So, why be afraid or proud?

original: 'di ni skrag pa med pa dang khengs pa med pa la phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni skrag pa med pa dang khengs pa med pa la phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: This is the non-erroneous understanding of fearlessness and lack of pride.

original: gzhan dag na re kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs la yang su'i 'grib pa yang med la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs la yang su'i 'grib pa yang med la /
translated: Others say: There is no decrease in the side of defilement,

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la yang su'i khyad par du 'gyur ba yang med de /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la yang su'i khyad par du 'gyur ba yang med de /
translated: and there is no increase in the side of purification,

original: de gnyi ga dang ldan pa su yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyi ga dang ldan pa su yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because no one possesses both.

original: gang gi phyir de dag ni de lta ma yin pas de la nga'i 'di med do zhes skrag par 'gyur du'ang ci yod /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag ni de lta ma yin pas de la nga'i 'di med do zhes skrag par 'gyur du'ang ci yod /
translated: Since they are not like that, why be afraid, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is not mine‚Äù?

original: nga'i khyad par ni 'di yin no zhes nga rgyal du 'gyur du yang ci yod ces zer ro //
analyzed: nga'i khyad par ni 'di yin no zhes nga rgyal du 'gyur du yang ci yod ces zer ro //
translated: Why be proud, thinking, ‚ÄúThis distinction is mine‚Äù?

original: gzhan dag ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Others think:

original: gang zag ni med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang zag ni med pa nyid do //
translated: The person does not exist.

original: gang gnas 'di gnyis myong ba dang 'di gnyis gang la brtag pa'i chos de yang med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gnas 'di gnyis myong ba dang 'di gnyis gang la brtag pa'i chos de yang med pa nyid do //
translated: The phenomenon that experiences these two states and is investigated in regard to them does not exist.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba 'di dag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid du zad do snyam mo //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba 'di dag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid du zad do snyam mo //
translated: These defilements and purifications are merely dependent origination.

original: 'di yang kun rdzob tu'o don dam par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang kun rdzob tu'o don dam par ni ma yin te /
translated: This is also in terms of the conventional, not the ultimate,

original: de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the latter is non-conceptual.

original: phyin ci ma log pa 'dis chos kyi dbyings zad pa dang 'phel ba med pa'i phyir 'gyur ba med par rab tu rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa 'dis chos kyi dbyings zad pa dang 'phel ba med pa'i phyir 'gyur ba med par rab tu rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this non-erroneous, one realizes the non-changing of the dharma-dhƒÅtu, because it is neither exhausted nor increased.

original: gzhan na re phyin ci ma log pa 'dis sgrib pa thams cad / spangs te /
analyzed: gzhan na re phyin ci ma log pa 'dis sgrib pa thams cad / spangs te /
translated: Others say: By this non-erroneous, one abandons all obscurations

original: sgrib pa dang bral ba'i nges par 'byung ngo zhe'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa dang bral ba'i nges par 'byung ngo zhe'o //
translated: and attains emancipation free from obscurations.

original: yang na kun rdzob kyi bdag nyid phyin ci ma log pa 'di bcus /üîΩdon dam pa'i phyir ci ma log pa 'di bstan te /
analyzed: yang na kun rdzob kyi bdag nyid phyin ci ma log pa 'di bcus / don dam pa'i phyir ci ma log pa 'di bstan te /
translated: Or, by these ten non-erroneous conventional natures,üîΩthis non-erroneous ultimate is taught,

original: gzhan du ni bstan pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni bstan pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable to teach the ultimate in any other way.

original: gzhan na re @301a * //
analyzed: gzhan na re @301a * //
translated: Others say:

original: gang dag yi ge dang / don dang / yid la byed pa dang / mi 'phro ba dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / ma dag pa dang / dag pa dang / glo bur dang / mi skrag pa dang /
analyzed: gang dag yi ge dang / don dang / yid la byed pa dang / mi 'phro ba dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / ma dag pa dang / dag pa dang / glo bur dang / mi skrag pa dang /
translated: The ten non-erroneous ultimate natures are the non-erroneous with regard to syllables, meaning, mental activity, non-diffusion, specific characteristics, general characteristics, impurity, purity, adventitiousness, fearlessness, and the non-erroneous ultimate.

original: khengs pa med pa la phyin ci ma log pa de dag ngo bo nyid gsum gyi dbang du byas pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: khengs pa med pa la phyin ci ma log pa de dag ngo bo nyid gsum gyi dbang du byas pa'o zhe'o //
translated: The absence of error in the three kinds of absence of pride is in terms of the three realities.

original: de la yi ge dang don la phyin ci ma log pa ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: de la yi ge dang don la phyin ci ma log pa ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The absence of error in the letter and the meaning is in terms of the imagined reality,

original: 'brel pa dang gnyis su ltung ba'i don ni brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa dang gnyis su ltung ba'i don ni brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning of the two falls into the imagined.

original: de kho na'i yul ma yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: de kho na'i yul ma yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even though it is not the domain of reality,

original: de bzhin du phyin ci ma log pa de bzhin nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyin ci ma log pa de bzhin nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: it is so because of the absence of error in reality.

original: de gnyis phyin ci ma log pa nyid do //
analyzed: de gnyis phyin ci ma log pa nyid do //
translated: These two are the absence of error.

original: yid la byed pa la phyin ci ma log pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa la phyin ci ma log pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The absence of error in mental attention is in terms of the relative reality,

original: rtog pa dang yid la byed pa gnyis rang bzhin gyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang yid la byed pa gnyis rang bzhin gyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the two, imagination and mental attention, are by nature the store consciousness.

original: mi 'phro ba la phyin ci ma log pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'phro ba la phyin ci ma log pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The absence of error in non-dispersal is in terms of the perfect reality.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni /
translated: Nonconceptual gnosis.üîΩüîΩ

original: yod pa dang med pa la g-yeng ba dang bral ba'i phyir dang / phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pas yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa la g-yeng ba dang bral ba'i phyir dang / phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pas yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nonconceptual intuition is included in the perfected nature because it is free from the distraction of existence and nonexistence and because it is perfected without error.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la phyin ci ma log pa ni chos kyi dbyings nyid la ste /
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la phyin ci ma log pa ni chos kyi dbyings nyid la ste /
translated: Non-error regarding the general and particular characteristics is in the reality realm itself,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yul las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yul las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because its nature is beyond the domain of conceptual discrimination.

original: ma dag pa dang dag pa la phyin ci ma log pa ni chos kyi dbyings nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag la'o //
analyzed: ma dag pa dang dag pa la phyin ci ma log pa ni chos kyi dbyings nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag la'o //
translated: Non-error regarding the impure and the pure is in the distinction of the states of the reality realm itself.

original: glo bur la phyin ci ma log pa ni chos kyi dbyings nyid la ste /
analyzed: glo bur la phyin ci ma log pa ni chos kyi dbyings nyid la ste /
translated: Non-error regarding the adventitious is in the reality realm itself,

original: nam mkha' bzhin du rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa de la /
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa de la /
translated: because, like space, it is pure by nature.

original: sems kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba 'di gnyis ni glo bur yin par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sems kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba 'di gnyis ni glo bur yin par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: In that, the mind‚Äôs defilement and purification are both established as adventitious.

original: mi skrag pa dang khengs pa med pa la phyin ci ma log pa ni chos kyi dbyings nyid la ste /
analyzed: mi skrag pa dang khengs pa med pa la phyin ci ma log pa ni chos kyi dbyings nyid la ste /
translated: Non-error in non-fear and non-arrogance is in the realm of the Dharma itself.

original: de nam mkha' bzhin du bcos ma ma yin pa'i phyir 'bri ba dang khyad par du gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nam mkha' bzhin du bcos ma ma yin pa'i phyir 'bri ba dang khyad par du gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is unfabricated like space, it is neither diminished nor exalted.

original: de ltar phyin ci ma log pa bcu po 'di dag ngo bo nyid gsum du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyin ci ma log pa bcu po 'di dag ngo bo nyid gsum du rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, these ten non-errors should be understood in terms of the three natures.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i phyin ci ma log pa bcu po 'di dag ni mdo sde las gsungs pa'i rdo rje'i tshig bcu dag dang go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i phyin ci ma log pa bcu po 'di dag ni mdo sde las gsungs pa'i rdo rje'i tshig bcu dag dang go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: These ten non-errors just explained should be applied in order to the ten vajra statements found in the sutra.

original: rdo rje'i tshig bcu po gang zhe na /
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshig bcu po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten vajra statements?

original: yod pa dang med pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang / gnas dang / sgyu ma lta bu nyid dang / @301b rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang / gnas dang / sgyu ma lta bu nyid dang / @301b rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: Existence and non-existence, non-error, basis, illusoriness, non-conceptuality, natural luminosity, affliction,

original: rnam par byang ba dang / nam mkha' lta bu dang / 'grib pa med pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba dang / nam mkha' lta bu dang / 'grib pa med pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa med pa'o //
translated: and non-exalted.

original: de la phyin ci log thams cad 'joms pa dang / de dag gis mi choms pa'i phyir rdo rje dang 'dra bas na rdo rje zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la phyin ci log thams cad 'joms pa dang / de dag gis mi choms pa'i phyir rdo rje dang 'dra bas na rdo rje zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is like a diamond because it destroys all errors and is not destroyed by them.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: It is the non-erroneous knowledge just explained.

original: rdo rje de ni 'di dag gis rtogs par byed /
analyzed: rdo rje de ni 'di dag gis rtogs par byed /
translated: This diamond is realized by these,üîΩand is comprehended by them.

original: khong du chud par byed pas rdo rje'i tshig rnams te /
analyzed: khong du chud par byed pas rdo rje'i tshig rnams te /
translated: Therefore, they are diamond words.

original: rdo rje'i rnam par bshad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rnam par bshad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúdiamond explanation‚Äù is the same.

original: ji ste na yang yi ge dang don dang yid la sogs pa nyid la tshig ces bya ba'i sgrar brjod de /
analyzed: ji ste na yang yi ge dang don dang yid la sogs pa nyid la tshig ces bya ba'i sgrar brjod de /
translated: Or else, the words are said to be the letters, meanings, and ideas, etc.

original: de'i phyir rdo rje'i tshig rnams te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rdo rje'i tshig rnams te /
translated: Therefore, they are diamond words.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúdiamond reference‚Äù is the same.

analyzed: dper na sgyu ma byas pa lta bu ni med kyang dmigs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ste /

original: de ni gang la sems med pa dang / yid med pa dang / rnam par shes pa med pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa 'byung ba med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //

original: yang na yul gang la zag pa dang bcas pa'i bag chags bsags pa'i bdag nyid kyi sems mi 'jug pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems pa med pa dang / rlom sems kyi rnam pa'i yid med pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa med pa 'di ni dbu ma'i lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na yul gang la zag pa dang bcas pa'i bag chags bsags pa'i bdag nyid kyi sems mi 'jug pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems pa med pa dang / rlom sems kyi rnam pa'i yid med pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa med pa 'di ni dbu ma'i lam zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, where the mind, i.e., the store consciousness, does not occur in the nature of the accumulation of the propensities of the dharmas with and without impurity, where there is no mental organ, i.e., no manas, which is characterized by the absence of formative influence, and where there is no consciousness, i.e., no conceptual differentiation in the aspect of conceit, this is called the middle way.

original: de la sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de la sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad kyi bag chags bsags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad kyi bag chags bsags pa'i phyir ro //

original: sems pa ni yid kyi las te /
analyzed: sems pa ni yid kyi las te /

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnams la sems 'jug par byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnams la sems 'jug par byed pa'i las can no //

original: yid ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do //
analyzed: yid ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do //

original: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go //

original: mi dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni /

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas la sogs pa bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas la sogs pa bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is also the teaching of the virtuous and nonvirtuous dharmas, the reprehensible and irreproachable, the mundane and supramundane, the contaminated and uncontaminated, the conditioned and unconditioned, and so on.

original: de la dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos ji @306b ltar snang ba dang brjod pa de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar lta ba ni /
analyzed: de la dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos ji @306b ltar snang ba dang brjod pa de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar lta ba ni /
translated: The view of the afflicted and the purified is just as the virtuous and nonvirtuous dharmas appear and are described.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtha' dang / gnyen po'i mtha'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtha' dang / gnyen po'i mtha'o //

original: de la mi dge ba ni mi bde ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la mi dge ba ni mi bde ba'i don to //

analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ni nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mi smra ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po gnyis mi brjod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mtha'i gnyen por dbu ma'i lam bstan pa'i phyir /

translated: The extreme of eternalism is the belief that the object of knowledge and the object of expression exist substantially and ultimately, as in the case of the imagination of what is unreal or the dharma-dhƒÅtu.
